Camp Woodwind is a small map in Phasmophobia. It very much resembles Maple Lodge Campsite, but is much more compact in size, bearing only a handful of tents, a couple of bathrooms, and the central campfire. This map unlocks at player level 13. ==Structure== Camp Woodwind is analogous with 6 Tanglewood Drive for number of accessible areas (rooms vs. tents), but only possesses one open area pathway that can be circumnavigated around the main tent. This causes the map to feel almost unnervingly small and the ghost to be roaming very close to the entrance either way. There are four tents, three clustered near the Picnic Area and one near the Bathroom, and a campfire. In addition, there is a shed-like area towards the back, referred to as "Lovers Bench". There is a game of backgammon near the farthest tent and an inaccessible lighted area which leads further into the forest. ===Layout tips=== *The campfire has only one entrance and exit facing the entrance gates; take care not to get stuck trying to quickly run through, or be cornered within it by the ghost during a hunt. *For faster ghosts, looping around the only pathway may not be a suitable option due to its small size. Always prioritize smudging and hiding. *When lit, the campfire does not affect sanity drain but affects temperatures by maintening the Campfire room at even if the ghost is in that room, provided the weather is not Snow. ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== There are 7 "sanctioned" hiding spots on Camp Woodwind: *Campfire, behind multiple barrels next to Games Tent *Campfire, behind multiple cooler boxes next to Blue Tent *Picnic Area, behind cooler boxes next to White Tent *Yellow Tent, behind several sleeping bags on the right section *Kids' Area, two small tents (orange and cyan) *Food Tent, behind a table with multiple cooler boxes on it Depending on difficulty and settings, a portion or all of the hiding spots mentioned may be unavailable, either blocked by props or not present: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 2 *Professional: 4 *Nightmare/Insanity: 5 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overridden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None Camp Woodwind is known for having many unreliable hiding spots, as ghosts frequently roam into some hiding spots, potentially killing players hiding there. These hiding spots are: Cooler boxes next to White Tent, the hiding spot behind the boxes in the Food Tent, and barrels next to the Games Tent. It is advised to hide in the small tents or use the furniture-based hiding spots next to the Blue Tent and/or in the Yellow Tent (if available) as ghosts roam less frequently in there. The Games Tent barrels are especially unreliable as the ghost can see the player through the small gaps between the barrels; if you must hide there, move as far back as possible and press yourself between the Games Tent and the barrel closest to it. Looping is a strategy to consider for this map, as the entire map has one main circular path that will take you around the Blue Tent and across the Lovers Bench. One can also loop the ghost around the campfire but beware, ghosts can easily kill a player inside the campfire circle while they are outside of it. The log between the two doesn't affect the ghost's reach! The picnic tables near the entrance can also be used to loop the ghost. If you crouch at the short ends of them, it will also break line of sight. Another feasible strategy on Camp Woodwind consists of "strafing" the ghost. One such spot is the ring of log seating around the campfire; if the player is agile enough, it is possible to force the ghost to constantly reroute its shortest pathing towards the player by constantly moving back and forth at the opposite side of the ring. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
Bone ribcage woodwind.png|A ribcage in the white tent. Bone pelvis woodwind.png|A pelvis in the red tent.
==Cursed possession locations==
Woodwind Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns leaning on the tree with string lights near the Campfire. Woodwind MusicBox.png|The Music Box spawns in the Yellow Tent. Woodwind Ouija.png|The Ouija Board spawns inside the Games Tent. Woodwind Circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns inside the Food Tent. Woodwind Tarot.png|The Tarot Cards spawn atop a picnic table in the Picnic Area. Woodwind Voodoo.png|The Voodoo Doll spawns out front of the small cyan tent next to the Red Tent. Woodwind MonkeyPaw.png|The Monkey Paw spawns on the left side of the Lovers Bench, next to the two marshmallow sticks.
==Easter eggs== *Slenderman - Like on Maple Lodge Campsite, Slenderman has a chance of spawning on the outskirts of Camp Woodwind. He can be seen in the rocky area with fireflies toward the back of the map, in the crack between the white food tent and the bathroom, or near the truck on its left side. *Toilet Heart - A white heart can be seen on the toilets in the restroom building, which is a reference to the movie 'Saw'. *Several engravings can be found on the wall of the bathroom. These refer to the beta team. ==Trivia== *Camp Woodwind is one of two maps to only have one floor and one fuse box spawn location, the other being Sunny Meadows (Restricted) when using its Male Wing and Female Wing variations. *The map's name possibly came from a world-renowned sleep away summer camp called Camp Woodward that is located in Woodward, Pennsylvania, United States. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.7.0 |Added Camp Woodwind. |}

content: 0.9.2.0 is a minor update released on 13 November 2023. It removes the Halloween event, brings many optimisations and adds Achievements. == Additions == * Added the first wave of Steam Achievements! Check out the Achievements section on Steam to see how to earn them. More achievements will be added in future updates. * Added an option to enable Screen Space Ambient Occlusion for VR == Changes == * Removed Halloween Event * Adjusted the sky effects when you are dead * Reduced translucency on medium tents slightly to stop them from glowing so much when a DOTS is placed inside * Both campfires in Maple Lodge will now have a max hearing range of 5m and are the same volume * The Maple Campsite Chem toilet will now behave similarly to house closets and lockers when hiding * Brightness will now default to 1 for new players instead of 0 == Fixes == * Significant improvements to loading times and performance across the whole game * Max-level players will no longer get stuck on the reward screen * You can now get past the splash screen if you are failing to connect to Steam * You can no longer hide from the ghost’s view behind a lit campfire * The totem pole in Maple Lodge Campsite will now block the ghost's view during hunts * Moved the twigs easter egg in Maple back to where it should be * Removed the invisible walls on top of the small tents * Incense III will now swing again while held * Maple’s Green and White tents now have the correct room names * Moved some camping chairs by Campfire B in Maple to remove a safe spot * Moved the small green tent in Maple’s Campsite B to remove a safe spot * Moved the Maple Campsite’s Ouija Board spawn to the right slightly to stop it from clipping * Moved the Maple music box spawn up slightly to stop it clipping inside of the log * Moved the orange bottle up one shelf to stop it clipping with the Maple Ouija Board spawn * Moved the fingerprint up on the Maple light pole near the Toilet block * Ambient Occlusion will no longer be turned on in VR * Fixed fog several leaks: ** Ridgeview bathroom ** Willow garage, laundry, bathroom and bedroom ** Sunny Meadows entry, courtyard hallway ** Woodwind toilet block ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.2.0

The Challenge Mode is a feature introduced in 0.8.1.0. It allows players to take part in a curated custom difficulty, often based on Professional, with predetermined rules and set of starter items. As players cannot bring their own items, dying in a challenge does not carry any significant monetary risk, encouraging players to experiment with strategies. Regardless of how difficult the challenge is, it always has a base reward multiplier of 1x, equal to Amateur. The main benefit of Challenge Mode is tied to the "Complete Challenge Mode in [map name]" Weekly Task, which awards a substantial $5,000 and 5,000 XP upon successful completion. Challenge Mode can be played on any map, and as many times as desired, but will not award completion of the aforementioned weekly task unless done on the intended map for the given challenge. Note that identifying the ghost is enough to count towards challenge completion, and the player does not need to survive the contract. Challenges specific to Sunny Meadows cannot be completed by playing Sunny Meadows (Restricted), and vice versa. ==Standard Challenges== There are 26 different standard challenges, which rotate each Monday at Midnight UTC. content: Weather is a mechanic intended to enhance gameplay and affect temperatures within the map. ==Mechanics== There are currently eight types of weather. Seven among which one will be randomly chosen per game with equal chance, and an additional eighth type that has a 2% chance to replace the chosen weather. Depending on what weather type is present, players may experience auditory and visual obstructions. Weather is grouped into four groups of temperatures. From warmest to coldest: * Sunrise * Clear, Fog, Blood Moon * Light Rain, Heavy Rain, Windy * Snow This can affect how the player finds the ghost; warmer weather means that the average room temperature where the ghost is will be slightly higher than in colder weather. The effects of weather are suppressed while indoors: noise disruption (save for the occasional roar of thunder) is quieted, and the visual effects of fog and precipitation do not make their way inside. However, weather can play a major part in Camp Woodwind and Maple Lodge Campsite, precisely as these maps are mainly played outside. ==Sunrise== overlooking the lake on Sunrise Weather.]] The sun is rising on the horizon (it does not actually move), casting golden rays onto the map, which may improve illumination in certain areas. The deep blue sky is untainted by clouds. Illumination: High Vision: High Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Clear== with Clear Weather.]] The "standard" weather type, and adds no additional features to gameplay. Surroundings are quite dim, and the sky is almost pitch black. Illumination: Poor Vision: High Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Fog== with Fog Weather.]] The map is covered in a thick mist, obscuring visibility. The fog dissipates inside buildings, but outdoor fog can be a hindrance to seeing with night vision outdoors through a video feed. Illumination: Modest Vision: Poor Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Blood Moon== with Blood Moon Weather.]] This weather provides a red sky and a light rain. The ghost becomes 15% faster during hunts, the passive sanity drain rate is increased by 100%, and the contract payout is increased by 10%. Illumination: Modest Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Light Rain== with Light Rain Weather.]] This weather type adds a modest rainfall, which generates some extra noise. Flames are not affected by the rain. Illumination: Modest Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Heavy Rain== with Heavy Rain Weather.]] The rainfall and thunder causes loud noise, and the map is shrouded by darkness. Non-tier III Igniters and Firelights cannot be lit in the rain. When an igniter or firelight affected by the rain is lit inside and brought outside, it will be extinguished immediately. Players cannot light the Campfire in Maple Lodge Campsite or Camp Woodwind with this weather. The objective 'Get the Ghost to blow out a Candle' can be difficult on these maps if the favourite room is outside and tier III firelights are not available. Illumination: Poor Vision: Modest Noise disruption: High Temperature: ==Windy== with Windy Weather.]] This weather type makes surrounding trees emit loud noise. The wind makes leaves rustle, making it a fairly loud weather type. Clouds overhead drift by quickly, but other than these, this weather type would appear similar to Clear. Illumination: Poor Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Snow== with Snow Weather.|alt=|thumb]] Frequent snowflakes will fall from the sky, though snow will not accumulate on the ground. A light mist lingers around the map. The low ambient temperature will cause for freezing breath to appear all throughout the map, potentially masking one of the main tells of the Ghost Room. Illumination: Modest Vision: Modest Noise Disruption: Low Temperature: == Related difficulty settings == * Weather: Set the weather in the location ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !2 February 2020 |Jinns can no longer manipulate the weather. |- !? |Weather is now limited to rain on Tanglewood Street House. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="2" |0.4.0 |Added 6 types of weather. |- |Tanglewood Street House is no longer always raining. |- !0.4.1.0 |Updated the visuals for Heavy Rain. |- !0.5.1.0 |Temporarily removed Fog weather. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.8.0 |Readded Fog weather. |- |Added Sunrise weather. |- !0.11.0 |Added Blood Moon weather. |} Category:Gameplay fr:Météo ru:Погода

Brownstone High School is a map in Phasmophobia. It was the first medium-sized map added to the game, though it is now a large-sized map. Its square shape and general symmetry can make it difficult to navigate, and its long hallways may make perpetual running almost impossible. ==Structure== Brownstone High School has one front and one side yard (separated from each other), about three dozen classrooms, eight bathrooms, a lecture hall, a cafeteria, and a gymnasium complete with two locker rooms. The entire building is approximately 85 by 55 meters. Brownstone High School features five exit doors. Due to the large distance between the closest entrance and the truck, it may be desirable to stage gear close to the building before entering. The rear exit doors lead onto a outdoor yard featuring an exterior basketball court. It is considered a safe zone, therefore preventing passive sanity drain. ===Layout tips=== *All hallways on both floors cannot be chosen as a favourite room, meaning Ghost Orbs do not need to be checked for in these hallways. The Lobby can be chosen as a favourite room, however. *The four Science Classrooms at the back of the building (two downstairs and two upstairs) each consist of two smaller sub-rooms: the classroom with chairs and the science lab with large metal tables. *There are four pairs of bathrooms on the map, with one pair per side per floor: **All male bathrooms are on the left, and all female bathrooms are on the right. **Each pair consists of a student's bathroom (labelled boys/girls) and a teacher's bathroom (labelled male/female). The teacher's bathroom is behind the "regular" bathroom (when looking towards the back). **The bathrooms are additionally labelled "upstairs" or "downstairs" respectively. *Classrooms numbered 20 and above are all located on the 2nd floor. The rest, classrooms 1-19, are downstairs. *The upstairs hallway is divided into three separate rooms by the game. The game calls each of these 6 hallway rooms a "Corridor" (rather than a "Hallway"). *In addition to doors and windows, fingerprints can also appear on bathroom mirrors. *The following rooms count as dim rooms and hence will drain sanity with 80% of the rate, even with all room lights being on: **Lobby, First Floor Main Corridor, First Floor Right Corridor, First Floor Left Corridor, Basketball Court, Lecture Hall, Second Floor Main Corridor, Second Floor Right Corridor, Second Floor Left Corridor. *Classroom 10 has no main room lights and hence no means of sanity drain prevention (other than firelights). ==Tips for surviving hunts== *Because of its many vast, empty rooms, the player should plan an escape route and identify a hiding spot as soon as the ghost is located, and always remain on their toes when investigating, especially if the favourite room is particularly expansive such as the Basketball Court or the Cafeteria. Be ready to run at the first sign of a hunt; using the brief grace period and strategic sprinting can make the difference between life and death. *This map is the only map in the game that has no official hiding spots at all; this means that only unofficial ones are available, which may not be reliable, and breaking line-of-sight to evade a ghost can be quite difficult due to how open the map is. Making sure to have Incense within reach can be very useful when still trying to collect evidence while sanity is nearing or below the hunt threshold, both to escape the ghost if spotted, and to prevent certain death if the ghost wanders into hiding spots. *Due to the very large size of the map, it may not even be necessary to hide if the player is sufficiently far from the ghost. The player can simply sit in a room far away from the ghost, as it would be extremely unlikely for it to wander by chance to the player's location if it has not detected them. **On the other hand, the large size of the map may make noticing the start of a hunt much more difficult. This can be particularly dangerous in hallways, as the player may be taken by surprise by a ghost that started hunting from far away. Communication between players and vigilance is key to avoid bad surprises; keeping exit doors open to hear or see them close and periodically trying to toggle light switches can help players know if a hunt started elsewhere in the building. *While all the lockers found on the map are simply decorative and therefore useless, the bathroom stalls are fair hiding spots during hunts, especially if the ghost does not see you enter the bathroom. *The Library contains several line-of-sight blockers, which can be used for both hiding and cutting off a chasing ghost. *The locker rooms on the left side of the first floor make for good hiding spots, as the lockers segregate the space and allow one to break line-of-sight or move away easier. *Some classrooms have hiding spots, such as in a corner next to some file cabinets, which block line-of-sight with the door. Knowing which ones do and which ones don't can save a player during hunts. Consider keeping open doors to classrooms with hiding spots and keeping closed those without. *The ghost is able to walk through many of the teacher's desks found in the classrooms, rendering them not useful for trying to loop the ghost. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. As Brownstone High School has a very large searchable area, looking for the bone is usually not a worthwhile endeavor; it is best either found incidentally or through use of a Ouija Board. ;Examples Please note that the white bone model is no longer used.
Bone in Brownstone High School, First Floor, Right Side, Library. On the ground. 1.jpg|First Floor, Right Side, Library. On the ground Bone in Brownstone High School, Second Floor, Right Side, Storage Room 2. On the ground at the foot of a shelf. 3.jpg|Second Floor, Right Side, Storage Room 2. On the ground at the foot of a shelf Bone brownstone classroom.png|A bone in a second floor classroom
== Cursed possession locations == All cursed possessions spawn in the Lobby or in the immediate vicinity in the hallway. File:School-Doll.png|The Voodoo Doll spawn on a bench in the end of the Lobby. File:School-Circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the end of the Lobby. File:School-Board.png|The Ouija Board spawns behind the left column in the Lobby. File:School-Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns behind the right column in the Lobby. File:School-Cards.png|The Tarot Cards spawn on a bench along the left wall of the Lobby. File:School-Music.png|The Music Box spawn on a bench along the right wall of the Lobby. Monkeypaw brownstone.jpg|The Monkey Paw spawns on a box in front of the right column in the Lobby. == Trivia == * Despite being larger than Sunny Meadows Mental Institution—the other Large map—in terms of playable area, Brownstone High School was classified as a Medium map until 0.9.0. ** This makes it the first map to have changed size class between versions of the game. * The "Second Floor Main Corridor" is one of the largest rooms in the map, competing with "Basketball Court". Both rooms individually are also among the largest rooms in the game. * The assets used for this map can be found here. * There is a phone in every classroom that the ghost can ring as an interaction. 13 Willow Street (or simply Willow) is a map in Phasmophobia. It is a small, single-story home with two bedrooms and one bathroom, as well as a small garage and a basement. It is one of the smallest maps in the game, being only slightly larger than 6 Tanglewood Drive, but feels almost tiny due to its spacious open rooms, a sharp contrast to the generally congested environments of the other suburban homes. Willow can often make for a swift investigation due to its small size, but the lack of lockers, closets, and easily-accessible side rooms to hide in makes it relatively dangerous during a hunt. As such, players will have to learn the ins and outs of hiding behind furniture in order to survive. ==Structure== Willow consists of two bedrooms, one bathroom, a garage, and a large basement, among other rooms. See Third-party tools for a list of detailed map viewers that players may use. ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== Willow does not contain any closets or lockers, but 8 organic hiding spots are available: *Living Room, behind stacked storage crates in corner next to fireplace *Garage, behind shelf in laundry area *Garage, behind stacked storage crates along far wall *Garage, behind upright plywood in corner (when covered from side and front) *Boys Bedroom, behind stacked storage crates in back corner next to white wardrobe *Master Bedroom, behind black wardrobe (only when chair is next to it and facing the opposite corner) *Basement Hallway, behind trash cans at far end *Right Storage Room, behind blue tool cart Depending on the difficulty, some of these hiding spots may be blocked by the presence of bulky items or have their concealing elements removed: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 3 *Professional: 5 *Nightmare/Insanity: 7 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overriden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None Several more unofficial furniture-based hiding spots are available. While they are more risky, they will never be blocked unlike official hiding spots, and can still provide decent hiding in most cases. Examples include: *Master Bedroom, behind the desk *Living Room, right against the bookshelf. While a decent replacement for the official hiding spot by the fireplace, it remains a risky option if the ghost wanders into the living room. Looping the ghost may be performed around the pickup in the garage, the kitchen island or around the two shelves in the Right Storage Room. The living room couch can also be used loop partially to move towards the kitchen if needed. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
Bone willow hallway.png|A long bone in the Hallway. Bone willow basementhallway.png|A spine bone in the Basement Hallway.
==Cursed possession locations== File:Willow-Ouija.png|The Ouija Board spawns on top of the washing machine/dryer in the Garage. File:Willow-Cards.png|The Tarot Cards spawn on the end table next to the couch in the Living Room. File:Willow-Voodoo.png|The Voodoo Doll spawns in the cabinet in the Boys Bedroom. File:Willow-MusicBox.png|The Music Box spawns on the table beside the entrance in the Living Room. File:Willow-Circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the Basement Hallway. File:Willow-Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns in the corner of the utility section of the Garage. Monkeypaw willow.jpg|The Monkey Paw spawns in a cabinet in the Hallway. ==Trivia== *In the kitchen, a set of food bowls, a scratch post as well as a bag of catnip with the name "Kong" written on it can be found. These props are dedicated to cjdxn's cat, which passed away before the release of 0.7.0. A photo of the cat can be found on the table next to the front door. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.29.0/0.29.6 |Added Willow Street House. |- !0.7.0 |Renamed Willow Street House to 13 Willow Street. |}

Asylum was the first large map to be added in the game. Its labyrinthine architecture, paired with its endless hallways and corridors, made for an intimidating venture, and even the most experienced paranormal investigator may find themselves getting lost. This map was replaced with Sunny Meadows Mental Institution. == Structure == The Asylum had 119 labeled rooms, the most on any map, while subdividing these into smaller, individual rooms would result in over 200 rooms. A large proportion of these are bedrooms, with other rooms such as a dentist room, conference rooms, canteens, barbers, storages, and more. This map's weather was always set to Clear Skies. === Layout tips === *All bedrooms are labeled starting with "Size Bedroom #", where Size is "Two", "Four" or "Six" and represents the number of beds in that bedroom, while # identifies the specific bedroom (e.g., the second four-bed room would be called Four Bedroom 2). Only the left/right wings of the first floor have bedrooms. The bedrooms fully occupy both outer rows of each wing (one row on the same side as the truck and the other on the opposite side). **"Two Bedroom #" rooms are the smallest bedrooms nearest to the middle of the building. Each of the 4 rows of bedrooms has a room called "Two Bedroom #". **"Four Bedroom ##" rooms are all on the same side of the map as the truck (at the bottom of the wings in the site map diagram). **"Six Bedroom ##" rooms are all on the opposite side of the map as the truck (at the top of the wings in the site map diagram). **There are no rooms in the map whose names begin with "One", "Three", or "Five". *The 4 rooms named "Day Room #" are all found on the first floor. *Because the map used to be rotated 180 degrees, all rooms with "Right" and "Left" labels are currently oppositely labeled. * All hallways and stairways cannot be chosen as a ghost room, meaning that players do not have to check for Ghost Orbs in these rooms. The rooms named Telephones and Lobby can still be ghost rooms. See Third-party tools for a list of detailed map viewers that players may use. === Key hiding spots and strategies === There are 2 sets of lockers in Asylum. These are always free to hide in, even on Nightmare difficulty. Players usually hide behind furniture or in rooms due to the lack of lockers. Alternatively, you can also hide in the bathroom stalls or in storage as a last resort. Due to Asylum being a large map, it is likely for ghosts to hunt from relatively far away in regards to the player's location, so the two would rarely meet before the actual ghost room is found (during multiplayer, these odds are increased by the number of players). However, it also makes the hunt much more dangerous when you have a ghost on your tail: due to large straight hallways, most ghosts can eventually gain on players, so getting cornered by a ghost becomes more likely. Ghosts such as the Yokai therefore are both harder to find and easy to escape from, but are still very dangerous in the open. Be wary of the ghost's general location when scouting for other objectives (like the Bone Evidence) or even just traversing the map in general, as telling that a hunt has started is much harder while the map's layout requires a different hiding strategy. == Bone locations ==
Please note that the white bone model is no longer used.
Bones generally spawn randomly, though there is a slight bias for them to spawn closer to the middle of a room. Due to the large size of the Asylum map, it is usually best left to chance for players to find a bone or to make use of the Ouija Board, instead of attempting to search every room for it. ;Examples File:BoneAsylum1.jpg|Basement Floor, Lounge 2, Left side of left corridor, three rooms down. Bone in Asylum, First Floor, Back Right Side, Six Bedroom 6. From afar. 3.jpg|A bone in one of the bedrooms. Bone in Asylum, Top Floor, Right Corridor, Toilet 10. On the ground. 1.jpg|Top Floor, Right Corridor, Toilet 10. On the ground. Bone asylum staircase.png|A ribcage midway on a staircase. == Cursed possession locations == All cursed possessions would spawn in the Lobby. == Easter eggs == *In 0.6.0, several scribbles that could be revealed using a UV Flashlight or glowstick were added in Six Bedroom 7, including tally marks counting up to 1080 and messages teasing the then-upcoming Sunny Meadows Mental Institution.
I have to leave
Somewhere new

To get better, I hope

Sounds nice, a place to heal

The Banshee is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. Banshees are noted for their distinctive screeches that they produce on the Parabolic Microphone or the Sound Recorder, as well as their targeting of only one specific player during hunts. ==Behaviour== ===Activity=== The Banshee has a higher chance of performing singing ghost events over other types. If the hunt target is the target of a singing event and causes the Banshee to disappear prematurely (by going near it), then their sanity will decrease by 15%, instead of the usual 10%. *Like other ghosts, who the Banshee targets for a ghost event is random and based on distance; being the hunt target by itself does not increase their chance of being the ghost event target. When in a D.O.T.S. state, the Banshee will try to move towards its hunt target instead of the nearest player. Contrary to most other ghosts, the Banshee is able to perform long roams while its current room is not the favourite room. ===Abilities=== When the Banshee performs a roam outside of hunts, if the hunt target is inside the investigation area, it has a 2/3 (67%) chance of triggering its ability which makes it perform a long roam to the target. Unlike the Wraith's and the Phantom's abilities, this will not create any EMF reading. The ability fails if the ghost and the hunt target are on different floors except if: *The map is Point Hope, *The Banshee was in a single-room basement or a single-room attic for all other maps. When a Parabolic Microphone or a Sound Recorder is used, the Banshee has a 33% chance of making 1 of its 20 unique screams instead of a regular paranormal sound. {| class="fandom-table" !Banshee screams |- | |} ===Hunt=== At the start of the game a player is randomly selected as the hunt target. If the hunt target leaves the game or dies, a new hunt target will be selected. The new target is not random: the Banshee will select the first alive player in the list (established by the order the players joined the lobby) that is not the previous target, unless there is only one player remaining. The Banshee's hunt threshold is 50%, but it only checks the target's sanity when trying to hunt, rather than the average sanity like other ghost types, meaning that only the target needs to be at or below 50% sanity for it to attempt to hunt. As a result, the Banshee can appear to start hunting from as high as 87% average sanity, or as low as 12% average sanity, on the Sanity Monitor, depending on the target's current sanity and number of other players. When a Banshee hunts, it will mostly follow standard hunt rules, but it is unable to detect, and will ignore all players other than its hunt target. It will not attempt to chase other players and is unable to kill them, even if it comes into direct contact with a non-target player, instead passing through them. The Banshee will react to Incense lit by other players within range, but this will not allow for completion of the "Repel a ghost while it is chasing someone" optional objective unless the Banshee is also chasing its target when this occurs. If the hunt target is outside the building, the Banshee will still use its target's sanity to decide whether to hunt. However, if it does hunt, it will hunt like any other ghost, chasing any opportune player. ===Miscellaneous=== The Banshee can only be a female ghost and will use a female ghost model. ==Evidence== ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Banshees will weaken their target before striking. Weakness: Banshees can sometimes be heard screaming with a parabolic microphone. ==Strategies== At the beginning of a contract, the Banshee can already be excluded if the ghost presents a masculine name. Identifying the target player of a Banshee both conclusively identifies it and can provide players with a significant edge, such as making hunt-related objectives much easier, and enabling the other players to continue investigating during hunts with impunity, though it is important to note that the target player must be inside the investigation area for this to be applicable. Alternatively, the target player can altogether prevent hunts indefinitely by topping up their sanity with Sanity Medication and staying outside the investigation area to never drop below the hunt threshold, for a completely safe investigation. There are several methods players may use to identify a Banshee's target: *Banshees will only check for the individual sanity level of the target player when attempting to hunt. If the ghost hunts above the average sanity of 50%, and one or more players are below 50% sanity, then one of them is the target. Likewise, if the ghost refrains from hunting at below 50% average sanity, but one player has high sanity, they can be presumed to be the Banshee's target; be mindful of mistaking it with ghosts that have different hunt sanity thresholds such as Demons or Shades. *Having players act as "bait" with Incense and/or escape routes ready can definitively identify the target. Bait players should stand in plain sight and attempt to actively attract the ghost, such as talking into the microphone/holding active electronics or letting the ghost spot them; if the ghost ignores them, have another player repeat the process then proceed by elimination until the target is found. Alternatively, if the ghost is already confirmed to be a Banshee, multiple players can do this at the same time, standing separate from each-other and seeing which of them the Banshee rushes for. This method, though more risky, is useful either when the sanity-based method proves inconclusive, or when playing on Nightmare/Insanity difficulty where the Sanity Monitor is not available. Ensure that all players are inside the building when performing this test. **Be aware that the Banshee might coincidentally wander towards a player after it has lost sight of its target, especially in hallways or cluttered rooms, giving the impression that it is chasing that player. In that case, observe its line of sight acceleration or attempt to move out of its way to see if the ghost is actively following you. *Banshees tend to wander towards their target outside of hunts; a player reporting frequent activity or even hunts starting near them and far away from the ghost room is most likely the target. Using motion sensors and salt can help to track the ghost's location. Note that if the target player dies or disconnects, a new target will be selected. This also applies on Nightmare/Insanity difficulty or when the "Kills extend hunts" setting is turned on: if the Banshee manages to kill its target, it will immediately select another player and continue hunting. On singleplayer, determining the Banshee by its target ability is impossible, making it much more difficult to identify through behavior alone, so one must rely on other potential tells or pieces of evidence. Using a Parabolic Microphone or a Sound Recorder to pick up its unique sounds might come in handy, though note that the Banshee only has a chance of producing its screams instead of a regular paranormal sound, so it mustn't be ruled out if the ghost doesn't produce any screams. Other singleplayer tells include a lot of singing events, and wandering to the player frequently (note that Phantoms also have this ability; theirs will, however, leave an EMF reading while Banshees will not). If the Sanity Monitor is available, touching the ghost during a singing event and checking for the 15% sanity drop instead of 10% is also a viable method. ==Trivia== *The Banshee is a female spirit in Irish folklore who heralds the death of a family member, usually by wailing or shrieking. A Banshee translates to "woman of the fairy mound" or "fairy woman" in its roots from Ireland. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !7 March 2020 |Banshee footsteps can now be heard by all players instead of just its target. |- !13 March 2020 |Banshee now requires Fingerprints as evidence instead of Bug. |- !25 March 2020 |Removed some sounds that could only be heard by the Banshee's target. |- !3 July 2020 |Banshees now cannot hunt within 5 metres of a crucifix, instead of switching targets when the crucifix is consumed. |- !15 July 2020 |Removed the chance of the Banshee's ability not working on players with high sanity. |- !26 August 2020 |Banshees will no longer hunt if their target is outside the building. |- !26 August 2020
(Part 2) |Increased the crucifix range for the Banshee to 6 metres. |- !25 September 2020 |Banshees will now hunt like most other ghosts if its target is outside. |- !29 September 2020 |Reverted the crucifix range for the Banshee to 5 metres. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Prior to 0.3.0, the evidence was EMF Level 5, Fingerprints, and Freezing Temperatures. |- ! rowspan="3" |0.5.0 |The Banshee's rare ability to hunt at any sanity percentage has been moved to the Demon. |- |The Banshee now create a unique paranormal noise on the Parabolic Microphone.
|- |The Banshee now prefer singing ghost events. |- ! rowspan="5" |0.5.2.0 |Crucifixes no longer have an increased effective range against Banshees. |- |Banshees now occasionally walk towards its target's location when not hunting. |- |Singing ghost events will now deduct an additional 5% sanity for their target player. |- |Whether the Banshee can hunt is now based on its target's sanity. |- |Changed the Banshee's special parabolic microphone scream.
|- !0.10.0 |Improved Banshee AI targeting when they stalk a player. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.13.0 |The Banshee can now change favorite rooms. |- |Added 20 unique screams to the Banshee. |- !0.15.1.0 |Banshee will now only present as female (names and ghost models). |} ==References== ==Notes== ru:Банши fr:Banshee Category:Ghosts

content: The firelight is a piece of equipment in Phasmophobia. It is a deployable light source that can be lit using a source of fire such as an igniter or another firelight. It can be used to continuously light up a room with a warm, orange glow, and mitigate sanity drain from darkness, until it eventually burns out. Ghosts tend to blow out nearby firelights, making them effective at checking if a ghost is nearby. ==Usage== ===Lighting firelights=== Players can light a firelight held in their hand by pressing if they have an igniter in their inventory. A firelight placed down can be lit while holding an igniter and pressing . One can also hold a lit firelight, aim at an unlit firelight, and use the Secondary Use key. An unorthodox way is to have the wick of one lit and one unlit firelight to collide (this may need velocity). ===Placement=== Firelights can be down on surfaces. Holding the placement key will show a translucent highlight of the firelight. This will place the firelight upright relative to the surface. Firelights can topple/fall over when placed on a slope or vertically. ===Function=== When a player is within 2 metres of a lit firelight, it will slow passive sanity drain that results from being in the dark, at a rate depending on the firelight's tier level. Lit firelights do not affect sanity drain from other sources such as ghost events or other players dying. Ghosts can blow out firelights at any time, even during hunts, and this will create an EMF 2 reading (or EMF Level 5). When blown out, the firelight will be extinguished with a blowing "sigh" effect. A firelight will also extinguish by itself at the end of its duration which depends on its tier level. Tier I and Tier II firelights will produce smoke when blown out by the ghost or self-extinguishing. Contrary to fire sources, however, ghosts cannot light firelights up. Like with fire sources, when a firelight is lit up for the first time, there will be a 30-second cooldown before the ghost can attempt to blow it out. After the end of that cooldown or on subsequent lightings, a new cooldown is set with a random duration between 20 and 80 seconds. The Onryo can bypass these cooldowns due to its hunt prevention mechanics. *Note that Tier III firelights will pause the current cooldown if they are turned off by the player or an Onryo's hunt attempt. Ghosts have a 66.67% (2/3) chance to blow out a lit firelight provided they are within 5 meters and the cooldown is over. *Tier II firelights are more likely to be blown out due to them having three candles, each rolling the same 66.67% chance and if one of the three chances is successful, all three candles are blown out, roughly making it a 96.30% chance overall. Despite being multiple candles, the tier II firelight still counts as one flame for the Onryo. a lit firelight/one falling with sufficient velocity (Tiers I and II only), placing it in the inventory, leaving it out in heavy rain (Tiers I and II only), or pressing while held in hand will cause it to extinguish. ==Tips== *Placing firelights on the sides of tables, shelves, or other elevated objects may improve their lighting by covering a wider area. *In larger maps like Brownstone High School or Sunny Meadows Mental Institution, firelights may be helpful as navigation markers for important areas such as the fuse box, ghost room, or exit door(s), also providing some helpful sanity drain reduction as a bonus, though they are not as reliable as spare UV lights or flashlights, as firelights both burn out after a time (except for tier III) and can be blown out by the ghost. *As non-electronics, firelights are less affected by hunts (other than potentially being blown out), neither do they attract the ghost. Players may use firelights as constant light sources to navigate during hunts. A potential but generally trivial downside is that it removes a source of alert as to whether the ghost is hunting (or performing ghost events). ==Objectives== {| class="article-table" ! Objective ! Actual requirements |- | Get the Ghost to blow out a Firelight | - |} ==Trivia== *Showers and sinks filled with water do not extinguish firelights. ==History == {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !31 January 2020 |Increased the duration that candles stay lit. |- !23 March 2020 |Candles can now be used to light other candles or Smudge Sticks. |- !7 July 2020 |Increased the candle lighting range, allowing it to prevent passive sanity drain when held. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !23 September 2020 |Candles can now be lit via the Secondary Use key if a lighter is also in the player's inventory. |- !0.3.0 |Updated the candle model. |- !0.4.0 |Candles will now extinguish when thrown or left out in the open in heavy rain. |- !0.7.0 |Candles now extinguish when swapped into the inventory. |- ! rowspan="4" |0.9.0 |Candles were renamed to firelights. |- |The Firelight now has 3 tiers. |- |Light from firelights no longer fully block sanity drain, and instead reduce the rate of it depending on equipment tier. |- |Candles found inside contracts can still be lit, but are no longer grabbable and do not provide any sanity-altering effects. |- ! rowspan="2"|0.10.0 |Increased the light intensity and range for tier I and tier II. |- |Increased the duration for tier I and tier II to 5 minutes and 10 minutes, respectively. |} ==See also == *Summoning Circle ==References== Category:Equipment fr:Lumière à feu ru:Светильник
title: Firelight

content: 0.9.0.6 is a minor patch released on 24 August 2023. It primarily fixes bugs. ==Changes== * Interact and Primary Use controls have now been swapped for gamepad to allow for easier gameplay * EMF reader T2 is now 2m range as stated in the shop description ==Fixes== * Photo cameras are no longer taking photos in portrait mode (regression since 0.9.0.4) * Dead body photos now work after the ragdoll animation has completed * Three star ghost photos are now easier to take * Haunted Mirror can now have its photo taken whilst upside down * The ghost will no longer have a high chance to fail to show DOTS if there is a room above you or the ghost * When looking through the room divider in the downstairs Grafton bedroom, objects will no longer disappear * You can no longer put the glowstick into your inventory during the “shake” animation * Firelight T3 is no longer labelled consumable in the Shop ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.0.6 ru:0.9.0.6

|265x265px]] Hiding Spots are features within a Map that allow players to survive hunts. ==Mechanics== ===Availability=== The number of available hiding spots depends on the difficulty as well as the number of players: *Amateur: All spots available *Intermediate: At least 3 spots available *Professional: At least 2 spots available *Nightmare/Insanity: At least 1 spot available *3 players: +1 spot available *4 players: +2 spots available For example, a Professional game with 3 players will have at least 3 hiding spots available throughout the entire map. By using a custom difficulty, hiding spots can also be turned off entirely, overriding all other rules. When a spot is unavailable, it can be blocked off with "junk"/storage equipment, be sealed behind a locked door, or have its concealing elements removed. The unavailable spots are randomly chosen at the beginning of each investigation. ===List of hiding spots=== A full list of hiding spots is available on each map's own page. See Map § List of maps. ==Tips== ]] * The ghost cannot open a closet/locker door that is currently being held by a player; Ideally, using this method, the ghost can only open one of the closet doors. Both doors can be held, in multiplayer. ** When hiding in a closet with one door fully open, you must hug the door you are holding to have better chances at survival. ** However, if the ghost detected the player inside or near a closet/locker, the ghost will forcibly open the doors, overriding the player holding the door shut. * Players are not forced to use "official" hiding spots. Some players may improvise and use furniture such as kitchen tables/islands to hide. As a general rule of thumb, if an object covers the player to at least their eye level, it can (but may not) work as a viable hiding spot. Category:Map Features fr:Cachettes
title: Hiding Spots

content: 0.9.1.0, also known as the Halloween Event update, is a minor update released on 26 October 2023. Past the titular event, it features a rework of Maple Lodge Campsite, as well as some assorted fixes and changes. == Halloween == * Halloween Event 2023 has been added, instructions can be found in-game on how to receive this year's spooky ID-card badge and trophy! The event will last around 2 weeks! * Maple and Prison are temporarily unlocked at level 1 to allow new players to complete the event == Additions and Changes == * Maple Lodge Campsite has had a complete layout revamp, featuring a new reception building, two separate campsite areas, new assets and areas, more hiding spots and greatly improved performance * Added new rain sounds in both campsites when inside tents, inside the toilet block or under draped tarp * Added Temporal Anti-Aliasing option in the journal (Provides a higher quality AA method than FXAA and SMAA, but lower quality than MSAA) * The EULA has been updated (2.2, 7.1, 7.2 and 10.4) * Several icons have been replaced across the main menu and contract selection screens * You can no longer light objects using 'Interact' (default: Mouse 1) * To help with performance in the truck, the CCTV monitor will now only turn on when you are standing nearby, and it will now display a screensaver when disabled == Fixes == * The Monkey Paw now has the correct textures again * You can now take a photo of the haunted mirror on Ridgeview, whilst it is on the wall * In Training, you can now open/close the truck doors in VR * Several fingerprints are no longer visible when you don’t have UV evidence * Crucifix T2 should now consistently give both “interaction” and “burned crucifix” photos * The haunted mirror will no longer get detected on the parabolic microphone or sound sensors if not being held or used * The Camp Woodwind entrance gate will no longer say “Maple Lodge campsite” * Video cam no longer breaks if swapped into inventory when CCTV is on the last camera * Lighters can no longer light some candles, firelights and the campfire when not lit * Summoning circle photos will no longer take priority over other photos as often * If you die in foggy weather, future games in foggy weather now show the fog correctly * Many performance improvements, especially in multiplayer and in the truck * Placing equipment on the wall in some areas of Sunny Meadows will no longer teleport the equipment back to the truck * Bone photos will now work more reliably * Firelight T2 now correctly lasts 5 minutes instead of 3 minutes == Known Issues (as of 26/10/23) == * The in-game version number will show as 0.9.0.11 * Terrain is currently showing inside Sunny Meadows * Ghost footstep sounds are currently sometimes incorrect in Maple Campsite * The bear trap interaction photo does not work ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.1.0

0.8.1.4, also known as the Easter Event '23 update, is a minor update released on 5 April 2023. This update introduces an Easter event. == Additions == === Easter '23 ===
Happy Easter everyone!
* Players can obtain a badge and a trophy for completing the event: ** Enter any location featuring an Easter sticker on any difficulty in single or multi-player. ** Find and collect all of the hidden Easter eggs. ** Retreat to the truck and leave! 0.9.0.7 is a minor patch released on 24 August 2023. The ID Card is a cosmetic that shows the player's in-game progress. ==Features== The ID card shows the name of the player, the platform they're playing on (Steam, PlayStation, or Xbox), their level, the player's badge, and their selected character model. For the player's own ID card, the bar shows the amount of experience needed to level up. When looking at other players' ID cards, the bar is used to adjust their voice chat volume. By default, the volume is set to 50%. The character model can be changed by clicking on the model portrait, and a player's badge can be changed by clicking the customize button in the top right corner. ===Roles=== By default, players are assigned the Ghost Huntin' Intern role. Different roles can be obtained through the prestige system, holiday events, contributing to the development of the game, being a Kinetic Games Partner, or through community-related events. Players that obtain a new role will also obtain a new badge that the role is linked to. The badge must be displayed on a player's profile to display the role. ===Prestige Badges=== Upon reaching Level 100 the player has the option to Prestige. Players will receive a new badge every Prestige that affects the role and color of the ID Card. Prestige Badges will also be displayed on the left shoulder of the player's character model, below the Legacy Badge. A player's prestige level will appear as Roman numerals prefixing their level (i.e. VI-002). Prestiges 1-10 display an ID Card with a static background and badge, while prestiges 11-20 display an ID Card with an animated background and badge. {| class="fandom-table" !Role !ID Card design !Prestige |- |Intern | |Prestige 0 (Default) |- |Recruit | |Prestige 1 (I) |- |Investigator | |Prestige 2 (II) |- |Pvt. content: 0.9.4.0 is a minor update released on 9 January 2024. == Additions == * New graphics settings have been added to the Journal (Currently not available for VR and requires a graphics card): ** Eye Adaption: Simulates your eyes adjusting to light or dark areas over time ** Screen Space Global Illumination (SSGI): Simulates bounced lighting; making lighting and shadows look less dark. This may affect performance so there are three quality settings. * Static lighting has been overhauled in all locations * Ambient light has been increased * Light from outside sources (moon, street lights) will now shine through windows * Larger rooms or rooms with darker materials such as farm houses may look darker, however this is intended == Changes == * Removed the Holiday Event * Reflections will now update quicker and more consistently when lights are toggled on or off * The brightness slider has been adjusted to 0%-250% and its maximum value lowered slightly due to the new brighter ambient light * The cursor brightness slider has been adjusted to be 0%-100% * Moved the wardrobe and lights in the Nursery in Grafton for better lighting * Adjusted the range and brightness of the passive player light * Adjusted the range and brightness of several location lights to make them more realistic * Grafton hiding spots ** The upstairs hallway armchair and nursery crib are now hiding zones and can be blocked ** The upstairs armchair has been moved closer to the wall to make it safer * Adjusted the player post processing to give slightly more cinematic colours * Improved performance when toggling the fuse box * Ghost writing books can no longer be thrown by a poltergeist ability == Fixes == * Metallic door knobs are now shiny again * Fixed several safe spots in Willow * “Deja Vu” weekly challenge now has the correct items * “Glow in the Dark” weekly challenge now has the Fuse Box as the correct state: Broken * “Hide and Seek: Extreme” weekly challenge now correctly has 3 evidence * Adjusted several reflection probes in Tanglewood to stop glowing objects when a light is turned on in a different room * You can now take a photo of the Sunny Meadows summoning circle * Motion sensors now correctly show detections on the truck map * Fixed safe spots in the Sunny Meadows male room 5 and Maple Campsite Storage Tent 2 * The ghost can no longer get stuck on the fallen down locker in the School hallway * Campsite A and B in Maple Lodge Campsite will now work correctly == References == Category:Development fr:0.9.4.0

0.9.4.2 is a minor hotfix released on 15 February 2024. == Additions == * Added the Unity Gaming Services notification system to be compliant with the EU Digital Services Act == References ==

0.8.1.5 is a minor hotfix released on 8 April 2023. == Fixes == * You can now complete the Easter event, if you do not have any other badges. If you had this bug, you will receive the badge and trophy by completing the Easter event on one map again * This weeks weekly challenge will now give the reward and have the correct loadout. This challenge will reset at the correct time and will not be extended ==References== Category:Development fr:0.8.1.5

0.9.6.0, also known as the Easter 2024 update, is a minor update released on 26 March 2024. This update adds the titular event as well as many fixes. ==Additions== *The Easter 2024 event has begun, it will be around for 2 weeks, so get investigating and earn those exclusive rewards! **More information can be found in-game *ID cards have had a facelift! **All badges now have a unique background when using that badge’s ID theme **Prestiges 11-20 have animated backgrounds to match their badges **Several colors have been adjusted **VIP and Artist have received new Badge designs **Volume slider colors are now the same as the EXP bar colors *Headphones are now visible when listening through the parabolic microphone ==Changes== *The middle lines of the ID card have been removed to make space for the new background designs (funds / ready status) *A ready sticker will now appear on the player ID card when that player is ready ==Fixes== *Fixed several Lobby-Equipment desync issues between players *UI will no longer overlap when applying a locked difficulty *You can now complete the “Survive with starter items” daily challenge *You can now place a video camera on a tripod more than once in VR *Parabolic microphone III will now determine the direction of sounds properly in VR *EMF Reader III will now determine the direction of EMF spots based on your screen position (non-VR only) *Shop gamepad buttons no longer still activate when not focusing on shop *The VR cursor is now in the correct position when highlighting Thermometers *You now get insurance when you die in Amateur or Intermediate difficulty *Hovering over the corkboard in the truck no longer appears as interactable *The thermometer tiers now highlight correctly when hovering over them *Tier 1 upgrades are no longer locked in the inventory manager when you are at the required level *Ambient Occlusion will now correctly turn off when the setting is disabled *Firelights will no longer blow out as soon as they are turned on again after being blown out by the ghost ==Known Issues== *One of the lobby effects after completing the event may not be visible in every lobby **Leaving the main lobby and rejoining may fix the visual, until you return from a contract where it will break again. ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.6.0
0.9.6.1 is a minor update released on 10 April 2024. This update removes the Easter 2024 event. ==Changes== *Removed Easter 2024 event ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.6.1

0.9.3.1 is a minor hotfix released on 25 December 2023. == Fixes == * You will no longer get Point Hope as a weekly challenge map * Years with an extra week will no longer break the weekly challenge on the last week of the year * Fixed localisation issues with the Holiday event in some languages == References == Category:Development fr:0.9.3.1

0.9.0.1 is a patch released on 19 August 2023. It fixes many outstanding issues from the release of 0.9.0, as well as a few small additions that didn't make it in for the major patch's release. ==New== *DOTS T1 is now placeable on most surfaces like Firelights *Added instructions to the shop descriptions of Head Gear, explaining how to turn them on or off ==Changes== *Igniter T3 is no longer consumable *Glowsticks will now be the correct brightness when dimmed *Crucifix T3 Range is now correctly 5m *Removed the 1s delay on the Incense hunt effects *Reduced the volume of the car alarm *Significantly improved performance of saving and loading from the save file *Motion sensor T2 now swaps between a single line, double line and off *Temporarily removed the VR social screen mode due to severe performance issues ==Fixes== *The Incense hunt effect duration will no longer sometimes set to 0 seconds *Fixed a bug where if you haven’t played for a long time, you would be wiped to prestige 0 *Incense will no longer use its ghost effects when you are not near the ghost *Crucifixes have received several scale fixes, improving consistency *Anti-virus software should no longer stop you from having read/write access to the save file *Corrupt save files will now revert to the cloud backup *Ghost sound effects now have the correct volume distance falloff *T2 Motion sensors no longer turn off when toggling the modes *Main menu performance has been improved *The wall telephones found in the farmhouses will now let you take interaction photos *Potential fix for the Incense T1 glowing *One Matchstick is no longer glowing *Equipment list text will no longer overlap the item icons *The “Next” button on the Legacy Badge screen will now scale correctly when translated *You can now get past the splash screen if you fail to connect to the unity servers *The legacy badge will no longer clip into one of the female model’s arms *After a game in challenge mode, you will no longer be set as a hacker *Challenge mode will no longer be different weather for each player *Challenge mode will no longer be different cursed item for each player *Potential fix for not being able to exit a map if a player crashed while loading *Flashlights now cost $30 ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.0.1 ru:0.9.0.1

0.9.0.8 is a minor patch released on 25 August 2023. It primarily fixes bugs, with a focus on VR interactions with Equipment. ==Additions== *You can now rebind the interact button on gamepad ==Fixes== *The left-hand VR orientation for emf reader T3 is now correct *The VR journal now works in Training *The spirit box and UV flashlight will no longer prevent you from being able to strafe in VR while it is on your belt *Motion sensor T3 can now be placed in VR *You can now light incense T3 consistently in VR *You can now light firelight T3 consistently in VR *The VR Journal can now be easily grabbed when on your shoulder *The shop TV no longer turns on and off for all players when a VR player focuses on it *Salt lines no longer collide with players, which allowed players to get trapped, and access unintended places *Turkish font is now readable *The cursed hunt will now end correctly if prevented by a crucifix T3 ==References== Category:Development fr:0.9.0.8 ru:0.9.0.8
