content: Experience (or XP) in Phasmophobia is used to unlock various equipment and difficulties. ==Mechanics== Each player starts off at level 1 with 0 XP, and earns XP through finishing contracts. The experience required to level up increases progressively, and the level is capped at 9,999. Once level 100 has been reached, the player can choose to Prestige, which will wipe out their level, money, and equipment, in exchange for a new badge and title for the ID Card. The ID Card lists the number of levels the player has and the amount of XP required to reach the next level. The amount of XP earned each contract is displayed on the debriefing screen. ===Gaining experience=== Players may gain XP from the following sources: {| class="article-table mw-collapsible" !Task completed !colspan="2"|XP rewarded |- |rowspan="3"|Ghost identification |Small map |100 XP |- |Medium map |150 XP |- |Large map |200 XP |- |Objectives 1 - 3 |colspan="2"|25 - 30 XP per successful objective |- |Media |colspan="2"|Up to 231 XP |- |Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|If the player identifies the correct ghost and escapes alive, XP = Ghost identification + Completed objectives |- |Perfect Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|50 XP on top of Investigation Bonus |- |rowspan="3"|Bone Evidence |Small map |25 XP |- |Medium map |35 XP |- |Large map |50 XP |- |Blood Moon weather |colspan="2"|+10% |} To get the additional Perfect Investigation Bonus of 50 XP, the player must identify the correct ghost, complete all 3 objectives, collect the bone, and fill the journal with only unique media. The amount of experience gained from identifying the ghost, completing optional objectives, recorded media, and any investigation bonus(es) is then multiplied by the difficulty multiplier: *Amateur: 1x *Intermediate: 2x *Professional: 3x *Nightmare: 4x *Insanity: 6x *Custom: 0x - 15x depending on settings If the player does not identify the correct ghost on a custom difficulty, their rewards will be rounded down to the nearest default difficulty (e.g. from 7x to 6x, which is the Insanity multiplier). Difficulty multipliers below 1x are not affected. If the player is dead when the investigation ends, the difficulty multiplier is not applied if it is higher than 1x, and their experience gained is halved. If the resulting EXP is not an integer value, it is then rounded down to the nearest integer. ===Level progression=== Players will unlock more equipment, difficulty levels, and maps as they progress. Prestige level doesn't change the amount of EXP for level up. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !colspan="4"|Level progression details |- !Level !XP to Next Level !Cumulative XP to Reach This Level !Unlocks |- |1 |100 |0 | |- |2 |231 |100 | *10 Ridgeview Court *42 Edgefield Road *Photo Camera Tier 1 |- |3 |337 |331 | *Motion Sensor Tier 1 |- |4 |432 |668 | *Bleasdale Farmhouse *Grafton Farmhouse *Sound Recorder Tier 1 |- |5 |518 |1,100 | *Nell's Diner *Parabolic Microphone Tier 1 |- |6 |601 |1,618 | *13 Willow Street |- |7 |678 |2,219 | *Crucifix Tier 1 |- |8 |753 |2,897 | *Brownstone High School *Salt Tier 1 |- |9 |825 |3,650 | *Tripod Tier 1 |- |10 |895 |4,475 | *Intermediate difficulty *Sound Sensor Tier 1 |- |11 |962 |5,370 | *Prison |- |12 |1,029 |6,332 | *Firelight Tier 1 *Igniter Tier 1 |- |13 |1,094 |7,361 | *Camp Woodwind *Maple Lodge Campsite *Head Gear Tier 1 |- |14 |1,156 |8,455 | *Incense Tier 1 *Sanity Medication Tier 1 |- |15 |1,219 |9,611 | *Point Hope |- |16 |1,279 |10,830 | |- |17 |1,339 |12,109 | *Sunny Meadows Mental Institution/Restricted |- |18 |1,398 |13,448 | *Flashlight Tier 2 *EMF Reader Tier 2 *UV Light Tier 2 |- |19 |1,456 |14,846 | |- |20 |1,512 |16,302 | *Professional difficulty |- |21 |1,569 |17,814 | |- |22 |1,625 |19,383 | |- |23 |1,679 |21,008 | *Ghost Writing Book Tier 2 *Photo Camera Tier 2 *Spirit Box Tier 2 |- |24 |1,734 |22,687 | |- |25 |1,787 |24,421 | |- |26 |1,840 |26,208 | |- |27 |1,892 |28,048 | *D.O.T.S. |710,882,510 | * Can't gain more levels |} ==Trivia== *The theoretical maximum experience you can gain in a single contract (excluding Daily and Weekly Tasks) is 14,261, by completing a perfect game on the highest difficulty multiplier with Blood Moon weather on large maps. When additionally completing 4 of the most rewarding daily tasks (only on the 2nd, 11th, and 25th of each month) and 3 weekly tasks awarding 500 XP each, the absolute maximum experience is 16,211. *It is possible to calculate each level's cumulative XP needed. With <math>x</math> being the targeted level: **If <math>x\leq100</math>, the formula used is <math>100(x-1)^{1.73}</math> rounded down. **If <math>101\leq x\leq999</math>, the formula used is <math>283432+4971(x-100)</math>. **If <math>x>999</math>, the formula used is <math>4468929+100(x-900)^{1.73}</math> rounded down. ==Notes== Category:Gameplay fr:Expérience ru:Опыт

content: Dirty water is murky brown water that appears in sinks, triggered by a ghost. This can be useful as an indicator for the ghost's general location. ==Mechanics== ]] If a ghost interacts with a nearby sink, it will cause the sink to start filling with brown-coloured water, or turn the water brown if a player had already activated the sink prior. An EMF level 2 emission will spawn on the sink's location, with a 33% chance for this to be EMF Level 5 instead if it is one of the ghost's evidences. Whether the sink has been activated before does not affect the ghost's ability to form dirty water. The sink cannot be emptied or cleaned once it has started filling with water, whether plain or dirty. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of dirty water or filming the faucet being opened by the ghost will yield a photo or a video labelled as Dirty Water, and reward up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the equipment tier and whether there is a Unique stamp. A dirty water photo can only be obtained once per sink, but dirty water videos can be obtained for multiple interactions on the same sink. ==Tips== ===Reliability=== As dirty water requires the ghost to be physically near a sink and interact with it, obtaining dirty water tends to be unreliable; in most maps, only a few rooms or small parts of the map have sinks. Clearing the room of interactable items will increase the chance of the ghost interacting with the sink. Depending on where the ghost is and the difficulty settings, it may not be worth it to wait for dirty water to appear. ===Interacting with the faucet=== It is advised to turn off the sink after the player is done filling it, in order to hear it turn on again should the ghost interact with it. ==Trivia== *Capturing a photo of dirty water was once a possible optional objective. This was later removed because of the unreliability in completing this objective. *In the promotional video on Steam for the game, the investigator turns on a sink and dirty water comes out. He tells his friend on the walkie, and his friend responds "That means we're dealing with a Spirit or a Wraith." This was changed before the game was made available on Steam and dirty water currently does not serve as evidence for any particular ghost type. ==See also== *Photo Camera *Objectives Category:Objectives fr:Eau sale

content: The Demon is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. Demons are generally considered to be one of the most dangerous types of ghost to encounter: they are purported to attack more often than any other ghost. == Behaviour == === Ability === The Demon has an ability that allows it to automatically start a hunt, regardless of current average sanity. There is no particular behaviour or condition (such as requiring line-of-sight with a player) that affects if it activates or not; if it decides to use its ability, it will hunt. This hunt can be blocked by normal prevention methods. Because the Demon's ability hunt is governed by the "ability phase", these hunts occur much less frequently than hunts derived from being below its sanity threshold. Additionally, as this is not a "proper" hunt attempt, the Demon can attempt to use its ability when it is unable to hunt (during the setup phase on Amateur and Intermediate difficulties, when it is affected by Incense, or when a hunt has just ended and it is on cooldown). However, it will fail and there will be no hunt. === Hunt === The Demon has a normal hunt sanity threshold of 70%, instead of the standard 50%. This does not affect and is independent from its hunt ability, although the hunt does not differ in any way. Demons have a minimum cooldown of 20 seconds between hunts, instead of the usual 25 seconds. Smudging a Demon will prevent hunts for only 60 seconds, as opposed to the standard 90 seconds. As a weakness, the effective range of a crucifix is 50% larger than the standard range: * 4.5 metres instead of 3 for Tier I * 6 metres instead of 4 for Tier II * 7.5 metres instead of 5 for Tier III == Evidence == == Strengths and weaknesses == These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Demons will initiate hunts more often than other ghosts. Weakness: Demons fear the Crucifix and will be less aggressive near one. == Strategies== Generally, it is best to think of the Demon as having a 100% hunt sanity threshold, even if its hunts are rarer above 70% average sanity. To identify a Demon by its traits, players may time the cooldown between hunts, or watch out for signs of a very early hunt. Given the Demon's relative aggressiveness in hunting, players should plan their route to the ghost room and what they wish to bring for any objectives, while considering whether to hide or to use Incense on the ghost if it hunts. Sprint may need to be conserved once approaching the ghost room in order to make a quick escape in the event of a sudden hunt. If a very early hunt occurs, make sure to rule out the possibility of a cursed hunt caused by another player using a cursed possession without the rest of the team's knowledge. With the crucifix's increased effective range, preventing hunts will generally be easier, though difficulties may still be encountered in massive rooms, such as the Basketball Court of Brownstone High School. === Identification === Players can use two tests: * Time the hunt cooldown: a cooldown of less than 25 seconds (excluding hunts caused by cursed possessions) may indicate a Demon. If it uses a crucifix charge in this time, this may also be indicative of a Demon. * Time the smudge hunt prevention: a ghost hunting between 60 - 90 seconds after being smudged correctly may indicate a Demon Take care to ensure that the timing is correct to avoid misidentification -- usage of a stopwatch may be helpful. In particular, if a ghost is still under the effect of a previous smudge, smudging again will not reset the timer, which may throw off timing; wait for the ghost to attempt another hunt before smudging again. Note that ghosts do not necessarily hunt after the cooldown is over; having hunts consistently being more than 25 seconds apart does not necessarily eliminate the Demon as a possibility. Additionally, while a ghost hunting above 70% average sanity is very likely to be a Demon, this does not guarantee it, as a few other ghosts are also capable of hunting that early. However, a Demon will do this the most consistently, as these other ghosts have conditions on hunting at high levels of sanity (the Yokai requires talking, the Onryo requires firelights to be blown out, etc.). ==Trivia== *On 42 Edgefield Road, a Demon located in the Garage, Master Bedroom, or Hallway may be able to burn a crucifix which is still hanging in the truck, as its increased range covers portions of these rooms. Note that it is also possible for this to happen with other ghosts (especially with higher crucifix tiers which have a longer range), but the Demon is able to do this much more frequently. *In mythology, demons tend to have horrifying forms, being commonly depicted with horns, tails, claws, and other inhuman appendages. In-game, Demons draw from the regular pool of Ghost Models without any sort of modifications. *The word "demon" comes from Ancient Greek "δαίμων" (daimōn), meaning "god", "godlike", "power", "fate", etc. It was used in contexts related to unknown/supernatural forces, both good and bad. As time progressed, the meaning became more negative thanks to Christianization. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" | Early Access Alpha |- ! 5 August 2020 | Added Demon. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! 0.29.6 | Increased the hunt sanity threshold from 65% to 70%. |- ! 0.3.0 | Prior to 0.3.0, the evidence was Spirit Box, Ghost Writing, and Freezing Temperatures. |- ! 0.4.0 | Demons now deduct less sanity on successful questions instead of failed questions. |- ! rowspan="3" | 0.5.0 | The Banshee's rare ability to hunt at any sanity percentage has been moved to the Demon. |- | The Demon's hunt cooldown is now 20 seconds. |- | Smudge sticks now prevent the Demon from hunting for only 60 seconds instead of 90 seconds. |- ! 0.5.1.0 | The Demon's reduced sanity drop now applies to all cursed possessions. |- !0.5.2.0 | The Demon's weakness has been changed from reducing cursed possession sanity drops to having a larger crucifix range, which was originally the Banshee's weakness. |- !0.7.0 | Improved the reliability of the Demon's hunt ability. |- !0.9.0 | Crucifixes will now have an extra 50% range (per Tier) against Demons. |} ==References== ru:Демон fr:Démon Category:Ghosts

42 Edgefield Road (or simply Edgefield) is a small map in Phasmophobia. It is a two story, six-bedroom house with a basement, with a congested, claustrophobic environment. Despite the thin hallways, there are plenty of hiding spaces during a hunt, as a room to hide in is always a few paces away. Its tight hallways can often make it difficult to see past fellow investigators, and a team member may be encouraged to set up Video Cameras and observe key investigative details from the truck. ==Structure== Edgefield contains six bedrooms (including a nursery), six toilets, a dining room, a garage, and a basement, among other rooms. ===Layout tips=== *Both the basement hallway and the storage room separated by a door is considered a single "Basement" room. *For every bedroom on the second floor, the game considers both the room with the bed and the attached bathroom, if any, to be a single room. *In order to fully prevent passive sanity drain in the Hallway, the light switch controlling the outside lamp above the entrance door has to be switched on as well. *There is a bug where the computer in Small Blue Bedroom needs to be turned on to prevent passive sanity drain in that room. See Third-party tools for a list of detailed map viewers that players may use. ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== There are 9 "sanctioned" hiding spots in Edgefield: *Utility, back corner between shelves and washer (crouch against the washer) *Garage, lockers against far wall *Basement, lockers next to refrigerator *Small Blue Bedroom, closet at back *Upstairs Hallway, 2 closets across from green bedroom *Large Blue Bedroom, closet at back corner *Master Bedroom, 2 closets across from bed Depending on the difficulty, some of these hiding spots will be filled with bulky items, preventing players from hiding in them: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 3 *Professional: 5 *Nightmare/Insanity: 7 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overridden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None Several more unofficial furniture-based hiding spots are available. While they are more risky, they will never be blocked unlike official hiding spots, and can still provide decent hiding in most cases. Examples include: *Hallway, behind a cupboard at the rear end of the hallway *Living Room, behind the bookshelf. It will block line-of-sight from the doorway, but it can be very risky if the ghost enters the living room. *Basement, behind the shelves in the storage room Looping the ghost is only possible around the living room couch, but the latter doesn't block line of sight. Using tier III Salt can be useful to slow down the ghost if one wants to test for certain ghosts (especially Poltergeist and Obake). ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
Bone edgefield utility.png|A large bone in a rug in Utility. Smaller bones spawned like this may be easier to miss. Bone edgefield smallbluebedroom.png|The bones of a foot in the Small Blue Bedroom on the second floor.
==Cursed Possession locations==
Hauntedmirror edgefield hallway.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns in front of the stairs leading up to the second floor in the Hallway. Musicbox edgefield livingroom.png|The Music Box spawns on the table with a lamp in the Living Room. Ouija edgefield utility.png|The Ouija Board spawns under a metal rack in the Utility. Summoningcircle edgefield basement.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the segmented room of the Basement. Tarotcards edgefield hallway.png|The Tarot Cards spawn on the table at the front of the Foyer. Voodoodoll edgefield largebluebedroom.png|The Voodoo Doll spawns on the bed in the Large Blue Bedroom. Monkeypaw edgefield.jpeg|The Monkey Paw spawns in the Nursery on top of the blue dresser.
==Trivia== *Before the Purple Bedroom's toilet had a sink, it was up to the toilet user to decide how to wash their hands, if at all. *There used to be a bug where taking a photo of the trash can at the front of the house resulted in a Dead Body photo. *Since the Truck is parked rather close to the house, tier II and III Crucifixes might get used while they are still hanging in the truck if the ghost is in the Garage or Master Bedroom, as their range will reach into the house. If the ghost is a Demon, this might even happen with a tier I Crucifix. *The assets used for this map can be found here. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !19 March 2020 |Split the basement into two rooms mechanic-wise. |- !? |Converted the basement back into a single room. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.7.0 |Renamed Edgefield Street House to 42 Edgefield Road. |}

content: The Dayan is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. Its unique trait allows it to speed up when players move near it but also makes it slow down when players stop moving. ==Behavior== ===Hunt=== When a player is within 10 metres of the Dayan, whether on the same floor or not, the ghost will have a modified hunt sanity threshold and hunt speed depending on further factors: *If the closest player is still, the threshold is decreased to 45% and the ghost will have a fixed speed of 1.2 m/s. *If the closest player is walking, the threshold is increased to 65% and the ghost will have a fixed speed of 2.25 m/s. If there is no player within 10 metres of the Dayan, it will have the standard threshold of 50% and follow standard ghost speeds with one particularity: if the Dayan has line-of-sight with a player within 10 metres, the speed increase from continuous line-of-sight adds in the background, and will only be applied once it is no longer near any player. ===Miscellaneous=== The Dayan can only be a female ghost and will use a female ghost model. ==Evidence== ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: The Dayan gains strength to protect herself if people 'dance' too close to her. Weakness: The Dayan loses strength if people close to her stand still. ==Strategies== At the beginning of a contract, the Dayan can already be excluded if the ghost presents a masculine name. The Dayan's ability to speed up when nearby players move arguably makes it one of the most dangerous ghosts in the game. Therefore, identifying the Dayan and completing the investigation without a hunt is preferable. During normal gameplay, players should assume the Dayan has a 65% hunting threshold, just hunting less often before 50% sanity, as it's impossible to completely avoid walking near the ghost. During a hunt, Incense and Tier III salt will play a highly important role to allow players time to hide or move out of the 10-metre ability range of the ghost. If neither of these options is available, it is worth crouching behind a looping spot out of immediate view of the ghost and remaining still until the hunt is over. If the Dayan spots you, line-of-sight breaks are a last resort for survival, as the ghost can quickly catch up to players. If line-of-sight cannot be broken, one can try to outrun the Dayan, as its maximum speed in range is slightly lower than the player's default maximum speed. The Dayan's ability makes standing still while one's sprint recharges look appealing, however walking should still be preferred. At normal speeds, the Dayan is slightly faster than the player; a Dayan will (under ideal circumstances) catch a player after 80 seconds, ignoring turning around corners. The player can avoid the ghost forever if the difficulty has lower ghost speeds or higher player speeds, but the player will have difficulty breaking out of the 10-metre range due to the line-of-sight increasing the speed outside of the range. Stopping while recharging sprint becomes the theoretical best strategy at higher ghost speeds and lower player speeds, however at these settings there is a high risk of the ghost catching the player before their sprint recharges. As such, the preferred movement should be to keep moving, even while at high difficulties. While normally used for restoring sanity, a Tier III Sanity Medication's speed boost can be used to escape the Dayan's ability range faster, assuming that the medication cannot be better used by restoring sanity before a hunt starts. ==Trivia== *A Dayan (or Daayan) is a malevolent ghostly presence derived in Indian and Pakistani Folklore. While the term in English typically describes a Dayan as a "Witch", it is more so described as a vengeful ghostly female spirit and not a living human. The folklore encourages the idea that they are a woman who would suffer from abuse and harsh cruelty and would return as a Daayan after her death. A Daayan would go on to haunt their family members and drink their blood, starting from the youngest male, draining his blood until he was an old man and then she would move on to other men of the family. It is also said that the Daayan would target younger families in order to "make the young become older". ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.15.1.0 |Added Dayan. |} fr:Dayan Category:Ghosts
title: Dayan

content: Freezing Temperatures (or Freezing Temps/Freezing) are a piece of evidence used to determine the type of ghost haunting the location. ==Mechanics== The presence of a ghost in a room will cause the room's temperature to decrease, regardless of evidence. Ghosts without Freezing Temperatures evidence will be able to drop the room's temperature to , whereas ghosts with Freezing Temperatures as evidence will be able to drop the temperature to . Freezing Temperatures can only be confirmed if the thermometer reads a temperature strictly below . *If using a Tier I thermometer, Freezing Temperatures should only be confirmed if the thermometer reads a temperature strictly below as it is less accurate between and (there are only 8 graduations between these two values instead of 9). ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of the thermometer while it is displaying a freezing temperature will yield a Freezing Temperatures photo, rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Photo Camera. ==Tips== ===Ghost location and temperatures=== Temperatures only decrease when the ghost is within a room, and although the ghost is more likely to stay in its ghost room, making it colder, freezing temperatures do not necessarily indicate the ghost room. Additionally, temperatures do not return to normal immediately after a ghost leaves a room. This means that multiple rooms can be freezing at once, and that players should not assume that low or freezing temperatures guarantees that the ghost is still in that room. Since 0.9.0, seeing cold breath is not an indicator of Freezing Temperatures. ===Weather=== If the fuse box is turned off at the start, Freezing Temperatures may be obtained quicker, depending on the weather and how often the ghost roams into other rooms. In particular, one could theoretically observe Freezing Temperatures in approximately two minutes if it is snowing, as long as the ghost stays in the same room for long enough. As of 0.9.0, temperatures drop at 1/3 the current speed, if the temperature is below the weather's ambient temperature. ===Visual effects=== Nearly all ghosts can initiate an "airball" ghost event which is visually similar to the player's breath, other than in movement. The airball does not count as an indicator for low temperatures. The main difference is that the airball event usually moves towards a particular player, while cold breath never moves by itself. ==Possible ghosts== {| class="article-table" |Demon |Freezing Temperatures |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |- |Hantu |Freezing Temperatures |Ultraviolet |Ghost Orb |- |Jinn |Freezing Temperatures |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |- |Moroi |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |Oni |Freezing Temperatures |D.O.T.S. Projector |EMF Level 5 |- |Onryo |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |Spirit Box |- |Revenant |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |Ghost Writing |- |Shade |Freezing Temperatures |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |- |The Mimic |Freezing Temperatures |Ultraviolet |Spirit Box |- |The Twins |Freezing Temperatures |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |- |Yurei |Freezing Temperatures |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Orb |} ==References== Category:Evidence fr:Températures glaciales ru:Минусовая температура

content: The 0.5.0 update, also known as the Cursed Possessions update, is a content update to the game that was released on 10 December 2021. This update adds several equipment related to interacting with the ghost, one new ghost, as well as a rework of the existing ghosts' behaviours. == Additions == === Equipment === ==== Cursed possessions ==== *1 of 6 items will spawn per contract, with several spawnpoints *Will trade sanity or other negative effects for information or uses ;Music Box *When activated, can sometimes cause the ghost to sing along to the melody, which can make identifying the ghost room easier. ;Summoning Circle *Used to summon the ghost, leading up to a hunt ;Tarot Cards *Contains ten randomly-selected cards, with positive or negative effects ;Haunted Mirror *Can be used to locate the current ghost room, at the cost of severe sanity drain the longer it is used === Gameplay === ;Journal *New Home and Item tabs === Ghosts === ;The Mimic *May mimic the actions of other ghosts *Ghost Orbs may appear as a fourth evidence *Requires Spirit Box, Fingerprints, and Freezing Temperatures as evidence == Changes == === Equipment === ;Voodoo Doll *Can now used to force the ghost to perform interactions *Updated visuals ;Ouija Board *Updated visuals *Now classed as a cursed possession *Now requires user to say goodbye to the board *New questions related to bone location, method of death, *No longer fails questions *No longer plays an additional sound when spelling double letters *Spawn chance is now treated as a cursed posession ;Parabolic Microphone *Paranormal sounds can now be heard more often ;Photo Camera and Video Camera *Interference effect during manifestations has been adjusted ===Evidence and ghost traces=== ;Ghost Writing *Ghosts will now also interact with it when it throws the book outside of hunts ;Fingerprints *Photos of "refreshed" fingerprints will now count as a photo reward ===Gameplay=== *Props/objects within the house now have different impact sounds to match its material *New sounds for player footsteps on different surfaces *Large rugs and floor mats now have collision *Interaction photos of objects thrown must now be of the objective itself instead of where the object was beforehand *Light flickers will now be based on distance of the ghost to the light instead of the switch ===Ghosts=== ;General *Will now use abilities more often and more consistently *Will now consider distance of path to take when setting waypoints *Heartbeats now scale depending on the distance of the player to the ghost ;Banshee *No longer has rare ability to hunt at any sanity *Will choose singing ghost events more often *Can emit unique paranormal sound audible to the parabolic microphone ;Demon *Now has a rare ability to hunt at any sanity *Now has shorter hunt cooldown of 20 seconds ;Hantu *Will now emit freezing breath when manifested ;Jinn *Distance for speed drop-off decreased ;Mare *May now turn off lights more often, including instantly *Will choose dark rooms to wander into more often *Will choose light bulb explosion ghost events more often ;Oni *Will now always manifest during ghost events *More likely to show up in full form during ghost events ;Shade *Hunt sanity threshold reduced to 35% *Will now have less interactions regardless of player numbers ;Yokai *Now reacts more to player voices ;Yurei *New ability to close doors while draining sanity from players in the same room ===Hunts=== *Players can no longer back out through the exit doors when the hunt starts *Ghosts can now throw objects during hunts *Ghosts will now only use physical form during hunts *Ghosts can now hear the player's voice from further away *Hunting sounds will now fade out instead of stopping abruptly ===Maps=== ;Maple Lodge Campsite *New temporary visuals for winter season *Assets have been optimised ===General=== *Several scripts and weather has been optimised for performance ==Bug Fixes== ===From versions released before 0.5.0=== *Fixed a bug where the Raiju’s weakness was only affecting camcorders and cameras *Fixed a bug where the hunt duration was being set based on the size of the map you previously played *Fixed a bug where heartbeat sound would play if the ghost was too far away *Fixed a bug where sound would muffle if you walked near the cabin balcony door *Fixed a bug where the escape from the ghost during a hunt objective couldn't be completed *Fixed a bug where several interactions were not giving photo rewards *Fixed a bug where the photo camera could be turned on inside the truck *Fixed a bug where smashed lights could be turned on when toggling the fuse box *Fixed a bug where you could hold lit candles outside in heavy rain *Fixed a bug where the temperatures inside the Campsite toilets were not being set correctly *Fixed a bug where a Yurei could still change its preferred room if it was smudged *Fixed a bug where the heartbeat sound would play when you were too far away from the ghost *Fixed a bug where you using a second smudge stick (within a few seconds of the first) wouldn’t stop the ghost killing you *Fixed a bug where setting the master volume slider wouldn’t always work *Fixed a bug where VR players couldn’t hear their own footsteps *Fixed a bug where some curtains didn’t have collision, causing a safe spot *Fixed a bug where the model of some lights wouldnt look 'turned on' after it flickered *Fixed a bug where the shower water in the ensuite in Edgefield was spraying the wrong way *Fixed several bugs where certain map UI and player icons were rotated incorrectly *Fixed several bugs where photo rewards were being given when they shouldn't be *Fixed several floating books in high school *Fixed several safe spots in Prison *Fixed several fans in Asylum having two sets of fan blades *Fixed several rare visual issues in Willow and Ridgeview ==References== Category:Development fr:0.5.0

The Expedition Update is an April Fools' joke update announced on 1 April 2022, and is a hoax changelog for the full release of v1.0. The update was said to be the final version of the game. Phasmophobia 2 was also announced, with an Early Access release date of 31 March 2025, and a full release date of 1 April 2025. No update was actually released to the game, and there are currently no plans to develop a Phasmophobia 2 game. == Additions == === Gameplay === *You can now perform an exorcism to delete the ghost, this will be permanent and you will never get that ghost type again. The game is completed when you run out of ghost types to play against *Added dust particles to each room to make finding ghost orbs harder *Added batteries hidden around each location, unique to each flashlight *Added an easter egg in an Asylum bedroom *There is now a chance for no ghost to spawn in the location, players can select 'None' in the journal to receive rewards *Added an optional objective after the contract to go back and clean the location for extra rewards *Added room names above all doors in Prison *Added an option to increase and decrease the maximum players in a server (Max 100) *You can now go prone by pressing the 'Z' key to hide under beds *You can now use the spray cans to draw graffiti *You can now change your characters clothes by taking them out of wardrobes when in a location, this only works if you are the only player in that room *Added raytracing support *Added an option to replace all textures and geometry with white cubes to improve performance for those with old computers *You can now play the game on mobile devices *You can now press 'N' to dance === Maps === ;Lighthouse *Small location with 8 rooms *A lighthouse located on a remote island in the middle of a hazardous sea *Players can complete maintenance on the light and tower for bonus rewards ;Funfair *A medium outdoor map featuring minigames, a house of mirrors and a completely interactive haunted fun house *You must buy a ticket for $100 to enter this location, per player ;Church *A medium location with a large open main hall, perfect for losing ghosts and items *Graveyard with dynamically generated gravestones for every previous death on your account *Enter the crypts and choose which ghost model you'd like to scare you === Truck driving === *Added an open world area where you can drive back and forth to each location *Added a shop location where you will have to drive to in order to buy your equipment *You must now bring all equipment back to the truck or you will lose them === Possession === *Likely references another horror game, Dead by Daylight, and multiple requests for a similar gamemode in Phasmophobia *A brand new game mode where you can play as the ghost, in a 1v4 competitive fight to the death against other players *The ghost player will have 1 minute to hide the bone and cursed possession before choosing a favourite room to stay in *During hunts players that are talking or have equipment turned on will glow red through walls *The ghost player will be able to talk to investigators through the spirit box *Ghost players will steal the money of anyone they kill, and can use it to upgrade abilities in a new 3 tier skill tree === Equipment === ;Ghost-e-ball *A red and white sphere like item that can be used to capture the ghost, in exchange for additional rewards OR can be trained to "become the very best!" ;Teddy Bear *A fluffy toy that responds to ghost activity, but can also be placed to hug the nearest player for a 1% sanity increase ;Buddy *You can now 'Use' the bone to summon a dog that will follow you and will bark when near the ghost ;Wrist Watch *A watch that tells you the time == Changes == === Gameplay === *The parabolic microphone will now play back all sounds at 500% volume, allowing you to hear things from further away *Reduced sprint duration from 3s to 1.5s *Reduced sprint cooldown from 5s to 2.5s *Sanity Pills will now only spawn inside bathrooms and are no longer buyable *You will now be fined by the home owners for every item that has been misplaced, dropped, broken or stolen *You now have to lock the exit doors and place the key under the doormat when you leave, otherwise you will be fined *Sinks and showers will now flood the house if you don't turn them off *You can now attach all equipment to tripods *Replaced all Spirit Box audio with “E” *The main key will sometimes be hidden outside the location instead of spawning in the truck *Converted the entire game from Unity to Unreal Engine 5 === Ghosts === ;Spirit *Spirits have developed a dependency on Smudge Sticks, and will stop all activity and leave the location unless you light them nearby **Increased smudge stick duration on Spirits to 5 minutes ;Revenant *The OG speed-demon has had enough of you all sprinting away and hiding, so we've put him back to his rightful top spot **Revenants now sprint when players sprint, setting them to their maximum speed **Revenant grace period is now always 1 second ;The Twins *The 'twin' ghost will now join the team and help with the investigation ;The Mimic *Mimics now mimic all ghosts at the same time, and always have every strength and weakness ;Raiju *Raiju will now speed up as long as the fuse box is on, when near switched on lights and when players are using walkie-talkies ;Poltergeist *Poltergeists can now throw players ;Obake *Obake were having some trouble changing forms as they were too shy, so we've given them an encouragement speech and now they think they're ready to change in front of players **Will now change ghost models every second during events and hunts == Bug fixes == *Fixed a bug where equipment and lights would flicker whenever the ghost appeared *Fixed a bug where ghosts were flashing on and off during hunts *Fixed a bug where the Newbridge Beech House contract could not be selected *Fixed a bug where players could hide behind doors (by removing all doors in all locations) *Fixed a bug where the 'Death' tarot card didn't instantly kill you *Fixed a bug where you could get EMF 5 by looking at the activity monitor *Fixed a bug where voice recognition breaks when tabbing out *Fixed a bug where you couldn't jump *Fixed a bug where the power would turn off if you turned on too many lights *Fixed a bug where players could hold 3 items instead of 2 *Fixed a bug where flashlights were staying on even when in your pocket *Fixed a bug where if two people grabbed an object at the same time, the item would duplicate for them *Fixed a bug where you could glitch doors off of their hinges *Fixed a bug where you could glitch yourself inside of walls *Fixed a bug where you couldn't see the ghost's relationship meter *Fixed a bug where the ghosts looked like they wanted to kill you, instead of give you a cuddle *Fixed a bug where ghosts were hugging your eye sockets instead of your body when they got to you *Fixed a bug where "#BlameLavender", "#BlameDK" and "#BlameCJ" categories weren't visible in the bug reporter *Fixed a bug where hackers weren't able to hack everything *Fixed a bug where the letter 'H' was found on keyboards when it shouldn't be (Reference to old keyboard not having an "H" key) *Fixed a bug where ghosts were being naughty == References == == Notes == Category:April Fools' fr:Mise à jour Expedition

Unlocked at level 50, custom difficulty, as the name suggests, allows the player to modify various parameters relating to the player, the ghost, and the contract itself. In exchange, the reward multiplier is either increased (if the changes make the difficulty harder) or decreased (if the changes make the difficulty easier). The penalties for decreasing the difficulty are usually higher than the rewards for increasing it. ==Difficulty Modifiers== Each difficulty setting will show a coloured icon beside it, depending on how the reward multiplier is affected, mostly in relation to Amateur difficulty: * Green: Increased rewards * Yellow: Limited by another difficulty setting * Orange: Decreased rewards * Red: Clamped or limited to a maximum reward multiplier In the following table, numbers in the Reward Modifier column are compared to the Base Reward. Every setting being set to Base Reward results in 1.00x rewards. Rewards cannot be lower than 0.00x or higher than 15.00x. *A modifier with + or - adds that number to the rewards multiplier. **e.g. +0.20x results in 3.00x -> 3.20x; -0.50x results in 3.20x -> 2.70x *A modifier with * multiplies the final rewards multiplier by that number. **e.g. *0.75x results in 4.00x -> 3.00x; *0.75x and *0.50x results in 1.00x -> 0.75x -> 0.37x *A clamp reduces the final rewards multiplier to that number, if it is higher. **e.g. a 2.00x clamp results in 3.00x -> 2.00x or 7.30x -> 2.00x; a 1.00x clamp would not affect 0.75x or 0.50x rewards Some parameters will affect other parameters. Such interactions are listed under the Secondary Modifier column. In the special case where modifiers are halved above 4.00x or 5.00x multipliers due to having 3 or 2 types of evidence respectively, the game first adds normally to reach the 4.00x or 5.00x multipliers, before adding half of what remains of the modifier. *For example, with 3 types of evidence and a multiplier at 3.80x, trying to add a modifier of +0.50x will first add 0.20x to reach 4.00x before adding half of the remaining 0.30x, which will give a final multiplier of 4.15x. {| class="fandom-table" !Setting !Option !Reward Modifier !Secondary Modifier !Notes |- ! colspan="5" content: The event board, in the lobby, allows the player to view their progression in various challenges and events, as well as getting information on how to complete them. ==Challenges== ===Lighthouse Keeper=== The player must identify the ghost 50 times and survive, on any difficulty, on Point Hope. The Lighthouse Keeper badge and ID card are rewarded after completing this challenge. ===Ranger Challenge=== The player must identify the ghost 50 times and survive, on any difficulty, on Maple Lodge Campsite or Camp Woodwind. The Ranger badge and ID card are rewarded after completing this challenge. ===Farmhouse Fieldwork=== The player must identify the ghost 50 times and survive, on any difficulty, on Bleasdale Farmhouse or Grafton Farmhouse. The Farmhouse badge and ID card are rewarded after completing this challenge. ===Sunny Meadows Survival=== The player must identify the ghost 50 times and survive, on any difficulty, on Sunny Meadows or Sunny Meadows Restricted. The Inmate badge and ID card are rewarded after completing this challenge. ===Achievement Hunter=== The player must obtain all Achievements/Trophies. The Completionist badge and ID card are rewarded after completing this challenge. ===Apocalypse Challenge=== ==See also== *Main menu board ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.11.0 |Added the Event Board. |- !0.11.1.0 |Added the Achievement Hunter challenge. |- !0.14.0 |Added the Farmhouse Fieldwork challenge. |} Category:Gameplay fr:Panneau d'événements

The crucifix is a buyable item that is used to prevent ghosts from hunting. ==Mechanics== A crucifix can be held in the player's hand, , or ; the crucifix works in all three situations. Holding the placing button will show the default effective range for the crucifix; this is a translucent sphere with a radius depending on its tier level (even if the ghost has a different effective range): *Tier I: 3 metres *Tier II: 4 metres *Tier III: 5 metres When the ghost attempts to initiate a hunt within the crucifix's range, the hunt will fail to begin, and a charge will be used. The ghost is then teleported back to its favourite room. Each time a crucifix successfully prevents a hunt, an EMF Level 2 reading is created, with a 33% chance for this to be EMF Level 5 if it is one of the ghost's evidences. For the Demon, the crucifix's effective range is increased by 50% for each tier: *Tier I: 4.5 metres *Tier II: 6 metres *Tier III: 7.5 metres For the Gallu, the crucifix's effective range is decreased by 2 metres while in its "enraged" state, and increased by 1 metre while in its "weakened" state. The Tier I crucifix only has one charge, while tier II and tier III both have two charges. Each time it blocks a hunt attempt, a burning effect will appear, and the crucifix will glow visually before cooling down. On first use, one arm of the crucifix will disappear. On second use, more parts of the crucifix will disappear. If a player-held crucifix successfully prevents a hunt attempt, it will automatically be thrown on the ground. After the crucifix is completely burnt, the crucifix will be useless and have no further effect on the ghost. In addition, the crucifix will not work if: *The ghost is not within the specified range (even if the crucifix is located in the favourite room) *A cursed possession is used to initiate a cursed hunt (Except for in the case of an unused tier III crucifix, which can be used to stop a cursed hunt at the cost of both its charges) *A hunt has already started/is in progress Each time a crucifix is used, the ghost must wait a minimum of 25 seconds (20 seconds for a Demon) before attempting to initiate another hunt. The crucifix range is not limited by any obstacle such as walls and doors. This includes exterior walls, which means that it is possible for crucifixes to be used outside provided the ghost is within its range inside the investigation area. 42 Edgefield Road is a good example of this, where a ghost near the front of the house, even upstairs, could possibly use up a crucifix still hanging on the truck wall. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a crucifix that has been used once or twice will yield a Burned Crucifix photo, filming a crucifix while it is burning will yield a Burned Crucifix video, and recording the sound of a crucifix while it is burning will yield a Burned Crucifix sound. These pieces of media respectively reward up to $7 and 7 XP, $12 and 12 XP, and $7 and 7 XP, depending on the equipment tier and whether there is a Unique stamp. ==Tips== Although the crucifix works while held in-hand, it is strongly advised to place the crucifix on the ground, as this will free the player to do other objectives or hold onto more useful equipment during the investigation. ==Trivia== *Because it has no corpus (figure of the crucified Christ), the in-game item is not a true crucifix but rather just a regular cross. ==Gallery== Crucifix used once 0.8.1.gif|A fresh tier II crucifix blocking its first hunt attempt. Crucifix stages 0.8.1.gif|The stages of tier II crucifix. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- ! rowspan="2" |3 July 2020 |The crucifix is no longer used up when preventing a hunt. |- |Increased the crucifix's price from $25 to $30. |- !26 August 2020
(Part 2) |Increased the crucifix's range by 1 metre for all ghosts. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.174 |The crucifix is now consumable, with 2 uses. |- !29 September 2020 |Decreased the crucifix's range by 1 metre for all ghosts. |- !0.27.4.2 |The crucifix now has models for each use instead of disappearing on its final use. |- !0.28.6.5 |Crucifixes now cause a 5 second delay before the ghost can attempt to initiate another hunt. |- !0.3.0 |Changed the crucifix model. |- ! rowspan="2"|0.7.0 |A successful block of a hunt attempt will now create an EMF 2 reading. |- |Used crucifixes can now be photographed. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.8.0 |Crucifixes can now be placed. |- |The crucifix's range can now be previewed. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.8.1.0 |Successful uses of the crucifix now causes the ghost to wait 25 seconds before hunting again (20 for a Demon). |- |Added new textures, effects, and sounds when the crucifix is used. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.9.0 |Added Tier I and Tier III crucifixes. |- |The original crucifix model is now Tier II and range reduced to 4 meters. |- !0.13.0 |The Crucifix now visually "cools down" after successfully preventing a hunt. |} Category:Equipment fr:Crucifix ru:Распятие

Ghosts are the main focus of Phasmophobia. Each ghost has a set of unique characteristics, including personal identifiers, abilities, and evidences. Players must investigate some of these aspects to correctly identify the ghost. The ghost can interact with its environment or perform ghost events, and even attempt to kill the player by initiating hunts. == Characteristics == Each ghost in a contract has a randomly generated unique identity consisting of the type of the ghost, gender, name, age, length of death, shyness (with respect to the Spirit Box), and a physical model that is determined at the start of the contract. Most of its general behaviour (such as movement speed, hunting patterns, activity, etc.) is based on the type of ghost, except for its willingness to respond to the spirit box in the presence of multiple people in the room, which is randomly set. ==Behavior== Each contract, one ghost will spawn within the map in a certain room. This room is very often the favourite room, and the ghost will wander back to it if not the case. After an exit door is opened for the first time, the ghost will be "activated" and be able to interact with the environment or the player. The ghost may stand still, roam or walk to another place, interact with objects and doors, use its abilities, and initiate ghost events or hunts. If a player attempts to enter the house without unlocking the exit door, the ghost will not be "activated" and cannot do interactions, ghost events, nor hunt, though some types of evidence (most notably Ghost Orbs) can be obtained. The ghost can however still be forced into initiating a cursed hunt using cursed possessions. Ghosts cannot exit the investigation area; they cannot walk out of the exit doors even if they are wide open. The following is a non-exhaustive list of "states" or "phases" that the ghost can enter (these terms are conjectural and may not be official): *Idling: The ghost stays still for 2-6 seconds *Roaming: The ghost chooses to perform either a short roam or a long roam, which are both defined by a smaller or larger spherical area, respectively. It then randomly picks a waypoint within that sphere, then checks the path distance to that waypoint. If successful, the ghost walks to that point, else it repeats the steps if the path distance is too long. Ghosts cannot initiate long roams outside their favourite rooms, except for Mare and Banshee. **When the ghost chooses to perform a roam, the chances for a short roam or a long roam are based on the "Roaming frequency" difficulty setting: ***Low: 90% for a short roam, 10% for a long roam ***Medium: 80% for a short roam, 20% for a long roam ***High: 70% for a short roam, 30% for a long roam **Short roams have a maximum of 3 metres, and long roams have a maximum of 12 metres *Favourite Room: The ghost returns to its favourite room *Interaction: The ghost interacts with an object nearby *Fuse Box: The ghost turns the fuse box on or off *Ghost Event: The ghost performs a ghost event *Ability: The ghost uses a specified ability, if any *Hunt: The ghost initiates a hunt *D.O.T.S: If the ghost has D.O.T.S Projector evidence, it will occasionally enter this state, and be visible via a D.O.T.S. Projector if it passes through its light It is important to note that certain phenomena often are generally not limited to one single type of ghost. For example, all ghosts can throw objects around in a room, manipulate doors, make Dirty Water appear in sinks, and present itself in any form. However, certain ghosts are more likely to exhibit certain behaviours than others or have unique abilities. For example, a Poltergeist will be more likely to throw objects and can throw several at once. ===Visibility=== In normal gameplay, ghosts are usually invisible and will only physically appear during (manifestation) ghost events and hunts. In a hunt, the ghost will flicker, repeatedly appearing and disappearing at a variable rate. For ghost events, the ghost can be fully visible, appear as a shadow, or have a dark translucent-like appearance. While the possible models a ghost can appear as depends on whether it is a female or male ghost, the ghost's specific model does not matter in determining what type of ghost it is, except for the Banshee and the Dayan, which are only female, and while this can be easily identified through the ghost's name before ever seeing the ghost, seeing its model serves as a good verification check in case of androgynous names. Ghosts with the D.O.T.S Projector evidence can be visible as a D.O.T.S silhouette through a video camera or to the naked eye (except for the Goryo) while passing through a D.O.T.S. Projector's light during a D.O.T.S state. ===Interference=== When a ghost manifests or hunts, all electronic equipment (brought in from the truck), such as flashlights and global chat, will malfunction within a 10-meter radius for most ghosts (15 for the Raiju). Room lights may also flicker at the same distance. ===Sounds=== When a ghost event or hunt occurs, the ghost will produce a vocalization that may differ between ghost events (but not hunts). If it is walking during such events (or walks after stepping in salt), it will also produce footstep sounds. For most ghosts, these sounds can be heard from up to 20 meters away by the player. There are seven male and six female sounds produced by the ghosts during manifestations: {| class=article-table !Male !Female |- | | |}
Every contract, the ghost gets a random but specific hunting sound. In every following hunt it will use the very same sound again. Remembering this sound from a former hunt can help the player tell a hunt apart from a ghost event. Ghosts will also produce a "paranormal sound" (groaning/laughing/talking/whisper) every 80 - 127 seconds (every 64 - 127 seconds for the Myling) that can only be heard through a Parabolic Microphone or a Sound Recorder. These paranormal sounds are different from ghost event/hunt vocalizations. If a player is within 10 meters of the ghost and would be considered "visible" to the ghost when not considering furniture, the player will hear their own heartbeat. Note that this does not necessarily correlate with actual line-of-sight. ==Types of ghosts== There are currently 27 types of ghosts in the game, appearing in the journal in the following order: {| class="article-table" style="text-align: center" style="margin: auto;" | Banshee || Dayan || Deogen |- | Demon || Gallu || Goryo |- | Hantu || Jinn || Mare |- | Moroi || Myling || Obake |- | Obambo || Oni || Onryo |- | Phantom || Poltergeist || Raiju |- | Revenant || Shade || Spirit |- | Thaye || The Mimic || The Twins |- | Wraith || Yokai || Yurei |}
All ghosts have an equal chance of being chosen per contract in all difficulties, except the Deogen, that will not be chosen if the host is below Prestige 0, Level 30. Otherwise, it is normal and expected for the number of ghosts encountered by type to vary, the sums of which will roughly be shaped like a bell curve graph with an increasing number of rounds played. Historically, newly added ghosts had an increased chance of being chosen during the first few weeks of their introduction. Depending on its type, the ghost will have unique strengths and weaknesses. The following table summarizes these: {| class="fandom-table" !Ghost type !Strengths !Weaknesses |- !Banshee |Will target a chosen player, assuming said player is inside.
Increased chance of performing a singing ghost event. |Has several distinctive wails on the Parabolic Microphone and the Sound Recorder. |- !Dayan |Moves faster when a player moves near the Dayan. |Moves slower when a player stands still near the Dayan. |- !Demon |Incense is less effective, preventing a hunt for less time.
Can rarely initiate a hunt at any sanity level. |Crucifix range is 50% larger than placement range indicator. |- !Deogen |Always knows where the player is during a hunt and moves very quickly toward its victim. |Moves extremely slowly once near its victim. |- !Gallu |Becomes aggressive when protective equipment is used. |Becomes less aggressive after a hunt. |- !Goryo |Can only enter a D.O.T.S. state when no player is in the same room.

50/50 chance of the ghost being either male or female, except for the Banshee and the Dayan which will always be female. ===Length of death=== The length of death of a ghost (i.e. the age it would be today if it were still alive) is a randomly generated number between 50 (overlapping with their death age between 50 and 90) and 1000 years. ===Age=== The age of the ghost (at their time of death) is a randomly generated number between 10 and 90 years. Note that this is not correlated with the ghost model. ===Spirit box responsiveness=== If the ghost is indicated to respond only to "people who are alone", the ghost will only respond to the Spirit Box if there is only one player in the room when the question is asked. A ghost which responds to everyone means that the number of people in the room does not affect its ability to respond. This characteristic is not indicated if there is no setup time (e.g., on Professional and Nightmare difficulties). This characteristic is only relevant for ghosts with the Spirit Box evidence, and is not synonymous with ghost activity. ===Ghost's name=== The name of the ghost consists of their first (given) name and a surname. content: EMF Level 5 (or EMF 5) is a piece of evidence used to determine the type of ghost haunting the location. ==Mechanics== When a ghost with EMF Level 5 as one of its evidences interacts with the environment, each EMF reading will have a 33% chance to be an EMF 5 emission instead of EMF 2 or EMF 3, which can be detected and confirmed with an EMF Reader. This applies to any action that will normally create EMF 2 or EMF 3, such as interactions, (some) abilities and so on. It does not apply to EMF 4. ===Rewards=== Recording the sound of an EMF Level 5 will yield an EMF 5 Reading sound in the journal, rewarding up to $12 and 12 XP, depending on the tier of the Sound Recorder and whether there is a Unique stamp. ==Possible ghosts== {| class="article-table" |Dayan |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |Spirit Box |- |Gallu |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |Spirit Box |- |Goryo |EMF Level 5 |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ultraviolet |- |Jinn |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |- |Myling |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |- |Obake |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |Ultraviolet |- |Oni |EMF Level 5 |D.O.T.S. Projector |Freezing Temperatures |- |Raiju |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |D.O.T.S. Projector |- |Shade |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |- |Spirit |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |The Twins |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |- |Wraith |EMF Level 5 |D.O.T.S. Projector |Spirit Box |} ==Tips== ===Increasing interactions=== EMF 5 is a random chance, so one would want to increase the chance of the ghost interacting with the environment. One can place some props in the ghost room for the ghost to throw. Make sure to turn off the room lights, as ghosts cannot throw items if the lights in its current room are on. Smudging the ghost or saying recognised phrases near the ghost can mildly increase the chance/rate of interactions. ===EMF from the Site Activity Monitor=== It is possible to "guess" EMF Level 5 as an evidence using the site activity monitor, though this is not guaranteed. This is because the site activity monitor is an approximate representation of the total EMF currently present in the map, with a modifier of 0, -1 or -2 for each EMF generated. Hence, EMF level 5 can be "guessed" if multiple straight-line jumps of 4 and 5 levels are observed, especially if no players are currently inside the investigation area. Though an EMF 5 emission can be represented by an activity change of 3 levels, an EMF 3 is just as likely to do the same, so a jump of 3 levels is generally ignored. Some occurrences may also show up as jumps of 4 or 5 levels; avoid erroneously taking these to represent EMF 5: *A ghost event, which generates EMF 4. Hunts also always generate EMF 4 but this is rarely observed *The Poltergeist's multi-throw ability *Using cursed possessions to force interactions or ghost events, resulting in two EMF 2/3 interactions happening within the same second, or EMF 4 from ghost events and hunts *A hunt ending, sometimes causing a jump from level 10 to level 5/6 *In general, interactions occurring very close to each-other Either way, using an EMF Reader is a far more reliable way of verifying EMF 5 as a piece of evidence. ==See also== *Objectives Category:Evidence fr:EMF niveau 5 ru:Детектор ЭМП (ур. 5)
title: EMF Level 5

content: The Gallu is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. It is known to become faster during hunts when players use protective equipment against it such as crucifixes or incense. ==Behavior== ===Activity=== The Gallu cannot disturb salt piles while in its enraged state. ===Ability=== The Gallu has three states it can switch to: "normal", "enraged", and "weakened". By default, it starts in the normal state, where it behaves like a standard ghost. It will change from the normal state to the enraged state or from the weakened state to the normal state: *instantly after burning a crucifix *instantly after the end of the incense's blinding effect during a hunt *after a duration equal to the last blinding effect from an incense after being affected by incense outside of a hunt **instantly if no incense were used during any previous hunts **4 seconds if the Gallu was last blinded while in an enraged state **5 seconds if the Gallu was last blinded while in a normal state **6 seconds if the Gallu was last blinded while in a weakened state *2 seconds after stepping in salt if its current state is "normal" *3 seconds after stepping in salt if its current state is "weakened" The state changes cannot be queued. For example, a weakened Gallu stepping in a second salt pile 1 second after stepping into the first one will not make it change into the enraged state 1 second after changing into the normal state. ===Hunt=== If a hunt ends while the Gallu is in its enraged state, it will instantly switch to the weakened state. The following table lists the Gallu's behavior depending on its current state: {| class="article-table" |+ !Behavior !Normal state !Enraged state !Weakened state |- !Hunt sanity threshold |50% |60% |40% |- !Crucifix range |Standard | -2 meters | +1 meter |- !Hunt base speed |1.7 m/s |1.955 m/s |1.36 m/s |- !Incense's blinding effect |5 seconds |4 seconds |6 seconds |} ==Evidence== ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Using protective equipment pushes the ghost to become enraged, weakening equipment effects. Weakness: Being enraged exhausts the Gallu, making protective equipment more effective. ==Strategies== One should exercise extreme caution with the Gallu, especially when collecting any evidence. As the Gallu has Ultraviolet evidence, the player may be prompted to confirm Ultraviolet or collect extra media using salt, which if stepped in, will cause the Gallu to enter its enraged state. Note that the tier of salt does not matter; the tier 1 salt is able to cause the ghost to enter its enraged state, even if it realistically has no effect on the ghosts' hunting ability entirely. However, this behaviour can also be used as an advantage in identifying the Gallu. As it is unable to step on salt piles once it is in an enraged state, this can help narrow down a Gallu greatly by taking note if the ghost only stepped on one pile of salt and no more, even if it had walked through the latter. Be careful to not confuse this with a Wraith, which can also not step on any salt and also shares two evidence types with the Gallu, that being Spirit Box and EMF Level 5. If you used an Incense near the ghost, or had a Crucifix be used recently before any salt was tested, then a Gallu should be considered if the salt has not been stepped in at all. ==Trivia== *In Mesopotamian and Sumerian mythology, a gallu (or galla) is a demon or devil from the underworld. It was known for dragging people into the underworld until it was appeased by animal sacrifice, most noted in the story of Inanna's journey to the underworld. *With line-of-sight (LOS) acceleration, the Gallu can achieve a top speed of 3.23 m/s in its enraged state, making it the joint second fastest ghost in the game behind the Moroi (3.71 m/s) and tied with the Obambo. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.15.1.0 |Added Gallu. |} ==Notes== fr:Gallu Category:Ghosts
title: Gallu

In Phasmophobia, death results either from being caught by the ghost during a hunt, obtaining The Hanged Man tarot card, or by chance from using the Monkey Paw's revival wish. ==Mechanics== ===Player's death=== When a player dies, all their equipment is dropped onto the ground and grotesque hands appear on their screen suggesting the player is being choked, for about 5 seconds. The player is then teleported to an otherworldly room with the ghost itself standing under a light, both standing around hanged corpses for about 5 more seconds. The light then shatters, the room goes dark, and the hanged corpses twitch slightly. Finally, the dead player teleports back to the location where they died, in form of an observer (see below). The whole process takes about 10 seconds. From another player's perspective, the victim drops their equipment, brings their hands to their neck while writhing from being strangled by an invisible force with a choking sound, and drops dead. ===Observer=== An observer will see the map through a greyish fog and can only communicate with other observers, though they can still hear the living (which may sound incorrectly muffled due to a bug), including the global chat radio. Observers will be able to phase through all forms of doors, even if they are locked. Ghosts will ignore dead players. Motion Sensors will be triggered if an observer walks past them. Observers can sprint infinitely, unlike regular players which run out of breath after a few seconds and have to "recharge" (unless the "Sprint duration" difficulty setting is set to infinite). Observers cannot pick up or interact with equipment or any other investigation-sensitive items (such as bones or cursed possessions). However, they can still pick up decorative items found around the map (dishes, notebooks, shoes, etc). ===Reviving a dead player=== If a living player draws a Tarot Card labeled The High Priestess, one dead player will randomly be chosen to be revived. The dead player will reappear at the location of their Dead Body (even if they were outside the investigation before being resurrected). Otherwise, the observer will remain as one until the game ends. The Monkey Paw can also be used to revive an existing dead player, but with a 50% chance of killing the wisher at the same time. If a player dies and revives in the same hunt, they cannot be killed again for that hunt (i.e. the player cannot die twice in the same hunt). ===End of the round=== If all players in the round die, the game will end shortly after the last player returns as an observer. ==Post-mortem== While dead, players may still help the investigation in the following manner: *Players can attempt to use random items to interact with the other living players. They can turn their attention to themselves if they find the Bone Evidence or if they know any useful information e.g. approximately where the ghost will spawn for its next hunt, or what type of ghost it is. **Items held by dead players vary in visibility depending on their current platform. When playing on desktop, items are invisible when held and only reveal themselves when thrown or placed down. If, however, the dead player is in VR, the held item is always visible to their teammates, and manifests as floating in midair. Clever players can use this to more accurately convey ideas, and, in some cases "write" out simple words in air gestures. ===Pranking & griefing=== Naturally, there is nothing preventing malicious players from also acting in bad faith; they can make deliberate attempts to prank, confuse, or otherwise lightly sabotage investigation post-mortem with their limited abilities. Since throwing items as an observer does not trigger a sound to the living survivors, imitating the ghost throwing items is not possible. However, throwing a ball down the stairs may confuse the remaining players about the ghost's location. As observers are capable of tripping motion sensors, they can potentially confuse living players about the ghost's real location. They may also move and place miscellaneous items such as dolls and teddy bears in key locations like doorways so as to appear to be stalking the remaining investigators. However, as the ghost is incapable of such specific behaviour, experienced players can quickly discern what is a ghost interaction/event and what is the work of another player. ==Post-game rewards== If the player is still dead when the round ends (and not revived by Tarot Cards), the difficulty multiplier will not be applied, and their rewards will be halved instead. They will also lose any equipment that they added to the game, instead receiving a percentage of the total value of the items that they added, depending on the difficulty multiplier. {| class="article-table" |+Insurance !Difficulty!!Percentage of Value |- |Amateur
Difficulty with multiplier ≤ 1x |50% |- |Intermediate
Difficulty with multiplier ≤ 2x |25% |- |Professional
Nightmare
Insanity
Difficulty with multiplier > 2x |0% |} ==See also== *Dead Body ==References== Category:Gameplay fr:Décès

content: D.O.T.S Projector is a type of evidence in Phasmophobia, used to determine which ghost is haunting a location. It is detected by placing a D.O.T.S. Projector in close proximity of a ghost, and allowing it to pass through it. ==Mechanics== Ghosts with D.O.T.S evidence will occasionally enter a "D.O.T.S state". During this, a faint silhouette of the ghost will be visible only when it passes through the laser grid. The ghost will also walk towards the nearest player if there is one in the same room, or towards a random waypoint if no players are nearby. While these silhouettes are visible to the naked eye (unless the ghost is a Goryo), a video camera with night vision may allow for better visibility. This also means that D.O.T.S can be tracked simultaneously alongside Ghost Orbs. Dead players cannot see the D.O.T.S state by any means. ===Ghost-specific abilities=== ====Banshee==== The Banshee will try to walk towards its targeted player, even if another player is closer to it. ====Goryo==== If the ghost is a Goryo, the silhouette will not be visible to the naked eye and can only be seen when the following two conditions are fulfilled: *There are no players in the same room as the Goryo when it enters a D.O.T.S state *The D.O.T.S silhouette must be viewed with a video camera One way to look for this behaviour is to view the projector from outside the room; if it is visible on the camera but not to the naked eye, the ghost is likely a Goryo. ====Phantom==== The Phantom will physically disappear if a photo or a video of it is taken while in a D.O.T.S state. ===Rewards=== The D.O.T.S silhouette can be photographed or video recorded, and will show up as D.O.T.S. Ghost in the journal. Both the photo and the video can reward up to $12 and 12 XP depending on the equipment tier and whether there is a Unique stamp. The photo will complete the "Capture a photo of the Ghost" objective and the video will complete the "Capture a video of a Ghost" objective. Because of the nature of the D.O.T.S silhouette and the ghost's tendency to move toward the nearest player, the D.O.T.S Ghost video recording is exceedingly hard to get. ==Potential ghosts== {| class="article-table" |Banshee |D.O.T.S Projector |Ultraviolet |Ghost Orb |- |Deogen |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |Goryo |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |- |Obambo |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Writing |Ultraviolet |- |Oni |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Phantom |D.O.T.S Projector |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |- |Raiju |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |EMF Level 5 |- |Thaye |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |Ghost Writing |- |Wraith |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |- |Yokai |D.O.T.S Projector |Spirit Box |Ghost Orb |- |Yurei |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |Freezing Temperatures |} ==Tips== *When two D.O.T.S fields overlap, the illuminated ghost may fail to be captured on camera and result in 'blank' photos. When this happens, turn one D.O.T.S. projector off or space them further apart. Category:Evidence ru:Лазерный проектор (Улика)
title: D.O.T.S. Projector (Evidence)

Cursed possessions are a group of seven powerful, supernatural items that are used to directly interface with the ghost. They can make the ghost appear or provide information, generally at the cost of sanity. These items are the Music Box, Ouija Board, Voodoo Doll, Haunted Mirror, Summoning Circle, Monkey Paw, and Tarot Cards. Activating or using a cursed possession will immediately cancel the setup phase. ==Mechanics== On all default difficulties, except Insanity, one cursed possession is selected at random for every contract. Each item has one dedicated spawn location on a given map. On most maps these spawn locations are scattered around the map, while on a few (namely Brownstone High School, Prison, and Sunny Meadows), they are all within just one room. The use of cursed possessions is not mandatory. All objectives can be completed without them, and only a handful of Daily and Weekly Tasks require them outright. Cursed possessions grant players a level of control over the investigative process and the overall flow of a mission, but come with the risk of causing a hunt. *The Music Box causes the ghost to sing, broadcasting its current location. *The Haunted Mirror provides a view into the Ghost Room. *The Ouija Board permits players to ask the ghost various questions. *The Summoning Circle teleports the ghost to the circle. *The Tarot Cards provokes various ghost activities. *The Voodoo Doll forces the ghost to perform interactions. *The Monkey Paw grants the player various wishes to call upon. Cursed possessions generally only work while the player is in the investigation area. All, except for the Summoning Circle and Ouija Board, must be picked up in order to be activated. Cursed possessions require a free hand to pick up, and cannot be stored in the inventory. Instead they drop to the ground when switching to a different item, like the Tripod. The Summoning Circle is the only item that is immovable, and must be interacted with by using either an igniter or a lit firelight. A photo can be taken of each spawned cursed possession in a contract. Photos reward up to $7 and 7 XP depending on the tier of the Photo Camera and whether there is a Unique stamp. ===Enabling the "Friendly ghost" option=== On Custom difficulty setting, when the "Friendly ghost" option is enabled, no hunt will occur after any of the following situations that would normally cause them: *When the "Death" tarot card is drawn *When the haunted mirror, music box, and Ouija board breaks *When the heart pin of the voodoo doll is pushed in or when all pins are pushed in at once at 0% sanity *When the summoning circle-triggered ghost event ends *When the "I wish to see the ghost" and "I wish to trap the ghost" effects end, and when "I wish for knowledge" is asked of the Monkey Paw Additionally, "The Hanged Man" tarot card cannot be drawn, except for "The Fool" version. All other effects of these cursed possessions work as normal with the setting enabled. ==Related difficulty settings== *Cursed Possessions quantity: The number of Cursed Possessions available *Cursed Possession #1 - #7: Enables the player to select the cursed possession(s), if desired ==Objectives and tasks== *Weekly task: Use cursed possessions ==Gallery== Tanglewood-Music2.png|The Music Box in 6 Tanglewood Drive. Ouija edgefield utility.png|The Ouija Board in 42 Edgefield Road. Grafton-Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror in Grafton Farmhouse. Willow-Circle.png|The Summoning Circle in 13 Willow Street. Prison-Doll.png|The Voodoo Doll in Prison. Maple-rework-tarot-cards.png|The Tarot Cards in Maple Lodge Campsite. Sunny Meadows Monkey Paw.png|The Monkey Paw in Sunny Meadows. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.5.0 |Added or changed various equipment to form the group of cursed possessions. |- !0.5.0.2 |Cursed possessions can no longer be used outside the investigation area. |- !0.5.1.0 |Each cursed possession now only has one spawn location per map. |}

content: The flashlight is an essential piece of equipment that is used to illuminate the area, usually in front of the player. ==Usage== on an equipped flashlight will provide a small conical range of light to improve visibility of the environment. The flashlight can also be put on the shoulder by to another item, allowing its use offhand. When on the shoulder, the flashlight can be turned on or off by pressing the key. Non-VR players can carry only one flashlight at a time, while VR players can have any number of flashlights held or placed onto the toolbelt. Illuminated flashlights will continue providing light from the hips until a player manually turns it off. While on the toolbelt, emitted light will track the player's head movement. Up to 4 flashlights can be brought on a single contract. One flashlight is always provided per contract as a starter equipment. During a hunt, a flashlight will rapidly flicker if a ghost is within 10 metres (15 metres if it is a Raiju) and on the same floor. Like other electronic equipment, carrying a lit flashlight within 7.5 metres of the ghost during a hunt on the same floor will attract it. ==Tips== *Extra flashlights can be dropped within dark areas of the map to provide illumination that remains unaffected by the state of the fuse box (though is subject to electronic interference during a hunt). This may be helpful if a ghost tampers with the lights and/or fuse box frequently. ==Gallery== <gallery> File:Phasmophobia flashlight old vs new.png|thumb|Pre-0.3.0 flashlight vs its subsequent updated model File:Flashlight tier comparison.png|thumb|Comparison of the 3 tiers of flashlights on 6 Tanglewood Drive </gallery> ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !rowspan="2" |0.3.0 |Changed the flashlight model. |- |Changed the light color to yellowish. |- !0.9.0 |The Flashlight now has 3 tiers. |- !0.9.3.0 |Flashlight III Upgrade now costs $3000 (up from $2500). |} Category:Equipment Category:Starter Equipment fr:Lampe de poche ru:Фонарик
