content: Evidence is used to determine which ghost is haunting the location. Each ghost has a unique combination of three pieces of evidence that determines which ghost is present. Each player can record pieces of evidence that has been uncovered in the Journal to thin down the possible ghosts, and determine the ghost once all three piece of evidence are collected. ==Types of evidence== There are currently seven unique pieces of evidence in the game that can be used to identify a ghost: {| class="article-table" | EMF Level 5 :Get a level 5 reading on the EMF Reader |- | D.O.T.S Projector :Witness a ghostly disturbance within D.O.T.S Projector lights |- | Ultraviolet :Uncover finger, hand, or footprints with the UV Light |- | Freezing Temperatures :Get a reading below 0°C/32°F on a Thermometer |- | Ghost Orb :See floating orbs on video (through Video Camera, Video Feed, or Head Gear) |- | Ghost Writing :Have a ghost write in a Ghost Writing Book that's been placed down |- | Spirit Box :Hear a reply on a Spirit Box after asking the ghost a question |} ==Ghost evidence== By default, each ghost can give 3 types of evidence. On Nightmare difficulty, each ghost can only provide 2 types of evidence, meaning at the start of the contract, the game will randomly choose 2 types, and the remaining type will be hidden (unobtainable). Similarly, Insanity difficulty causes each ghost to only give 1 type of evidence, with the other 2 being hidden. The 'Evidences given' option for a custom difficulty can also be changed for the ghost to give 0, 1, 2, or 3 types of evidence. {| class="article-table sortable wikitable" style="text-align: center" given' option is set to 1 or 2), they will not be hidden and will always be one of the ghost's given evidences. This does not apply if the 'Evidences given' option is set to 0. The Mimic will always produce Ghost Orbs in addition to its chosen evidences. This works differently from the above "forced" evidences, as none of the Mimic's usual evidences (Spirit Box, Ultraviolet, and Freezing Temperatures) are guaranteed to appear when 'Evidences given' is 1 or 2, while the extra Ghost Orbs are always present even when 'Evidences given' is 0. ==Trivia== *It is not required to update all of the evidence options if the ghost has already been conclusively determined; simply selecting the correct type of ghost is sufficient. *During the development of Phasmophobia, the presence of bugs was planned to be an evidence. .]] An exit door is a physical barrier, often in the form of a door, that separates the safe area (usually the "outside") from the investigation area of any given map. == Mechanics == Each map will have at least one exit door, with the truck located in a way that allows the player to walk directly to it. Some maps contain more than one exit door, which may or may not be directly accessible from the truck. In Maple Lodge Campsite and Camp Woodwind, the exit door is a set of wooden gates as opposed to a building door. The main door key must first be obtained to unlock the door. When any exit door is opened for the first time, the setup phase will begin and the ghost will "activate". As soon as a player steps inside the investigation area, their sanity can become affected. When a ghost begins to hunt, all exit doors will automatically close and become locked, indicated with a distinctive locking sound followed by a door "slam" sound, preventing players from leaving the investigation area. On top of the locked door, an invisible barrier will also form at all exit doors. This barrier forms the instant the ghost initiates a hunt, which is sooner than the door's closing animation. They will remain locked until the hunt ends, after which they will automatically become unlockable, but remain closed. Already locked exit doors do not make sound upon the beginning of a hunt. The ghost may close (but not lock) exit doors during ghost events if the player who "activated" the event is in a room that connects to an exit door. The Yurei can also close the door without a ghost event or hunt by using its ability. Otherwise, ghosts cannot interact with exit doors normally. ==Trivia== * Items, as well as equipment, can be thrown through doors at any time, even while closed or locked. * If the player glitches into the investigation area without unlocking the exit door for the first time, the ghost will remain inactive, and will not hunt, perform ghost events, or provide most evidences (apart from Ghost Orbs). *Exit doors can show a handprint. For this to happen, the ghost must be The Mimic, it must be mimicking a Yurei, and it must use the door-closing ability on the exit door. Hence, this occurrence is extremely rare. == Gallery == Grafton Exit Door.png|The exit door on Grafton Farmhouse. Maple Exit Door.png|The exit door on Maple Lodge Campsite. == History == {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !23 March 2020 |Exit doors will now become locked during hunts. |}

content:
Difficulties in Phasmophobia adjust the player experience according to their skill. There are five main difficulties in Phasmophobia: Amateur, Intermediate, Professional, Nightmare, and Insanity. Custom difficulties can also be created. Difficulties impact the player, the ghost, and the contract, giving out varying rewards. ==Difficulties== - Intermediate=
"The standard Ghost Huntin' experience"
This difficulty is for the average player who has a good knowledge of the game's mechanics. *Unlocked at level 10 *2x rewards *2-minute setup time *1.5x sanity consumption *Common ghost activity *Medium hunting phase *Sanity Medication restores 35% of sanity *Few doors will start open *25% value of lost items returned to dead players *The fuse box will be off at the start of the game *Some hiding locations will be blocked - Professional=
"For experienced Ghost Hunters"
This difficulty is for experienced players who have a relatively strong foundation in the core mechanics, ghosts, and strategies needed to complete the investigation. *Unlocked at level 20 *3x rewards *No setup time *2x sanity consumption *Uncommon ghost activity *Long hunting phase *Sanity Medication restores 30% of sanity *0% value of lost items returned to dead players *The Fuse Box will be off at the start of the game *The objective board will not specify if the ghost responds to everyone or people who are alone *The ghost room will change rarely *Some doors will start open *Most hiding locations will be blocked - Nightmare=
"A challenge for the best of the best"
This difficulty is a challenge aimed solely at players who know the game's mechanics inside-out, have strong practical experience in ghost hunting, and have a solid strategy or action plan, especially in teams. *Unlocked at level 30 *4x rewards *No setup time *2x sanity consumption *Uncommon ghost activity *Longest hunting phase *Sanity Medication restores 25% of sanity *0% value of lost items returned to dead players *The fuse box will be off at the start of the game *The Objective Board will not specify if the ghost responds to everyone or people who are alone *The ghost room will change occasionally *The Sanity Monitor and Site Activity Monitor will be damaged and display random values *Almost all hiding locations will be blocked *Many doors will start open *The fuse box is not shown on the truck map *A successful kill will extend the hunting phase, allowing multiple kills in a single hunt *The ghost will only provide 2 pieces of evidence instead of 3 - Insanity=
"Feeling brave? These ghosts don't mess around..."
This difficulty is an extremely hard challenge solely aimed at players that have mastered the mechanics of the game from top to bottom. Players must have knowledge of all ghost strengths, weaknesses, abilities and behaviors and have knowledge on many hunting and escape tactics on the maps. *Unlocked at level 40 *6x rewards *No setup time *No Cursed Possession *Sanity starts at 75% *2x sanity consumption *Uncommon ghost activity *Longest hunting phase *Sanity Medication restores 20% of sanity *0% value of lost items returned to dead players *The fuse box will be off at the start of the game *The fuse box is not shown on the truck map *The Objective Board will not specify if the ghost responds to everyone or people who are alone *The ghost room will change frequently *The Sanity Monitor and Site Activity Monitor will be damaged and display random values *Almost all hiding locations will be blocked *Many doors will start open *A successful kill will extend the hunting phase *The ghost will only provide 1 piece of evidence *Fingerprints last for 60 seconds - Challenge Mode= A unique difficulty with a customised equipment loadout and possibly other difficulty changes is available every week. There are currently 26 possible challenge mode difficulties. Free equipment is provided specifically for Challenge Mode. Completing a Challenge Mode difficulty on a specified map 3 times before the difficulty changes rewards the player with $5000 and 5000 XP. - Custom=
Unlocked at level 50, this difficulty lets the player choose the settings for the contract, with up to 3 custom difficulties that can be saved. content: The D.O.T.S Projector is a piece of electronic starter equipment, as well as a type of evidence, that can be used to reveal the ghost's movement. ==Usage== The D.O.T.S Projector can be on a wall or floor similar to a motion sensor. It emits a matrix of bright green laser points in a small area from the projector. Tier I D.O.T.S Projector additionally can be held and to create a cone of D.O.T.S light where it is pointed. The Tier I D.O.T.S Projector will not work if Flashlights are turned off in custom difficulty settings. Ghosts with D.O.T.S evidence will occasionally enter a "D.O.T.S state". During this, a faint silhouette of the ghost will be visible only when it passes through the laser grid. The ghost will also walk towards the nearest player if there is one in the same room, or towards a random waypoint if no players are nearby. While these silhouettes are visible to the naked eye (unless the ghost is a Goryo), a video camera with night vision may allow for better visibility. This also means that D.O.T.S can be tracked simultaneously alongside Ghost Orbs. Dead players cannot see the D.O.T.S state by any means. Though the D.O.T.S Projector is an electronic equipment, only the Tier I D.O.T.S. Projector when activated and held will attract the ghost to the player during a hunt, and they are otherwise safe to hold onto. ===Rewards=== The D.O.T.S silhouette can be photographed or video recorded, and will show up as D.O.T.S. Ghost in the journal. Both the photo and the video can reward up to $12 and 12 XP depending on the equipment tier and whether there is a Unique stamp. The photo will complete the "Capture a photo of the Ghost" objective and the video will complete the "Capture a video of a Ghost" objective. Because of the nature of the D.O.T.S silhouette and the ghost's tendency to move toward the nearest player, the D.O.T.S Ghost video recording is exceedingly hard to get. ==Tips== * A good way to see the D.O.T.S silhouette clearly is to have the room lights turned off and use a video camera with night vision on, then look either directly through the video camera screen or the computer. This will increase the silhouette's contrast against the background. Having two D.O.T.S Projectors placed can allow the silhouette to be visible for longer as it moves across the lighting radius. * If the favourite room is small, consider placing the D.O.T.S Projector in a neighbouring room to aid visibility. * The Projector emits a substantial amount of light when placed. Investigators can use them for illumination, especially with a spare Projector or when D.O.T.S evidence can be safely crossed off. Note that the D.O.T.S projector light does not mitigate sanity drain. * The Tier II and III D.O.T.S Projectors can be placed on some ceilings in a few maps, which may allow the light to cover a room with much more consistency. This is especially useful for the tier III projector, whose sweeping motions and cone-shaped light area can cause the ghost to potentially leave its light prematurely depending on the ghost's and the projector's movement. * The green light emitted may obscure nearby fingerprints or footprints; look carefully or remove the projector when checking for ultraviolet evidence. *Some visual effects such as freezing breath or Incense smoke will reflect the D.O.T.S Projector's light. Be careful to not confuse them with a D.O.T.S silhouette. *There is currently a bug where the ghost can initiate a ghost event or a hunt while in "D.O.T.S state". This will make the ghost entirely invisible and nearly quiet (footsteps will not be heard) outside of a D.O.T.S. Projector's range. *The tier III D.O.T.S Projector emits a constant motor whirring sound when active, which can both be quite annoying and interfere with the player's hearing when trying to listen for ghost activity. If you press when pointing at the projector, it will stop in its current position, allowing it to operate in complete silence at the cost of covering a smaller area; interacting again will turn it off completely, and interacting a third time will turn it back on again. *When two D.O.T.S fields overlap, the illuminated ghost may fail to be captured on camera and result in 'blank' photos. When this happens, turn one D.O.T.S. projector off or space them further apart. ==Gallery== <gallery> File:DOTS090_T1_animation.gif|A ghost moving through a Tier 1 D.O.T.S Projector. File:DOTS090_animation_videocamera.gif|A ghost moving through a Tier 3 D.O.T.S Projector, seen via the truck's video feed. File:D.O.T.S - Avatar Frame.png|"D.O.T.S" Avatar Frame for Steam </gallery> ==Possible ghosts== {| class="article-table" |Banshee |D.O.T.S Projector |Ultraviolet |Ghost Orb |- |Deogen |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |Goryo |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |- |Obambo |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Writing |Ultraviolet |- |Oni |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Phantom |D.O.T.S Projector |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |- |Raiju |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |EMF Level 5 |- |Thaye |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |Ghost Writing |- |Wraith |D.O.T.S Projector |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |- |Yokai |D.O.T.S Projector |Spirit Box |Ghost Orb |- |Yurei |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Orb |Freezing Temperatures |} ==Trivia== *D.O.T.S stands for "Detector Of The Supernatural". *The D.O.T.S Projector is inspired by the XBOX Kinect scene in the film Paranormal Activity 4. *The D.O.T.S Projector as referenced in game forgets to add an extra "." as in D.O.T.S. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Added D.O.T.S Projector. |- !0.3.0.1 |Increased the interaction rate with the D.O.T.S Projector. |- !0.3.0.2 |The ghost will now move through the DOTS Projector at different speeds each time. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.3.0.3 |D.O.T.S Projectors now emit sounds randomly rather than when the ghost interacts with it. |- | D.O.T.S Projectors no longer produce an EMF reading. |- !0.3.1.0 |Dead players can no longer see D.O.T.S Projector figures. |- ! rowspan="4" |0.9.0 |The D.O.T.S. Projector now has 3 tiers. |- |Ghosts with DOTS evidence can now enter a short “DOTS state”; where they are temporarily visible with infrared light, during this time they will wander towards the nearest player before disappearing (if the player is in the same room). |- |You will no longer get duplicate DOTS ghosts, or DOTS triggering during events, hunts or other interactions, as DOTS. |- |DOTS Ghost photos now count as normal ghost photos. |- !0.9.0.1 |DOTS T1 is now placeable on most surfaces like Firelights. |- !0.9.3.0 |Lowered the volume of DOTS Projector III. |- ! rowspan="2"|0.10.0 |Increased the light range for tier I. |- |Tier III's scanning effect can now be paused by interacting with it while it is rotating. |} ==References== Category:Equipment Category:Evidence fr:Projecteur D.O.T.S. ru:Лазерный проектор

An Electro-Magnetic Field (short: EMF) is emitted whenever the ghost interacts with its environment. EMF can be read by the EMF Reader, allowing players to deduce the ghost's activities from the EMF Level indicated by the reader. ==EMF emissions== When the ghost performs certain interactions or enters a certain state, it will generate an EMF reading at a certain location depending on the type of action performed. There are four types of EMF emissions: interaction, throwing, manifestations, and evidence. {| class="wikitable" |+ ! EMF Level !! Ghost Activity |- !1 |None, default state |- !2 |Interacting with an object
Using an ability |- !3 |Throwing an object |- !4 |Manifestation |- !5 |Evidence (33% chance) |} ===Level 1: Default State=== EMF Level 1 is the default level indicated as soon as the EMF Reader is turned on. It has no further significance. ===Level 2: Interaction=== EMF Level 2 generally indicates that the ghost recently interacted with an object in the surrounding environment: *Interacted with a door (including during ghost events) *Interacted with the fuse box *Interacted with a Ghost Writing Book (writing, not throwing) *Interacted with a light switch (outside of ghost events) *Interacted with an appliance or electronic device such as phones or radios *Interacted with a sink *Interacted with a shower *Interacted with a rocking chair *Interacted with a painting *Knocked on a window *Replied to the Ouija Board *Teleported an object *Triggered a Car Alarm *Used a crucifix *Making the room's light flicker For the above interactions, the EMF reading will be tied to where the object is. The ghost blowing out a firelight will also give off EMF Level 2, though this does not count as a true interaction. EMF Level 2 can also indicate that any of the following ghosts used their ability: *Jinn (lowered sanity of nearby players; read from the fuse box) *Phantom (walking to player; read from the ghost's targeted location when it used its ability) *Poltergeist (multiple item throw; an EMF 3 reading will be created for each item thrown) *Wraith (teleporting to player; read from where the ghost teleported to when it used its ability) ===Level 3: Object throw=== EMF Level 3 indicates that a prop (including the Video Camera or a Ghost Writing Book) was recently thrown by the ghost or knocked a painting off of the wall. The EMF reading will be tied to where the object is. ===Level 4: Manifestation=== EMF Level 4 indicates that the ghost initiated a ghost event, with the source of the reading fixed to where the ghost was when the ghost event started. An EMF level 4 reading is also created at the ghost's position where it started a hunt. This reading is usually not discovered, as the ghost's electronic disturbance generally masks it, but it can be detected if the ghost either moves far enough away or the hunt happens to end before the reading expires. ===Level 5: Evidence=== Each EMF Level 2 or 3 occurrence from any source (except interference) has a 33% chance to show up as Level 5 instead if the ghost has the evidence and it is not hidden. It does not necessarily indicate strong activity or immediate danger to the player. While hunting, the ghost will still produce EMF readings when it interacts with the environment (i.e. touching doors, throwing props), although the malfunctioning caused by its presence will usually prevent reading it. This means that EMF Level 5 readings can be observed if the ghost interacts with something, then moves far enough away for the EMF Reader to stop malfunctioning. While malfunctioning, the EMF Reader cannot show up as EMF Level 5. Category:Evidence fr:EMF

]] Equipment in Phasmophobia is used to determine the type of ghost inhabiting a location, or to complete optional objectives. Players can purchase equipment using money they receive from successful investigations. ==Mechanics== Equipment may be bought or sold in the Shop when in the lobby. When a player dies, they lose all equipment they added to the mission, excluding the default starter equipment that is always provided. Players who stay alive do not have to collect their equipment at the end of a contract to keep them; they will be returned automatically. Items categorized as consumable (e.g. incense and sanity medication) do not need to be bought again if the player remains alive, but if the player uses them, they need to be rebought. Players can buy and store a maximum of 999 of each item. Ghosts disrupt nearby electronic equipment whenever they are visible, such as during a hunt or when they manifest (i.e. become visible while not hunting). Holding active electronic equipment during a hunt will attract nearby ghosts. There are 3 types of equipment: *Starter equipment *Optional equipment *Truck equipment ==Starter equipment== Starter Equipment is available from the very beginning, and one of each of the following will always be freely included on an investigation, though additional pieces may be purchased and added. {| class="fandom-table" !Equipment !Max limit !Description |- |D.O.T.S. Used to detect Ghost Orbs, as well as to make recordings for additional rewards. |- |Flashlight |4 |Provides a basic source of light. |} ==Optional equipment== This equipment must be purchased in the game's shop and will not be given by default. {| class="fandom-table" !Equipment !Max limit !Description |- |Crucifix |2 |Prevents ghosts from hunting in a certain radius. |- |Firelight |4 |Used for optional objectives, and to provide light. |- |Head Gear |4 |Can be equipped on a player's head. content: The firelight is a piece of equipment in Phasmophobia. It is a deployable light source that can be lit using a source of fire such as an igniter or another firelight. It can be used to continuously light up a room with a warm, orange glow, and mitigate sanity drain from darkness, until it eventually burns out. Ghosts tend to blow out nearby firelights, making them effective at checking if a ghost is nearby. ==Usage== ===Lighting firelights=== Players can light a firelight held in their hand by pressing if they have an igniter in their inventory. A firelight placed down can be lit while holding an igniter and pressing . One can also hold a lit firelight, aim at an unlit firelight, and use the Secondary Use key. An unorthodox way is to have the wick of one lit and one unlit firelight to collide (this may need velocity). ===Placement=== Firelights can be down on surfaces. Holding the placement key will show a translucent highlight of the firelight. This will place the firelight upright relative to the surface. Firelights can topple/fall over when placed on a slope or vertically. ===Function=== When a player is within 2 metres of a lit firelight, it will slow passive sanity drain that results from being in the dark, at a rate depending on the firelight's tier level. Lit firelights do not affect sanity drain from other sources such as ghost events or other players dying. Ghosts can blow out firelights at any time, even during hunts, and this will create an EMF 2 reading (or EMF Level 5). When blown out, the firelight will be extinguished with a blowing "sigh" effect. A firelight will also extinguish by itself at the end of its duration which depends on its tier level. Tier I and Tier II firelights will produce smoke when blown out by the ghost or self-extinguishing. Contrary to fire sources, however, ghosts cannot light firelights up. Like with fire sources, when a firelight is lit up for the first time, there will be a 30-second cooldown before the ghost can attempt to blow it out. After the end of that cooldown or on subsequent lightings, a new cooldown is set with a random duration between 20 and 80 seconds. The Onryo can bypass these cooldowns due to its hunt prevention mechanics. *Note that Tier III firelights will pause the current cooldown if they are turned off by the player or an Onryo's hunt attempt. Ghosts have a 66.67% (2/3) chance to blow out a lit firelight provided they are within 5 meters and the cooldown is over. *Tier II firelights are more likely to be blown out due to them having three candles, each rolling the same 66.67% chance and if one of the three chances is successful, all three candles are blown out, roughly making it a 96.30% chance overall. Despite being multiple candles, the tier II firelight still counts as one flame for the Onryo. a lit firelight/one falling with sufficient velocity (Tiers I and II only), placing it in the inventory, leaving it out in heavy rain (Tiers I and II only), or pressing while held in hand will cause it to extinguish. ==Tips== *Placing firelights on the sides of tables, shelves, or other elevated objects may improve their lighting by covering a wider area. *In larger maps like Brownstone High School or Sunny Meadows Mental Institution, firelights may be helpful as navigation markers for important areas such as the fuse box, ghost room, or exit door(s), also providing some helpful sanity drain reduction as a bonus, though they are not as reliable as spare UV lights or flashlights, as firelights both burn out after a time (except for tier III) and can be blown out by the ghost. *As non-electronics, firelights are less affected by hunts (other than potentially being blown out), neither do they attract the ghost. Players may use firelights as constant light sources to navigate during hunts. A potential but generally trivial downside is that it removes a source of alert as to whether the ghost is hunting (or performing ghost events). ==Objectives== {| class="article-table" ! Objective ! Actual requirements |- | Get the Ghost to blow out a Firelight | - |} ==Trivia== *Showers and sinks filled with water do not extinguish firelights. ==History == {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !31 January 2020 |Increased the duration that candles stay lit. |- !23 March 2020 |Candles can now be used to light other candles or Smudge Sticks. |- !7 July 2020 |Increased the candle lighting range, allowing it to prevent passive sanity drain when held. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !23 September 2020 |Candles can now be lit via the Secondary Use key if a lighter is also in the player's inventory. |- !0.3.0 |Updated the candle model. |- !0.4.0 |Candles will now extinguish when thrown or left out in the open in heavy rain. |- !0.7.0 |Candles now extinguish when swapped into the inventory. |- ! rowspan="4" |0.9.0 |Candles were renamed to firelights. |- |The Firelight now has 3 tiers. |- |Light from firelights no longer fully block sanity drain, and instead reduce the rate of it depending on equipment tier. |- |Candles found inside contracts can still be lit, but are no longer grabbable and do not provide any sanity-altering effects. |- ! rowspan="2"|0.10.0 |Increased the light intensity and range for tier I and tier II. |- |Increased the duration for tier I and tier II to 5 minutes and 10 minutes, respectively. |} ==See also == *Summoning Circle ==References== Category:Equipment fr:Lumière à feu ru:Светильник

content: The 0.3.0 update, also known as the Exposition update, is a content update to the game released on 26 August 2021. This update adds a new type of evidence which can be seen through the new D.O.T.S. Projector, new hunt mechanics, as well as an update of nearly all equipment models. == Additions == === Items === ; D.O.T.S. Projector * Serves as new type of evidence * Emits a matrix of bright green laser points around it * Shows a silhouette of the ghost running through the laser matrix if the ghost interacts with it * Can be mounted on the wall or the floor === Ghosts === ; Goryo * When interacting with a D.O.T.S. Projector, will only be visible on a video camera and when no other people are nearby * Roams less than other ghosts * Requires EMF 5, Fingerprints and D.O.T.S. Projector as evidence ; Myling * Makes quieter hunting sounds * Makes paranormal sounds more frequently * Requires EMF 5, Fingerprints and Ghost Writing as evidence === Gameplay === ; Paranormal sounds * Indecipherable whispers of the ghost * Can only be heard by using the Parabolic Microphone === General === * New Head bob option * New post processing effects for CCTV and players == Changes == === Hunts === * Hunting grace period has been shortened from 5 seconds to 3 seconds * The ghost is now invisible during the hunting grace period * Ghosts now have a higher acceleration rate * All electronic equipments are now affected by hunts * Active electronic equipment held in hand within 8 meters of the ghost now alert it of your position during a hunt * Equipment and lights will only be affected within 10 meters of the ghost during a hunt === Ghosts === ; General * All ghost types have their evidences changed * Groaning sound effect has been changed * The lullaby sound effect has been changed * Footsteps when walking can now only be heard via a Parabolic Microphone ; Phantom * If a photo of it is taken while it is visible, it will now show up on the photo === Equipment === ;General * Updated visuals for most equipment ;Candles and Smudge Sticks *New visual effects when used ;Ghost Writing Book * Now has an animation and sound effect when used by the ghost ;Glowsticks * Now glow for 30s before fading over the next 30s ;Motion Sensor * Features from the infrared light sensor have been merged into the motion sensor ;Parabolic Microphone * Can now hear paranormal sounds ;Photo Camera and Video Camera *Now provide footage when the player is holding it ;Salt * Now has an animation when the ghost steps in it ;Spirit Box * New audial responses from the ghost * New icons to replace the text-based indicator for responses === Gameplay === ; Sprinting * Sprinting is now twice as fast * Player may sprint for 3 seconds with a 5 second recharge * Walking speed has been increased to the old sprinting speed ===General=== * Lighting has been improved on every map * New "placement helper object" visuals == Removed features == ;Infrared Light Sensor * Features merged into motion sensor == Bug Fixes == === From versions released before 0.3.0 === * "Show us" phrase no longer makes the ghost interact twice * Fixed a bug where you could mute the Spirit Box static by picking it up with a different object in your hand * Fixed a bug where ghost events would only lower host’s sanity * Fixed a bug where the ghost window knocks were not giving interaction evidence on most windows * Fixed a bug where you could get the ghost to interact with objects with voice recognition in quick succession * Fixed a common multiplayer crash for the host on Asylum in multiplayer * Fixed a bug where you could force the ghost to end the hunt using voice recognition * Fixed a bug where you could get the ghost to interact with objects when you were dead with voice recognition * Fixed a bug where you wouldn't always get a small map on the map selection screen * Fixed a bug where the sensors couldn't be placed in certain doorways * Fixed a bug where picking up sensors too quickly would keep them turned on in your hand. * Fixed occlusion culling issues on several levels * Fixed a bug where Danish and Finnish were in the wrong order in the language selection * Fixed a bug where certain ghost's animations would only play if you are the host * Fixed a bug where equipment sounds were broken when being held by a female character === From 0.3.0 (as fixed in hotfix) === * Fixed a bug where you could click on the ghost writing book to activate it * Fixed a bug where Hungarian and Danish languages were swapped in the settings * Fixed an issue where the celcius text didn't change to fahrenheit on the Thermometer == References == Category:Development fr:0.3.0

The computer is an equipment located on a desk in the truck. ==Usage== By default, the computer displays a screensaver, but when the player approaches it, it displays a live feed of any currently-active camera on the map, including video cameras, Tier I Head Gear, and the location's video feed. When with the computer, players can then select which camera to focus on, or use one of the available buttons at the bottom of the screen. The REC button will start the video recording for the selected camera, the PAN buttons will rotate the camera if placed on a tripod, the NV button will toggle night vision, and the ZOOM buttons will adjust the zooming. The use of the computer in tandem with video cameras allows for the safe gathering of some evidence types: Ghost Orbs, Ghost Writing, Ultraviolet and D.O.T.S. Projector can all be observed through the screen with proper positioning of the camera and the relevant equipment. ==Trivia== *Prior to update 0.29.0, the computer keyboard lacked an "H" key. *Prior to the Exposition Update, the computer was the only way to utilize video cameras, as they did not have their own display feed. *The assets used for the computer can be found here. ==References== Category:Truck Equipment fr:Ordinateur ru:Видеомонитор
title: Computer

content: A dead body is the corpse of a player that was killed by the ghost during a hunt, drew The Hanged Man tarot card or died from the negative effect of the revival wish from the monkey paw. It will usually have a twisted and elongated neck and remain at that player's place of death until the end of the game. ==Mechanics== During the process of death, the player who died will be teleported to the "death room". At the same time, a body will appear with their hands writhing around their neck, before dropping dead. The player can be revived by drawing tarot cards, via the The High Priestess card, or using the Monkey Paw's revival wish (which also has a 50% chance to simultaneously kill the wisher). ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a dead body or filming the death of a player will respectively yield a Dead Body photo rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, and a Dead Body video rewarding up to $12 and 12 XP, depending on the equipment tier and whether there is a Unique stamp. ==Trivia== *Taking a photo of the dead body does not affect the dead player's insurance. *There used to be a bug where taking a photo of the bin outside 42 Edgefield Road would count as a dead body photo. Category:Gameplay fr:Cadavre
title: Dead Body

content: The fuse box, breaker, or generator is found on maps and may be turned on or off to power the lights. Ghosts can also interact with the fuse box. ==Mechanics== Each map will always have one fuse box that will spawn in one of multiple rooms. The location of the fuse box is indicated on the Site Map, except on Nightmare and Insanity difficulties where it is not indicated. The fuse box model differs depending on the type of map. At the beginning of the game, the fuse box is turned on by default in Amateur difficulty and turned off by default in all other difficulties. This can additionally be changed to Broken by using the 'Fuse box at start of contract' setting for Custom difficulties, where sparks will fly out of the fuse box, and it cannot be toggled on. Using the Monkey Paw's 'activity' wish will also break the fuse box. The player can turn on and off the fuse box by: *Opening the cover, then clicking the small switch (Small houses & Farmhouses) *Clicking on the red box (Prison and Brownstone High School) *Clicking on the generator (Campsites) *Clicking on the lever (Sunny Meadows Mental Institution) The fuse box affects the following electrical equipment: *All light switches/sources (including lamps and lanterns) *Televisions *Computers *(Other environmental details or lighting) A direct interaction with the fuse box, whether it be by the ghost or a player, does not change the state of any electrical equipment (light switches will remain in their on/off state). The fuse box can support a maximum number of lights, depending on map size: *Small maps: 9 *Medium maps: 8 *Large maps: 7 This refers to the number of light sources that can be turned on, regardless of their type and their number of bulbs. If the number of light sources turned on is greater than the map's limit, the fuse box will instantly turn off, and all lights will be reset to the off position. Temperature is affected by the fuse box's state. When it is on, the temperature within indoor areas will slowly rise to . When it is off, the temperature will slowly drop to the ambient temperature, which depends on the weather. Outdoor temperatures are not affected. ===Ghost interactions=== When a ghost performs an interaction, it has a chance of interacting with the fuse box remotely. Most ghosts can turn on and off the fuse box. This will generate an EMF Level 2 reading at the fuse box, with a 33% chance for this to be EMF Level 5 for ghosts with this evidence. Where applicable, ghosts can also interact with the fuse box's door. The ghost must be nearby for this to happen. Some ghosts have special interactions or abilities concerning the fuse box: *The Jinn will never turn off the fuse box directly (but it can still trip). If the fuse box is on, the Jinn can: **Chase players in line-of-sight further than 3 metres at a fixed speed of 2.5 m/s **Occasionally use a special ability to drain the sanity of a nearby player by 25% *The Hantu cannot turn on the fuse box and has a doubled chance of turning it off. **If it is hunting while the fuse box is off or broken, it will emit freezing breath near its ghost model's head. ===Related custom difficulty options=== *Fuse box at start of contract: Broken/Off/On *Fuse box visible on map: Off/On (option only shows if 'Fuse box at start of contract' is not set to Broken) ==Gallery== <gallery orientation="Square"> Maple_generator_on_0.4.0.png|The generator for Maple Lodge Campsite. Fusebox legacy.png|A fuse box in Brownstone High School. Fusebox sunnymeadows.png|The fuse box for Sunny Meadows. </gallery> ==Trivia== *The limit on the number of lights was added mainly to prevent low framerates, rather than hindering the player's investigation. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !30 January 2020 |Halved the chance of ghosts turning off the fuse box. |- !12 March 2020 |Increased the chance of ghosts turning off the fuse box. |- !20 March 2020 |Moved the Asylum's fuse box to near the top floor middle elevator. |- !27 May 2020 |The fuse box is now displayed on the Site Map. |- !27 June 2020 |The fuse box now has a random spawn location. |- !30 June 2020 |Decreased the chance of ghosts turning off the fuse box. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.4.0 |The fuse box now has two separate lights to indicate its power state. |- !0.7.0 |Added two new fuse box models for small maps and Sunny Meadows. |- !0.8.0 |The fuse box no longer affects radios. |} ==References== Category:Map Features fr:Disjoncteur
title: Fuse Box

content: A contract, also known as a job or investigation, forms the core component of the game. The player who created the lobby will have the option to choose a difficulty. All players can vote on the map to be played. Not all players have to vote to begin the contract. If there are multiple maps voted on, the map with the most votes wins. If two maps both have the most votes, either map will have an equal chance of being chosen. If the Random option and at least one other map is selected, the selection will automatically narrow down to the remaining map(s) instead of randomisation. Once a map is selected, each player may ready up, allowing the host of the lobby to begin the contract. Once a contract is completed and the truck is closed up, the player(s) will automatically be returned to the lobby. The rewards earned for the contract will be listed, followed by any level-up and unlocks, and the statistics of the contract. If the player leaves the contract without completing it, they will be returned to the main lobby without earning any rewards. Category:Gameplay fr:Contrat ru:Контракт
title: Contract

content: Ultraviolet is a type of evidence created by ghosts that can be used to determine the ghost type. ==Mechanics== Ultraviolet evidence consists of fingerprints and footprints which can be revealed by using a UV Light. ===Fingerprints=== By default, each interaction on a valid surface will always produce a fingerprint. Exceptions include with the Obake which has a 25% chance to hide them, or when using the "Fingerprint chance" custom difficulty modifier to reduce the odds. A ghost with Ultraviolet evidence will leave behind fingerprints when it interacts with the following surfaces or items: *Most types of doors *Light switches and lamps *Windows *Keyboards *TV remotes *Cooler boxes *Mirrors (specific maps only) The Prison map has additional places where fingerprints may be left behind: *On the horizontal surface of a bar of cell doors *On the steel keyhole surface of cell doors Maple Lodge Campsite and Camp Woodwind also have additional places where fingerprints may appear: *Bases of lanterns *Interior edges around large tent door flaps/tops of small tent door flaps *Picnic benchtops *String light poles Lights flickering or interactions caused by ghost events will not result in a fingerprint being left behind in these instances. Depending on the surface area of the object being interacted with, either a fingerprint or a handprint will be visible. Fingerprints will disappear completely after 2 minutes, or 1 minute on Insanity difficulty. This can be changed using a custom difficulty setting. Additionally, the Obake can sometimes use an ability to reduce the remaining time for all existing fingerprints on the map by half. There are 18 different fingerprint patterns, including 3 which are unique to the Obake. When leaving fingerprints on surfaces it touches, an Obake has an approximately 16.7% chance to leave a non-standard pattern: *A handprint with six fingers instead of five *Two fingerprints instead of one on light switches, lamps, and TV remotes *Five fingerprints instead of four on keyboards and Prison doors For each type of door or surface that a fingerprint is possible, the fingerprint will always appear in the same spot. In addition, most doors of the same model will always have the fingerprints on only the push or pull side, but not both. For example, all Farmhouse-style doors will always have the fingerprints on the top-right corner of the door, and only appear on the "push" side. There are a few exceptions to these two rules; for example, one street/road house-style door may have the fingerprint on the "push" side while another identical door has it on the "pull" side, though they will always appear on the middle of the door. ===Footprints=== When a ghost moves any time within 10 seconds after it steps in a salt pile, it will leave a footprint with each step until it stops moving, and each footprint will produce a footstep sound and disappear after 10 to 15 seconds. If the ghost doesn't have Ultraviolet as evidence, or the evidence is hidden, its footprints will be invisible. *The Obake has a 25% chance each step to hide the footprint, creating no footstep sound when successful. Because of the random nature of the game, a ghost may step in a salt pile and choose to stop moving immediately, creating no footprints in that instance. Footprints left by the "lamprey-faced" child ghost model are slightly smaller than those left by other ghost models. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a fingerprint or a footprint that has been charged using a UV Light will respectively yield a photo labelled as Fingerprint or Footprint, each rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Photo Camera and whether there is a Unique stamp. Keep in mind, however, that the prints will slowly fade before becoming completely invisible after the player stops charging them with a UV Light. Invisible prints cannot be photographed and will result in an invalid photo. Each instance of a fingerprint, including repeat fingerprints on the same surface, can only be photographed once. ==Possible ghosts== {|class="article-table" |Banshee |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Orb |- |Demon |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |- |Gallu |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |- |Goryo |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |EMF Level 5 |- |Hantu |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |- |Jinn |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Myling |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |- |Obake |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |- |Obambo |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |D.O.T.S. Projector |- |Phantom |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |Spirit Box |- |Poltergeist |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |The Mimic |Ultraviolet |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |} ==Tips== *Footprints can be useful to check for Ultraviolet evidence if the ghost is not interacting with doors in a timely fashion. *Footprints can sometimes be covered by certain furniture or carpets. *During a hunt, the ghost will almost certainly open and/or close a few doors; scanning doors with a UV Light immediately after a hunt ends can often reveal some fingerprints if the ghost has Ultraviolet as one of its evidence. ==Trivia== *Exit doors can show a fingerprint. For this to happen, the ghost must be The Mimic, it must be mimicking a Yurei, it must use the door-closing ability on the exit door, and the Ultraviolet evidence is not hidden. Hence, this occurrence is very rare. ==Related difficulty settings== *Fingerprint chance (%): The chance of a ghost leaving fingerprints when interacting (only shows when Evidence given is not 0) *Fingerprint duration (s): The duration of fingerprints before they disappear (only shows when Evidence given is not 0) ==History== {|class="fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Early Access Alpha |- !29 January 2020 |Fingerprints now only show on doors that have been interacted with by the ghost rather than being on walls. |- !19 March 2020 |Fingerprints can now appear on windows. |- !11 August 2020 |Fingerprints can now appear on light switches. |- !colspan="2"|Early Access |- !0.2 |Fingerprints can now appear on Prison keyboards. |- !0.3.0 |Updated footprint visuals. |- !rowspan="3"|0.4.0 |Fingerprints now disappear after 60 seconds. |- |Fingerprints are now left only 75% of the time. |- |Added a new fingerprint design for Maple Lodge Campsite. |- !rowspan="3"|0.4.1.0 |Increased the fingerprint duration to 2 minutes. |- |Fingerprints are now left 100% of the time again. |- |Fingerprints can now be found on more surfaces in Maple Lodge Campsite. |- !rowspan="2"|0.6.0 |Added new fingerprint designs. |- |Fingerprints can now appear on house keyboards. |- !rowspan="3"|0.8.1.0 |Fingerprints will now slowly fade out, instead of disappearing instantly. |- |Footprints now fade over time, instead of disappearing instantly. |- |Improved fingerprint and footprint rendering. |- !rowspan="5"|0.9.0 |Renamed Fingerprints evidence to Ultraviolet evidence. |- |Footprints now count as Ultraviolet evidence. |- |Salt will now only reveal footprints if the ghost has Ultraviolet evidence |- |Renamed Footsteps photo to Footprints |- |Footprints will be affected by ghost traits similar to Fingerprints |- !0.10.0 |Ghosts can now leave single fingerprints on all small lamps and TV remotes in all locations |} Category:Evidence fr:Ultraviolet ru:Отпечатки
title: Ultraviolet

content: Doors are map elements that play an important role in Phasmophobia. They are crucial to the game's mechanics and provide help during investigations. ==Types of doors== All maps contain doors of some sort. There are three types of doors in the game: hiding spot (locker/closet/small tent flap), passageway (room/hallway/stall/cell) and exit/entrance. Each of them serves a different purpose. Non-VR players can use the button on a door and move their view in a sweeping manner to open or close the door. VR players can aim for the door to do so. VR players cannot move doors with a non-empty hand. ===Hiding spot doors=== Like the name implies, these doors serve to protect hidden players. Both players and ghosts have to manipulate hiding spot doors in order to open or close them. Ghosts will usually not enter hiding spots when hunting because they don't need to: a ghost can reach out and kill the player just as these doors are in open position. Therefore, the challenge for the players is to keep these doors closed for as much as possible and as long as they remain hidden. ===Passageway doors=== Passageway doors will usually (but not always) delimit a room/area and serve as sight blockers. Unlike players, ghosts can phase through passageway doors, both during and outside of hunts. However, just like with hiding spot doors, ghosts cannot see through passageway doors. The only exception to that is the Deogen, who can set waypoints to the closest player's location, disregarding sight rules. ===Exit doors=== Exit doors can be locked or unlocked by players or the game itself. They separate the "investigation area" from the safe, outdoors sections of the maps, trapping the ghost inside its confines, and additionally trapping players inside the investigation area during hunts. The cabin door on Maple Lodge Campsite or the wing doors in Sunny Meadows Mental Institution are not exit doors, though they can be locked (and in a couple of cases separate indoor and outdoor sections of the map) and are instead passageway doors. ==Gameplay mechanics== All doors are interactable and additional elements to an investigation: *Depending on the difficulty, a random number of doors will be open or ajar at the start of the game. This is important because a wide open passageway door, or several wide open hiding spot doors, tend to indicate the ghost is likely within the immediate area. If many doors are selected to be randomly opened at the start of the game, players will have a harder time finding the ghost through this method. *Since version 0.6.1.0, the ghost will perform special checks to look for players behind open passageway doors. This was done for balancing reasons as to discourage players from hiding behind open doors (especially those opening against walls). *Ghosts will sporadically interact with doors. Ghosts will loudly rattle doors before either closing or opening them, producing an interaction and potentially giving out certain evidence, such as an EMF Level 2 reading (33% chance of being EMF Level 5) or Ultraviolet, for applicable ghosts. *During certain ghost events, all passageway doors in the room/area (including the exit door, if applicable) will close. This does not affect hiding spot doors. *When a hunt begins, all exit doors and wing doors in Sunny Meadows will close and lock for the duration of the hunt. This is also not considered as an interaction. *Ghosts cannot interact with doors that are being held by a player. There are some exceptions: **Ghosts can forcefully open a hiding spot door if a player has been detected inside a closet/locker. **Ghosts can forcefully close a passageway door if a player has been detected near an opened one. ===Rewards=== Recording a moving door with a Video Camera will create a Door Moved video in the Journal, rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP. The video evidence is valid as soon as the door starts rattling. If the ghost has Ultraviolet evidence, the ghost has a chance to leave fingerprints on the door. In this case, players may reveal the fingerprints using a UV Light before snapping a quick photo labelled Fingerprints. ==Related difficulty settings== *Doors starting open: How many doors are randomly moved at the start of the contract ==Trivia== *Players used to be able to pull most doors off of their hinges by walking into them from a certain angle. While it did not prevent the ghost from opening or closing them, this glitch could be abused in order to go through walls or go out of bounds, such as going onto the roof of 6 Tanglewood Drive by using the locker doors in the garage. This has been fixed in 0.11.0. Category:Map Features fr:Porte
title: Door

The ID Card is a cosmetic that shows the player's in-game progress. ==Features== The ID card shows the name of the player, the platform they're playing on (Steam, PlayStation, or Xbox), their level, the player's badge, and their selected character model. For the player's own ID card, the bar shows the amount of experience needed to level up. When looking at other players' ID cards, the bar is used to adjust their voice chat volume. By default, the volume is set to 50%. The character model can be changed by clicking on the model portrait, and a player's badge can be changed by clicking the customize button in the top right corner. ===Roles=== By default, players are assigned the Ghost Huntin' Intern role. Different roles can be obtained through the prestige system, holiday events, contributing to the development of the game, being a Kinetic Games Partner, or through community-related events. Players that obtain a new role will also obtain a new badge that the role is linked to. The badge must be displayed on a player's profile to display the role. ===Prestige Badges=== Upon reaching Level 100 the player has the option to Prestige. Players will receive a new badge every Prestige that affects the role and color of the ID Card. Prestige Badges will also be displayed on the left shoulder of the player's character model, below the Legacy Badge. A player's prestige level will appear as Roman numerals prefixing their level (i.e. VI-002). Prestiges 1-10 display an ID Card with a static background and badge, while prestiges 11-20 display an ID Card with an animated background and badge. {| class="fandom-table" !Role !ID Card design !Prestige |- |Intern | |Prestige 0 (Default) |- |Recruit | |Prestige 1 (I) |- |Investigator | |Prestige 2 (II) |- |Pvt. The Haunted Mirror is a cursed possession that can be used to locate the ghost's favorite room. ==Mechanics== A haunted mirror has a 1 in 7 chance per contract of being chosen as the cursed possession that will spawn on a default difficulty, with one specific spawn location per map. ===Activation and usage=== The mirror can be while inside the investigation area. It will be automatically deactivated when brought outside. When activated, the haunted mirror will show a view of the favorite room as a sweeping panorama from the center of the room, allowing players to locate the room by cross-reference. This view is a live feed of the room, so any lights turned on, items moved, and equipment or players present in the room will be visible. The only exception is the player's own model. The mirror also gives a faint glow to see into the favorite room, which all players, including the user, can see, even outside of the mirror. This can help confirm rooms, as well as help other players know where the favorite room is. Each usage of the haunted mirror, which includes the animation of raising but not of lowering the mirror, will decrease sanity at a rate of 7.5% per second, or by 20%, whichever is higher. This means that using the mirror for less than ~2.67 seconds will still drain at least 20% sanity. The mirror will crack visually and audibly, triggering a cursed hunt if: *The user's sanity reaches 0% while looking into the mirror *A player activates the mirror while below 20% sanity Once broken, the mirror automatically lowers and cannot be used for the rest of the investigation. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a haunted mirror, cracked or not, will yield a photo labelled as Haunted Mirror, and reward up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Photo Camera. ==Tips== *On maps such as Brownstone High School where many rooms look very similar, it may be hard to confirm the favorite room; players can place some equipment in the room they suspect to be the favorite room, and see if said equipment is visible in the mirror. Alternatively, players can also memorize small details such as the position and placement of windows, or the tile color, before searching that room. *If the "Eye Adaption" option is on, the player's vision will be significantly darkened for a short while after lowering down the mirror. Turn this option off if it becomes troublesome. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.5.0 |Added Haunted Mirror as a cursed possession. |- !0.5.0.2 |The mirror's view into the favourite room will now keep rotating instead of resetting on every use. |- !0.8.0.3 |The mirror now drains at least 20% sanity per use. |- !0.9.5.0 |The Haunted Mirror will now correctly break straight away if you do not have enough sanity (20%). |}

The Head Gear is a type of equipment in Phasmophobia. Its specific function varies based on its equipment tier, though generally it improves the ability to investigate without a Flashlight. ==Usage== a head gear will put it on the player's head. The head gear can be toggled on or off by holding the key for a couple of seconds. It can be back at any time. Worn Head Gear does not take up an inventory slot. The camera's display moves relative to the direction that the player's model is facing. Activated Head Gear will attract the ghost during hunts, similar to other electronic equipment. ==Mechanics== ===Tier I=== Tier I Head Gear is the Head Mounted Camera. When activated, it functionally serves as a portable Video Camera, and can be used to help teams track each other and to see Ghost Orbs. Although useless when playing alone, they can be handy in a team with an observer in the Truck. Like with regular video cameras, Head Mounted Cameras can switch between visual and night-vision modes at the Computer, and can be used to detect Ghost Orbs when in night vision mode. They are also handy for monitoring players who have to be alone to get ghost responses, such as when using a Spirit Box, and are very useful for guiding players around larger maps, especially in the dark, since the player in the truck can see with night vision mode even if all the lights in the location are out, as well as having access to the Site Map. When the player equips the Tier I Head Gear, the player can see a big box-like object above the field of view. If it is activated, a red indicator light will start to blink. ===Tier II=== Tier II Head Gear is the Head Lamp. When activated, it provides a light source emanating from the player's head, with comparable power and illumination to the Tier I Flashlight. The Tier II Head Gear is not visible in the player's field of view unless the player starts to sprint. Even while sprinting, the player can hardly see a part of it. ===Tier III=== Tier III Head Gear is the Night Vision Goggles. When activated, it brightens visibility substantially, painting the player's view light green and allowing them to see in the dark, at the expense of added film grain, lowered render scale, and a slight fish-eye effect, altogether reducing the player's ability to see as far as they could have, and clearly. The display through Tier III Head Gear is a filter through normal vision, rather than a proper separate display as seen in a Video Camera in night-vision mode; an active UV Light will project a definite purple light, when through the video camera's night vision it would be white like from a (visible light spectrum) Flashlight, and Ghost Orbs cannot be seen through just the view provided by the goggles. The Tier III Head Gear filters out red lights. This makes EMF Level 5 on a Tier II EMF Reader appear identical to EMF 4, or the Spirit Box's red lights to not be visible. When the player equips the Tier III Head Gear, the player can see a big goggle-like object above the field of view. ==Trivia== *The Tier I Head Gear appears to be closely modeled on a GoPro Hero 4 Silver Edition. *The Tier III Head Gear is likely modeled after the real life Sightmark SM15070 "Ghost Hunter" Night Vision Goggles. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="2" |0.9.0 |Head Mounted Cameras were renamed to Head Gear. |- |The Head Gear now has 3 tiers. |- ! rowspan="3" |0.10.0 |A customizable keybinding has been added to the Controls page for turning on and off Head Gear. |- |Turning Head Gear I on and off will now play different sounds to help know which state the equipment is in. |- |While within range of a ghost event or hunting ghost: * Tier III will now have visual interference * All tiers will now play a new sound |- |}
