Brownstone High School is a map in Phasmophobia. It was the first medium-sized map added to the game, though it is now a large-sized map. Its square shape and general symmetry can make it difficult to navigate, and its long hallways may make perpetual running almost impossible. ==Structure== Brownstone High School has one front and one side yard (separated from each other), about three dozen classrooms, eight bathrooms, a lecture hall, a cafeteria, and a gymnasium complete with two locker rooms. The entire building is approximately 85 by 55 meters. Brownstone High School features five exit doors. Due to the large distance between the closest entrance and the truck, it may be desirable to stage gear close to the building before entering. The rear exit doors lead onto a outdoor yard featuring an exterior basketball court. It is considered a safe zone, therefore preventing passive sanity drain. ===Layout tips=== *All hallways on both floors cannot be chosen as a favourite room, meaning Ghost Orbs do not need to be checked for in these hallways. The Lobby can be chosen as a favourite room, however. *The four Science Classrooms at the back of the building (two downstairs and two upstairs) each consist of two smaller sub-rooms: the classroom with chairs and the science lab with large metal tables. *There are four pairs of bathrooms on the map, with one pair per side per floor: **All male bathrooms are on the left, and all female bathrooms are on the right. **Each pair consists of a student's bathroom (labelled boys/girls) and a teacher's bathroom (labelled male/female). The teacher's bathroom is behind the "regular" bathroom (when looking towards the back). **The bathrooms are additionally labelled "upstairs" or "downstairs" respectively. *Classrooms numbered 20 and above are all located on the 2nd floor. The rest, classrooms 1-19, are downstairs. *The upstairs hallway is divided into three separate rooms by the game. The game calls each of these 6 hallway rooms a "Corridor" (rather than a "Hallway"). *In addition to doors and windows, fingerprints can also appear on bathroom mirrors. *The following rooms count as dim rooms and hence will drain sanity with 80% of the rate, even with all room lights being on: **Lobby, First Floor Main Corridor, First Floor Right Corridor, First Floor Left Corridor, Basketball Court, Lecture Hall, Second Floor Main Corridor, Second Floor Right Corridor, Second Floor Left Corridor. *Classroom 10 has no main room lights and hence no means of sanity drain prevention (other than firelights). ==Tips for surviving hunts== *Because of its many vast, empty rooms, the player should plan an escape route and identify a hiding spot as soon as the ghost is located, and always remain on their toes when investigating, especially if the favourite room is particularly expansive such as the Basketball Court or the Cafeteria. Be ready to run at the first sign of a hunt; using the brief grace period and strategic sprinting can make the difference between life and death. *This map is the only map in the game that has no official hiding spots at all; this means that only unofficial ones are available, which may not be reliable, and breaking line-of-sight to evade a ghost can be quite difficult due to how open the map is. Making sure to have Incense within reach can be very useful when still trying to collect evidence while sanity is nearing or below the hunt threshold, both to escape the ghost if spotted, and to prevent certain death if the ghost wanders into hiding spots. *Due to the very large size of the map, it may not even be necessary to hide if the player is sufficiently far from the ghost. The player can simply sit in a room far away from the ghost, as it would be extremely unlikely for it to wander by chance to the player's location if it has not detected them. **On the other hand, the large size of the map may make noticing the start of a hunt much more difficult. This can be particularly dangerous in hallways, as the player may be taken by surprise by a ghost that started hunting from far away. Communication between players and vigilance is key to avoid bad surprises; keeping exit doors open to hear or see them close and periodically trying to toggle light switches can help players know if a hunt started elsewhere in the building. *While all the lockers found on the map are simply decorative and therefore useless, the bathroom stalls are fair hiding spots during hunts, especially if the ghost does not see you enter the bathroom. *The Library contains several line-of-sight blockers, which can be used for both hiding and cutting off a chasing ghost. *The locker rooms on the left side of the first floor make for good hiding spots, as the lockers segregate the space and allow one to break line-of-sight or move away easier. *Some classrooms have hiding spots, such as in a corner next to some file cabinets, which block line-of-sight with the door. Knowing which ones do and which ones don't can save a player during hunts. Consider keeping open doors to classrooms with hiding spots and keeping closed those without. *The ghost is able to walk through many of the teacher's desks found in the classrooms, rendering them not useful for trying to loop the ghost. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. As Brownstone High School has a very large searchable area, looking for the bone is usually not a worthwhile endeavor; it is best either found incidentally or through use of a Ouija Board. ;Examples Please note that the white bone model is no longer used.
Bone in Brownstone High School, First Floor, Right Side, Library. On the ground. 1.jpg|First Floor, Right Side, Library. On the ground Bone in Brownstone High School, Second Floor, Right Side, Storage Room 2. On the ground at the foot of a shelf. 3.jpg|Second Floor, Right Side, Storage Room 2. On the ground at the foot of a shelf Bone brownstone classroom.png|A bone in a second floor classroom
== Cursed possession locations == All cursed possessions spawn in the Lobby or in the immediate vicinity in the hallway. File:School-Doll.png|The Voodoo Doll spawn on a bench in the end of the Lobby. File:School-Circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the end of the Lobby. File:School-Board.png|The Ouija Board spawns behind the left column in the Lobby. File:School-Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns behind the right column in the Lobby. File:School-Cards.png|The Tarot Cards spawn on a bench along the left wall of the Lobby. File:School-Music.png|The Music Box spawn on a bench along the right wall of the Lobby. Monkeypaw brownstone.jpg|The Monkey Paw spawns on a box in front of the right column in the Lobby. == Trivia == * Despite being larger than Sunny Meadows Mental Institution—the other Large map—in terms of playable area, Brownstone High School was classified as a Medium map until 0.9.0. ** This makes it the first map to have changed size class between versions of the game. * The "Second Floor Main Corridor" is one of the largest rooms in the map, competing with "Basketball Court". Both rooms individually are also among the largest rooms in the game. * The assets used for this map can be found here. * There is a phone in every classroom that the ghost can ring as an interaction. In earlier versions of the game, this ringing was very loud and could be heard from great distances. * Brownstone High School is the only map in the game that doesn't have any official hiding spots. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha? |- ! N/A |Brownstone High School was added to the game. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.28.6.5 |Optimisations to significantly improve load times and fps |- ! rowspan="2" |0.29.6 |Truck map has been flipped to make them less confusing to navigate |- |Top and bottom floor corridors have been split into 3 sections each |- !0.9.0 |Brownstone High School is now classified as a Large map. |} ==References== Category:Maps Category:Large Map fr:Brownstone High School ru:Brownstone High School

The Ghost Writing Book is a piece of equipment used to obtain Ghost Writing by placing it near a ghost. ==Usage== ===Placement=== A translucent preview of the Ghost Writing Book opened will appear while the player is aiming at a surface and holding down the button. The book will be placed when the button is released. ===Function=== If Ghost Writing is an evidence type for the ghost, the ghost has a chance of interacting with the book by writing in it. When this happens, the book will slightly levitate and the pen will start to frantically scribble on the pages visually and audibly, followed by the pen being thrown on the ground. An EMF Level 2 reading is also created, with a 33% chance of it being EMF Level 5 instead if this is one of the ghost's types of evidence. The ghost will not write in the book if it is closed and/or out of range. A ghost can throw the Ghost Writing Book only if it does not have Ghost Writing among its types of evidence or when that piece of evidence is hidden. After being thrown, the book will close. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Advanced mechanics |- !colspan="2"|WARNING: This data is not officially verified. |- !Interaction chance |The ghost will try to write in a book every 45 to 90 seconds. The timer starts as soon as the equipment is loaded and is different for each book. The interaction chance depends on the ghost writing book tier: 50%, 66.67%, 75% for tiers 1, 2, 3, respectively. |} ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of the Ghost Writing Book after it has been written in will yield a photo labelled as Ghost Writing, and reward up to $12 and 12 XP depending on the tier of the Photo Camera and whether there is a Unique stamp. A video and a sound labelled as Ghost Writing, each awarding up to $12 and 12 XP, can also be recorded when the ghost is writing in the book. ==Strategies== *If placed within the vision of an active video camera, you can use the Video Feed in the truck to watch ghost writing books and see if ghost writing is occurring. While it may be much more difficult to see if there are any markings in the pages on camera, more observant players may check if the pen is missing from the book to determine if ghost writing has occurred or not. *A nearby sound sensor can also be used to monitor a Ghost Writing Book from the truck; this will allow players to hear the sound of Ghost Writing occuring without having to actively monitor the book. ==Possible Writing Patterns== ==Gallery== File:SatanicBook.png|thumb|Old writing book model and one of the symbol writings ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !25 March 2020
(Part 2) |Added a Ghost Writing Book. |- !26 March 2020 |Increased the chance of ghosts interacting with the book. |- !13 May 2020 |Ghost Writing will now work in a lit room. |- !15 July 2020 |Further increased the chance of ghosts interacting with the book. |- !19 August 2020 |Ghost Writing Books can now be placed in a fashion similar to video cameras. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !20 September 2020 |Further increased the chance of ghosts interacting with the book. |- !29 October 2020 |Ghost Writing now counts as photo evidence. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.3.0 |Changed the Ghost Writing Book model and patterns. |- |The book now emits writing sound and animation when the ghost writes on it. |- !0.7.0 |The written book that has been photographed will now show up as Ghost Writing instead of Interaction. |- !0.9.0 |The Ghost Writing Book now has 3 tiers. |- !0.9.4.0 |Ghost writing books can no longer be thrown by a poltergeist ability. |- !0.10.0 |Non-Ghost Writing ghosts now close the book after throwing it. |}

This page is not an official list of bugs.
This Wiki is not moderated by, nor affiliated with, the official Phasmophobia developers or its volunteer staff in the official Discord server. This page should not be used to report bugs. Any bugs you encounter should be reported on the Discord server, instead of here. Bugs may be fixed without notice. Additionally, this page is updated very sporadically, meaning anything written here has a very good chance of being out-of-date. As such, this page should not be used as a reference, but instead as a novelty.
This page lists several glitches or bugs that can be found in-game. == Acknowledged bugs == This is an informal list of bugs that have either been currently designated as "known" under the pinned comments of the #bug-reports channel of the official Discord server, or have a Known Issue tag to the relevant bug report. * If a player loads into a lobby while holding an item, it will appear floating * Hunts occasionally occur without anyone being in the house * Summoning circle candles can be rapidly lit to bypass the candles being blown out at 0 sanity * Bones occasionally spawn in inaccessible/difficult-to-reach areas * Players may not see items in the truck if someone loads in improperly * Lighting may appear warped in certain places * Some language fonts have white blocking around the letters * DOTS may not render correctly * Player hair can disappear in the fog or when viewed through the paramic * Sunny Meadows boilers cannot be lit * Prison monitors are very bright * Placing items (such as DOTS) may teleport it back to the truck * Items and props can spawn in the wrong place, and will bug the player's inventory when picked up * Multiple players can grab the same item at the same time, resulting in the item doubling or being unusable * Hands may fall when grabbing equipment in certain cases * Global Chat occasionally cuts out * Audio may muffle incorrectly between floors, when dying or being resurrected with High Priestess/Monkey Paw * Dead bodies may occasionally be invisible to some players * The map may disappear through doorways (portals) * There are places where the player can get stuck/be invincible * The player may get killed through the stairs in 42 Edgefield Road * Ghosts can get stuck behind certain furniture * The Deogen can kill through walls * The ghost may not hunt when all the Voodoo Doll pins are pulled at once * Journal case number may not match the paramic's * Video cameras may desync in position if a non-host player placed it * The ghost may not register moving between floors correctly, resulting in electronics not flickering * Airball event may not move to the player correctly * The mannequin being teleported in Edgefield may cause it to teleport into a hiding spot filled with boxes * Photos of the ghost can be duplicated if two players take it at exactly the same time * When loading back into the lobby, the difficulty will show as challenge mode while the host has not exit the debriefing screen * Using a text interface may soft lock the game if another player runs away with the equipment * Photos of certain things do not count under rugs * Lights may flicker infinitely after certain events/hunts * An extra character may sometimes appear in the lobby/map * Dying with the black fog effect via the Monkey Paw will cause it to persist for the rest of the round * Muting between the lobby and maps is not synced * Raindrops cannot be seen in certain cases * When ambient occlusion is turned off, odd reflections will appear * The ghost's footsteps and sounds may be inconsistent * Ghosts may remain invisible and not produce any footsteps if they started hunting while in D.O.T.S state == Informal bugs ==
This is not an exhaustive list.
This is a list of bugs that have not been routinely acknowledged by the developers or Discord staff, though they may still be aware of the bugs. *Opening one tent door may sometimes open another tent door instead *A player's model may remain if they disconnect while finishing loading into the contract *Sound Monitor is sometimes desynced between players *Upon starting a contract, the exit door might be missing, allowing players to walk in without unlocking the door and thus keeping the ghost's AI into a "standby" state. Triggering a cursed hunt using a cursed possession will "activate" the ghost should this glitch happen. *Some props, cabinet doors or drawers might spawn floating outside the building *One blue bed model's LoS collider is too tall *The ghost sometimes spawns at the entrance room/wrong room at the start of the contract === "Low to ground strategy" === The low to ground strategy is a maneuver that can be performed by VR players in an attempt to avoid being killed during a hunt. It was fixed in the 0.26 update on 6 March 2021. A similar bug reoccurred in the VR Overhaul Update. To perform this maneuver, the player had to lie on their stomach or back as low to the ground as possible. A ghost successfully kills their target player when hunting by colliding with them, but reducing the character's size also reduces the chance of collision. In this case, the character's hitbox (an arbitrary shape that the game uses to determine whether the player is colliding with things) shortens and possibly descends into the floor, meaning that the ghost cannot touch it, and thus could not kill the player. Doing this could help the player get photographic evidence of the ghost by pointing a photo camera upwards and taking pictures, without risk of death. Youtuber hudzell released a video demonstrating this strategy in October 2020, adding during the video that players might not need to crouch too low to perform it. Players using this trick would find their vision possibly restricted from being prone (unless they lie on their back), and they may also find the experience physically uncomfortable. Also, moving too close to some objects may cause the player to go out of bounds, teleporting them back outside the house or in the truck. Obviously, Non-VR players cannot use this strategy, as they do not have the ability to lay down. == Notorious bugs == Below is a list of patched glitches that were either peculiarly game-breaking and/or gained significant notoriety in the community. === Door physics === In the past, door physics were notoriously janky and prone to many glitches. The most common was the ability to push into doors and tear them off their hinges into awkward angles. This did not, however, "jam" doors or prevent them from being closed/locked by the ghost, as they would reset to their normal position as soon as they were interacted with again. Door physics could also be exploited to traverse walls or cieilings, allowing players to go out of bounds or exit the investigation area during a hunt. For a short time after the early access Steam release, kitchen cupboard doors shared the same physics properties as passageway doors, allowing for certain exploits such as climbing on countertops, out of the ghost's reach. === "Show us" === During a brief period, saying the phrase "show us" would always force the ghost to perform an interaction no matter what. A widely-exploited side effect of this glitch was that it would immediately cancel ongoing hunts. This glitch became widely notorious at the time for its absurd power. === Hantu super speed === In version 0.7.1.4, a glitch was introduced causing the Hantu's ability of accelerating in cold rooms to increase the speed value exponentially. This led to astonishingly high speeds up to approximately 19 m/s, breaking the ghost's pathfinding and making hunts absurdly difficult to survive. == Not bugs == The following behaviours, although they may seem unexpected, are features working as designed/won't be fixed: * Maps are an ugly red and black when eye adaption is turned on, caused by an incompatible graphics card * Losing consumable items even when not dying (such as salt and sanity medication) * Seeing freezing breath with non-freezing ghosts. Since 0.9.0, freezing breath occurs whenever temperatures drop below 5°C (41°F). * The Goryo changing favorite room after using the "I wish for sanity" wish on the Monkey Paw. * UV flashlights not working when flashlights are disabled in the custom difficulty settings. * Summoning Circle candles extinguishing right after lighting them when at 0% sanity. * Crucifixes being used while inside the truck. Although very unexpected (usually occuring on 42 Edgefield Road due to the proximity of the truck to the house), this is simply due to the range-based functionality of the crucifix. * Labeled photos with no visible subject in the frame. Photos are intentionally not synched over with other players for performance reasons, therefore it is possible that photos taken by other players may appear incongruent in the journal. * Not being able to take photos of some interactions like opened doors or thrown objects. Since 0.13.0, photos of certain subjects have been removed, and must now instead be recorded using a Video Camera. == References == Category:Gameplay
title: Glitches

The Goryo is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. Goryo are known for appearing only on video feeds when interacting with a D.O.T.S. Projector, as well as remaining within the vicinity of its starting Ghost Room. ==Behaviour== ===Activity=== When performing a roam, the Goryo can only perform short roams, rather than either short or long roams. The Goryo will not roam away from its favorite room as often as other ghosts and cannot change its favorite room in any difficulty. This can only be overridden via the 'sanity wish' when using the Monkey Paw. The Goryo will only enter in a D.O.T.S state if no players are in the same room as the ghost. In addition, its D.O.T.S silhouette is only visible through a Video Camera, and cannot be seen with the naked eye. A Goryo will still manifest normally during ghost events and hunts. The Goryo will enter the D.O.T.S state more frequently than other ghosts. ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: A Goryo will usually only show itself on camera if there are no people nearby. Weakness: They are rarely seen far from their place of death. ==Evidence== On limited evidence (1/2 evidence) games, a Goryo will always have the D.O.T.S. Projector as one of its evidence types. ==Strategies== ===Identification=== It is necessary to have a Video Camera either placed facing an active D.O.T.S. Projector, or held by a player outside the ghost's room. If D.O.T.S. evidence is visible in the camera's screen, but invisible in direct view, the ghost is likely to be a Goryo. Conversely, if D.O.T.S. is seen without the aid of a video camera, a Goryo can be safely ruled out. Turning up device or in-game brightness may help when trying to rule out a Goryo. Ghost events only need the player to be somewhat near the ghost, and the ghost does not need to roam to perform them, only teleporting if applicable. Hence, having ghost events happening a relatively long distance away from the favorite room does not rule out the Goryo; if it is from an extremely far distance however, then the Goryo can usually be ruled out. If the player did not obtain D.O.T.S Projector as one of the ghost's evidences on Nightmare/Insanity difficulty or on a limited evidence custom game (1/2 evidence), then the Goryo can be safely ruled out. On a custom difficulty with 0 evidence, the Goryo is near-impossible to identify with certainty, as it cannot be identified through its D.O.T.S ability, only its favorite room/roaming limitations, and as these are not definitive indications (other ghosts can also not change favorite rooms/roam far), at best only an educated guess based on its movements can be made; Try waiting a while to see if the ghost changes its favorite room at low sanity, or use motion sensors and salt to track how far it travels in one go. The ghost always hunting from the same room can also indicate a Goryo, especially if the custom difficulty has a high roaming frequency. ==Trivia== *In Japanese folklore, it was feared that when a person died tragically, their soul would become a vengeful spirit (commonly referred to as Onryō), causing disasters, pestilence, and haunting. People worshipped the Onryō as a Goryō (御霊, honorable spirit) and tried to avert disaster by appeasing his anger. The Japanese word "御霊" is often read as "Mitama" ("Goryō" is also the correct reading), which is a term of respectful invocation of ancestral spirits. In Phasmophobia, Goryo do not reflect these powers nor their Japanese origin, and are American in both appearance and name due to sharing models and a naming pool with other ghost types. *It is possible to take a D.O.T.S. Ghost photo of the Goryo's D.O.T.S. silhouette. This will require switching from a video camera to a photo camera at just the right moment if playing in singleplayer. Just as with the Phantom, the ghost won't actually be visible in the photograph, but it will still count toward the "Capture a photo of the ghost" optional objective. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Added Goryo. |- !0.8.0 |The Goryo will no longer change favourite rooms or roam long distances. |- !0.13.0 |The Goryo now has an increased chance to enter a D.O.T.S state. |}

content: A ghost room, officially referred to as the favourite room, is a specific room in a map that the ghost will "prefer", or base specific actions upon. Those can be limited to whole rooms of a building but can also include hallways, enclosed areas, campsite tents, etc. Ghosts may leave their room while hunting or simply being more active due to a player's decreasing sanity, but in general, their activity will be localised to the favourite room and its immediate surroundings. Finding the favourite room in itself is not an objective, however, it simplifies the task of identifying the type of ghost correctly and allows players to record media more quickly. Depending on the difficulty, the ghost can decide to change its favourite room during the contract. The favourite room plays a lesser role once the type of ghost has been identified correctly and will usually serve as a reference for player activity during hunts. ==Mechanics== ===Favourite room=== Whenever a map is loaded in, one room in the area will be randomly selected as the favourite room. The favourite room is relevant for the following behaviours: *The ghost will teleport to the favourite room at the end of every hunt and when a crucifix has successfully prevented a hunt. *The ghost can roam back to the favourite room. *Ghost Orbs, if the ghost has it as evidence, will be present in the favourite room. **Though The Mimic doesn't have Ghost Orb among its types of evidence, it will still provide it as its weakness. *The Haunted Mirror will show a view of the favourite room. *The Hermit tarot card and the "I wish to trap the ghost" wish from the Monkey Paw will teleport the ghost to the favourite room and temporarily trap it there. *The Yurei will be sent back to the favourite room and stay within it for 90 seconds after being affected with Incense outside of a hunt. ===Ghost's current location/room=== As an invisible entity by default, ghosts can perform roaming simply to walk around. This can include roaming to another room; this does not change the favourite room. The following behaviours relate to where the ghost actually is: *Ghosts will interact with objects in a certain radius around itself. *Ghosts always start a hunt from its current position (except for The Twins in some cases). *Ghosts can initiate ghost events (naturally) if the player is within a certain range of the ghost. *For evidence to either be created and/or obtained, the ghost must be nearby (other than Ghost Orbs). *Ouija Board responses always give the ghost's current room, not the favourite one. Generally, ghosts will spend most of their time in the favourite room and will not roam far off. Still, they may move far away from their room if they have an ability that allows them to do so (the Wraith's teleport ability, the Banshee's roaming ability, and the Phantom's travel ability), or perform a ghost event on a player that is somewhat far from the ghost room (but not too far). These instances are technically not a "roaming phase, " but the ghost may roam after performing these actions. ===Changing favourite rooms=== Three criteria are used to determine whether the favourite room will change. Suppose the ghost performs a "long roam" and ends up in a room that is not its current favourite. In that case, the ghost will perform a chance roll based on the Changing favourite room difficulty setting: *None (Amateur, Intermediate): 0% *Low (Professional): 33% *Medium (Nightmare): 66% *High (Insanity): 100% If the chance above succeeds, a second chance roll is performed on the complement of the average sanity (or insanity); for example, an average sanity of 80% has a 20% chance of succeeding. If both chances are successful, the favourite room will change to the ghost's current room. The Goryo cannot change its favourite room by itself, even with the "Changing favourite room" parameter set to High. Using a specific Monkey Paw wish can force it to change the favourite room once. ===Disallowed favourite rooms=== Some maps have rooms such as corridors or hallways which cannot be chosen as the favourite room. The ghost can still roam into these rooms, provide evidence in these rooms, interact with items in or around the room, and spawn in these rooms during hunts or manifestations, but Ghost Orbs cannot be An igniter is an item used to light incense, firelights, summoning circles, and fire sources. It emits a small amount of light when activated and held by the player. ==Usage== An igniter can be used either when held or when in the inventory. The igniter can be lit by pressing the key while holding it. Incense, fire sources and regular firelights can then be lit by aiming at the item and pressing the key. Alternatively, if the igniter is offhand in the inventory, incense or firelight being held on-hand can be lit directly with . The igniter does not have to be lit prior in this case, as it will automatically turn off when placed offhand. Igniters take up their own special slot in the inventory, allowing for three other items to be carried with them. Igniters have a limited amount of usable time, depending on their tier: *Tier I: 10 matches per box with 10 seconds per match, for a total of 100 seconds (1 minute 40 seconds) *Tier II: 5 minutes *Tier III: 10 minutes Additionally, lighting a held incense or firelight while the igniter is offhand in the inventory will instantly deduct 1 match for the Tier I and 15 seconds of the total fuel for the Tiers II and III. Active Tier I and Tier II igniters are affected by Heavy Rain, and will be extinguished automatically when taken outside and cannot be ignited in that weather, except in places that are covered from the rain (e.g. under porch roofs, inside tents). However, they can still light held incense and Tier III firelights up if they are in the inventory, even while fully outside. When an igniter is lit for the first time, contrary to other fire sources, it will not have the 30-second cooldown before the ghost can attempt to blow it out but a cooldown with a random duration between 20 and 80 seconds as with subsequent lightings (this might be a bug). The Onryo is the only ghost that can bypass this cooldown due to its hunt prevention mechanics. Ghosts cannot light igniters and have a 66.67% (2/3) chance to blow out a lit igniter provided they are within 5 meters and the cooldown is over. Tier I and II igniters are consumable, and will have to be repurchased after use. ==Tips== *While using tier I igniters, it is quicker to pick up, light and place firelights than to wait for the match-striking animation. ==Trivia== *The igniter is the cheapest item in the game, costing $10. *Tier I matches may be extinguished by the ghost, however, they will still appear to be lit. *In Point Hope and Bleasdale Farmhouse, a usable Tier I igniter containing a single matchstick spawns in one of the rooms. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !23 September 2020 | Lighters can now light held smudge sticks and candles. |- !0.3.0 |Changed the lighter model. |- !0.6.2.0 |Increased the limit of lighters per contract from 2 to 4. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.9.0 |Lighters were renamed to igniters. |- |The Igniter now has 3 tiers. |- ! rowspan="3" |0.10.0 |Players can now carry an Igniter in addition to 3 other items (Note: Non-VR players can only carry one Igniter at a time, similar to flashlights). |- |Igniters now have their own slot in the VR belt (When placing a tier 1 igniter in this slot, you won't be able to remove it again, until all matches have been drawn). |- |Firelights and Igniters will now be extinguished accurately in heavy rain. For example, they will no longer be extinguished under house porches and inside small tents. |}

Maple Lodge Campsite is a map in Phasmophobia. It is the game's second medium map, and the first predominantly outdoors location. The map is a spacious campsite with multiple tents divided into two distinct campgrounds, as well as a restroom building, staff-only storage area, reception building, and a two-story cabin next to a lake. Its organic layout creates a stark contrast to the geometric and more familiar mechanics of the "traditional" indoors maps. Even more experienced players might find themselves lost and confused, as otherwise simple things such as finding the ghost room or locating fingerprints might not be as intuitive, and require more proactive search. However, the significant amount of segmented forking paths leads to plenty of different routes for getting to different parts of the map, which a cunning investigator can leverage to evade an aggressive ghost. Additionally, being mainly outdoors, weather plays a major factor during investigations on Maple Lodge. The temperature outside the cabin and reception building cannot be raised even by turning on the power; heavy rain will prevent the usage of candles and other open flames; while strong winds might hinder the hearing of sound cues such as items being thrown or the ghost's vocalizations while it is hunting. ==Structure== ===Layout tips=== *The key to the cabin can be found under the mat near its door. *The cabin's front doors cannot be unlocked during a hunt. However, once unlocked, these doors will never lock again, as opposed to exit doors. *The following areas cannot be chosen as a Ghost Room: **Campsite A **Campsite B **North East Path *Campfire A and Campfire B have no main room lights, so firelights are the only option to reduce sanity drain when in these rooms. *The following rooms don't completely prevent passive sanity drain even if all lights are turned on: **Campsite A **Cleaning Closet ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== There are 15 "sanctioned" hiding spots on Maple Lodge Campsite: *Entrance, behind dividers near door to Staff Storage Area *Staff Storage Area, behind boxes on the left of Storage Tent 2 *Staff Storage Area, chemical toilet near Storage Tent 2 *North East Path, behind a tarp and boxes *Picnic Area, behind multiple dividers near a boat *Cabin Bedroom, in the small gap where the staircase is *Campsite A, three small tents *Campsite A, behind dividers next to the small tents (only if there are two of them) *Campsite A, behind the Games Tent (only if there are no garbage cans blocking the path) *Campsite B, four small tents, two near Black Tent, one next to White Tent and another one between Blue Tent and Yellow Tent Depending on the difficulty, some of these hiding spots may be blocked by the presence of bulky items, be sealed behind locked doors, or have their concealing elements removed: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 4 *Professional: 7 *Nightmare/Insanity: 11 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overridden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None *There are a few places to loop the ghost during a hunt such as the picnic tables or around a large portion of the map going across Reception Building, Campsite B, and Staff Storage Area. *The toilet stalls inside the restroom buildings serve as a decent hiding spot, as the ghost will rarely wander into the stall themselves unless the player attracts its attention. Keep the door of your cubicle held shut in case the ghost happens to wander in and attempt to open it, which would allow for it to spot you if it happens to see you in its peripheral vision while it is moving through that side of the restrooms. *Unlike regular doors, the tent flaps will not block line of sight with the ghost if they are not fully closed, even if the player holds them up so it completely hides their model. *The entrance gate produces a distinctive sound when compared to most other entrance doors when closed, which can be heard from most outdoors areas of the map. Hearing them shut with no one near them can provide a critical early warning of a hunt. *The ghost can't see players on the cabin's balcony from the Picnic Area, even when they are not crouched. *The ghost also can't see players that are far enough on the pier if it is on the cabin porch or in the section behind the cabin. This happens due to an invisible wall on the pier that begins after the first pole. If a player hides behind the chair at the far end of the pier, this serves as a decent hiding spot, as the chair breaks line of sight and the ghost needs to roam all the way down to the far end of the pier to see a player there. ===General tips=== *The campfires can be lit using a firelight or igniter. *In addition to existing "common" surfaces, fingerprints can also appear on the following items and surfaces: **Interior edges around tent door flaps **On tent windows **At the base of lanterns **On the string light poles and their switches **On picnic benches **On small tents **On the log seating ;Examples of fingerprints File:Tent door fingerprint.png|Fingerprints on an interior edge around a tent door flap. File:Tent window fingerprints.png|Fingerprints on a tent window. File:Maple-Fingies-Pole.png|Fingerprints on a light pole. File:Picnic bench fingerprints.png|Fingerprints on a picnic bench. File:Maple-Fingies-Coolerbox.png|Fingerprints on cooler boxes. File:Maple-Fingies-Lamp.png|Fingerprints on the base of a lantern. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
Bone maplelodge cabinkitchen.png|A bone in the Cabin Kitchen. File:Pier bone.png|A bone on the pier. File:Blue tent bone.png|A bone inside of the blue tent.
==Cursed possession locations== File:maple-rework-board.png|The Ouija Board spawns on the shelf in the Cleaning Closet. File:maple-rework-mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns in the Reception Building. File:maple-rework-musicbox.png|The Music Box spawns seated on a cut log in Campfire B. File:maple-rework-doll.png|The Voodoo Doll spawns leaning against a log in Campfire A. File:maple-rework-tarot-cards.png|The Tarot Cards spawn in the Picnic Area, atop a table with poker cards scattered all over it. File:maple-rework-circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the Cabin Kitchen. File:maple-rework-paw.png|The Monkey Paw spawns on a barrel in the Staff Storage Area. ==Generator locations== *The fuse box (generator) has 5 possible spawn locations: **Next to the Male Toilets **Behind the Reception Building **In the Staff Storage Area **At the beginning of the North East Path **Next to the stairs leading to the Cabin ==Easter eggs== There are a few hidden Easter Eggs which can be found on the map: *Jason Voorhees Mask - Walking out to the edge of the pier will make a mask of Jason Voorhees float to the surface. *Slenderman - Slenderman has a one-third chance per game to spawn on the outskirts of the map. He can be seen near the truck, behind the Twig Doll easter egg in Campsite A, behind the small purple tent in Campsite B, near the Tarot Cards location in Picnic Area, or floating above water behind the cabin. *Blair Witch Twig Doll - At the fence by the Campfire A, a Twig Doll is hanging, which is a reference to the Blair Witch Project stick figures. *Corpse - A dead body can be found under the cabin. *The Ring - When either the television in the cabin or the fuse box is turned on and later turned off, there is a chance for a phone also in the cabin to ring. *Lighthouse - Standing on the pier (same area near the Jason Voorhees Mask) if one looks to the left side of the lake above the tree line there is a lighthouse in the distance. This was added in the 0.6.0 update. ==Gallery== Winter Fairy Lights.png|Winter themed fairy/string lights during the 2021 Christmas event. Maple Lodge Geography.png|A map of the surrondings of Maple Lodge Campsite. ==Trivia== *The map's name 'Maple' came from developer cjdxn's cat's name called 'Mayple'. *Some rooms need their small lamps to be turned on additionally to the main room lights to fully prevent the sanity drain. These rooms are Entrance, Staff Storage Area, Storage Tent 1, Campsite B, Picnic Area, Cabin Living Room, and Cabin Bedroom. *Maple Lodge Campsite is the only map that has lights that prevent sanity drain for multiple rooms: the light switches in both Female Toilets (the one in the bathroom, not the one on the pole) and Male Toilets count for their respective room, as well as for Cleaning Closet. *Contrary to Camp Woodwind, Maple Lodge Campsite's campfires don't heat the room they are in when lit. This is likely a bug. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.4.0 |Added the Maple Lodge Campsite map. |- !0.4.1.0 |A new path has been created from the entrance to the campfire area. |- !0.6.2.0 |The campfire now raises the temperature of the area around it when lit. |- !0.9.1.0 |Complete layout revamp, featuring a new reception building, two separate campsite areas, new assets and areas, more hiding spots and greatly improved performance. |} ==References== Category:Maps Category:Medium Map fr:Maple Lodge Campsite ru:Maple Lodge Campsite
title: Maple Lodge Campsite

content: This is a list of voice lines used in Phasmophobia. == General voice lines == === First Time === Upon loading in for the first time on a new device, you will be greeted with an End User License Agreement and a voice line. * First day, huh? Well, I've already got some jobs ready for you. Don't worry, I'll be helping you out as much as I can from this side. === Training === * Welcome to your first day at Ghost Huntin' Distribution. Read the whiteboard to get started. * Head to the door to the next section. * Good job. * Well done. * Nice work. * Move to the next room. * Something's not quite right. You better hide, quickly! * That was a close one. Congratulations on completing your training! You can exit through the truck by interacting with the keypad. === Main menu === These lines are used when loading into the main menu, after leaving a lobby, and after completing a contract. * Welcome back! I've got some jobs ready for you. * Welcome back! I've prepared some jobs for you. * Welcome back! There's some jobs ready for you. === Multiplayer selection === These lines are used when loading into the server selection screen. * I've gathered a list of other hunters asking for help. * Looks like there are others out there in need of help. If there are no servers currently available in the region, the following lines are used instead: * Doesn't look like anyone else is in need of help. * Unfortunately, it looks like you're on your own. === Loading into the truck === After all players have loaded into the map, information is given in two parts: instructions to set up, and any additional information that the instructor has. The voice lines are randomly selected and do not indicate what the ghost will actually do, whether it is aggressive, or whether there is a cursed possession; the latter is determined by the difficulty. ==== Arrival ==== *Alright, we're here. Take a look at the equipment, and prepare accordingly before starting the investigation. <s>I've also written some notes on the whiteboard if you need them.</s> *We've arrived. Check the equipment, and get set up before investigating<s>, and remember to check the whiteboard for help</s>. ==== Additional intel ==== ; Original voice lines * Got the intel, looks like this is going to be a tough one. We've had reports of violence, and it looks like they left in a hurry. * I've got a report that suggests a possible ghost sighting. * I've got nothing else to report unfortunately. * New intel: reports of light switching. Possibly harmless, but be careful out there. * No report this time. Be careful, you're going in blind. * Nothing to report, but it looks like whoever was here left in a hurry. * There's been no reports of violence or sightings, but please remain careful. * We've had no reports of violence, but keep an eye out. ; Added in 0.5.0 * The ghost here seems to be linked to a cursed object. Go and take a closer look, maybe using it will help your investigation. * There’ve been new reports of a cursed object nearby. This must be the reason that the ghost was summoned here. Take a look, you may be able to use it to your advantage. * Whoever was here must have summoned the ghost with a cursed object. Investigate it, but be careful. We don't know what it's capable of. === Key === If any player leaves the truck before the house key has been collected, the instructor will remind the players to collect it: * I managed to get a copy of the key. I've left it on the desk for you. * The owner left us a key. It's ready on the desk for you. === Prestige === When the player reaches level 100: * We want to offer you a special kind of promotion. * If you'd like to progress, you can now prestige. * We'd like to offer you a promotion. Let us know if you'd like to progress further. * Fancy moving up in the world? A prestige is now available. After prestiging: * Congratulations recruit, and welcome to the team. (Prestige I) * Well done! Now get investigating, investigator. (Prestige II) * A private investigator already? Nice work! (Prestige III) * Elementary! Nice work, detective! (Prestige IV) * Technically, this isn't a promotion. But it is a new title. (Prestige V) * Oh! You've accepted it already! Congratulations! (Prestige VI) * We've noticed you've got a keen eye for this ghost hunting business. Keep it up! (Prestige VII) * Agent! I must have skipped that one. (Prestige VIII) * Now you're a smooth operator. (Prestige IX) * You've made it to commissioner. You're nearly the boss of me!...Nearly. (Prestige X) * Congrats on another promotion. Great work! (Prestige XI) * Here at Ghost Huntin' Distribution, we would like to thank you for your continued service. (Prestige XII) * The third time's a charm. (Prestige XIII) * Commissioner 4. Nice work! (Prestige XIV) * Consistent work as always. Well done! (Prestige XV) * You really are dedicated to the business. Congrats again! (Prestige XVI) * Impressive. Really Impressive. Welcome to Commissioner 7! (Prestige XVII) * Ready for another promotion. Congratulations! (Prestige XVIII) * You've never ceased to amaze us. Nice work! (Prestige XIX) * I think you might be the longest standing ghost hunter I've ever seen. We've promoted you to the highest rank available: Commissioner 10. Well done! (Prestige XX) == Spirit Box voice lines == <small>This section is incomplete.</small> Official Content Creators read short scripts that were then edited for use as Spirit Box responses: * In a tragic turn of events, an elderly individual was left hurt after a distressing incident that occurred close to a bustling neighbourhood. The community is now grappling with the unsettling proximity of the incident, highlighting the need for increased vigilance and safety measures. == Trivia == * The person voicing the general lines is Christian H. Miles and was hired off fiverr, a platform for freelance services. == References == Category:Gameplay fr:Liste de lignes vocales

content: Lights are a map feature that facilitate navigation across the investigation area as well as providing a way to mitigate sanity drain. ==Mechanics== .]] .]] There are several elements counting as lights: ceiling lights, lamps, TVs, and computers. When the fuse box is on, players can toggle these on or off by with their respective switch: a wall switch for ceiling lights, the lamp itself for lamps, a TV remote for TVs, and the keyboard for computers. If the TV remote is held, players will instead need to press the button. Ghosts can also interact with the switch to toggle the lights, and will leave fingerprints on it if Ultraviolet is among their types of evidence. Occasionally, ghosts may perform a special interaction with turned on lights, making them flicker for a short duration. An EMF Level 2 reading (33% chance to be an EMF Level 5 reading instead for applicable ghosts) will be left on the switch in all these cases. Outside of hunts, lights will sometimes flicker near the ghost without any EMF reading being created. The player will also start seeing lights flickering across the entire map when their own sanity is below 50%, but these flickers are only "imaginary" as they cannot be recorded in the journal and other players cannot see them. Lights in the player's current room will turn off at the start of a ghost event. There are two exceptions: the lights will turn off at the end of the event if it is a red-light event, and the lights will flicker before shattering if it is a light-shattering event. For all ghost events, ghosts will never leave EMF readings on the light switches. During a hunt, ghosts will make lights flicker within 10 metres on the same floor, and light switches cannot be toggled and will turn off at the end of the hunt. All switches also turn off when the fuse box trips. ===Affecting sanity=== ===Rewards=== Filming a light switch being toggled by the ghost will yield a Lights Switched video in the journal, rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the video camera and whether there is a Unique stamp. Two other videos, rewarding up to $12 and 12 XP, can be captured from lights: a Light Exploded video upon capturing lights exploding, and a Light Flickering video upon capturing lights flickering outside of hunts. Category:Map Features fr:Lumière

content: Ghost model is the appearance of a ghost. There are currently seven male and four female ghost models in Phasmophobia, totalling 11 different ghost models. Each model can also appear as a shadowy or translucent version of itself during ghost events. While no singular ghost model is tied to a type of ghost, the Banshee and the Dayan are always female and can only use female ghost models, allowing players to rule them out if the ghost appears with a male model. The model of the ghost may conflict with information gathered from the Spirit Box and Ouija Board; ghosts labeled as "old" may have one of the models that one would equate to a child, for example. == Male models == <gallery mode="packed"> File:2.png File:Ghost Male Greybeard.png File:4.png File:3.png File:Ghost Male Nerd.png File:Ghost Male Sofia.png File:Ghost Male Butcher.png </gallery> == Female models == <gallery mode="packed"> File:Ghost Argyro.png File:Ghost CreepyGirl.png File:Ghost OldCrone.png File:Ghost RingGirlUPDATED.png|This ghost model is semi-officially called Patient 07. </gallery> == Postures == The child and "Patient 07" models have multiple postures that they can switch into during a contract. In addition to the standing posture, both of these models can be crawling, and bent over backwards for the "Patient 07" model. <gallery mode="packed"> File:Crawling.png|Child model crawling File:Crawling Girl.png|Patient 07 model crawling File:Bent Over Backwards.png|Patient 07 model being bent over backwards </gallery> == Themed event models == For Christmas 2021, one of the ghost models was given a temporary Santa Claus garb, accompanied by ringing bells as footstep sounds. During Christmas 2022, the ghost would also transform into this model after eating the cookies. For Halloween 2022, various ghost models wore a jack-o-lantern on their head. On April Fools' 2023, all ghosts had a bigger head. For Christmas 2023, the ghost would transform into a snowman after all dancing snowmen of the map were destroyed. Its footsteps were accompanied by ringing bells. For Easter 2024, the ghost on Camp Woodwind would become a Forest Spirit after all five of its minions are photographed. The Forest Spirit came back for Easter 2025 and would appear on maps featuring the Cursed Hollow event. This model is considered female. For the Winter's Jest event, ghosts on specific maps used a special Krampus model. This model is considered male. <gallery mode="packed"> File:Santa Ghost.png|The Santa Claus ghost File:Big head small head.jpg|A ghost with a big head File:Snowman Ghost.png|The Snowman ghost File:Forest Spirit.png|The Forest Spirit ghost File:Krampus Ghost.png|The Krampus ghost </gallery> == Trivia == *Some models are from the Unity Asset Store, more specifically this pack, with each of them having a dedicated name also being used in the game files. *A Patient 07 plushie was available as official merchandise for a limited time, until 31 October 2024 (UK time). == History == {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !rowspan="2" |0.6.0 |Updated Patient 07's model. |- |Added more animations for Patient 07. |} Category:Ghosts fr:Modèle d'entité
title: Ghost Model

content: The Journal is the main piece of equipment in Phasmophobia. It contains important information relevant to Ghosts, Evidence, Media and mission data. It is divided up into 5 categories with specific focuses, used to aid players on cases. The journal is always accessible to the player any time while in a contract or in the lobby. ==Usage== The Journal can be opened by pressing the button, or grabbing the book from the toolbelt on VR. Upon opening it for the first time, players will be greeted with a contents page outlining each section of the book. Several bookmarks are also visible at the top of the journal, allowing players to quickly switch between sections. ===Home=== This section outlines the fundamentals and basic game mechanics in Phasmophobia, including subsections on sanity and tools. ===Items=== This section provides information on payment bonuses, cursed possessions, and gathering evidence. ===Overview=== The Overview page is a single page detailing information unique to the specific case a player is on. From here, players can view: *The ghost's name *Who it responds to *Any collected keys *All optional objectives This allows players to check objectives and case information on-the-go without needing to constantly run back to the truck. ===Media=== This section is a 5-page section containing all of the photos, videos, and sounds that players have collected on a case. Several pieces of media can be deleted per contract, depending on the difficulty: *0x - 1.99x: 5 available deletions *2x - 2.99x: 4 available deletions *3x or higher: 3 available deletions ===Evidence=== The evidence page shows all potential evidence items and the ghosts that correspond to them. From here, evidence can be either checked off or crossed out, which in turn causes ghosts on the page to grey out, signifying they are no longer possible suspects. Crossing out evidence can greatly reduce the number of potential ghosts remaining, making it essential for quick missions. By default, the Spirit is selected as the default ghost. ===Ghosts=== The Ghosts page contains a list of all 27 available ghosts in Phasmophobia. Clicking onto a specific ghost will cause the rightmost page to display its strengths, weaknesses, and potential evidence items. ===Pause menu=== Shows the pause menu, also reachable by pressing the button. The player can also access most in-game options. This will also show the Recent Players, Blocked Players, and Statistics bookmarks. ===Recent players=== This shows a two-page list of all recent players that have joined the same lobby as the user. One can access the Steam profile of a player, add them as a friend, or report them via an in-game system. ===Blocked players=== This shows a two-page list of all blocked players. One can access the Steam profile of a player, or unblock them. ===Statistics=== This shows various statistics of all previous games since 0.7.0. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="4" |0.3.1.0 |Updated the journal for easier use and navigation. |- |Evidence can now be selected and crossed off individually. |- |Integrated the pause menu into the journal. |- |Settings can now be changed through the journal in-game. |- !0.6.2.0 |Ghosts can now be crossed off. |- !0.7.0 |The journal is now accessible in the lobby. |- !0.7.1.4 |The default ghost selection is now circled. |- !0.8.0 |Added a Payments section. |- !0.9.5.0 |Reduced the brightness of the Journal. |- !0.10.1.0 |Two photos can now be removed from the journal. |- !0.11.0 |Changed the font of the journal to improve localisation support across all languages. |- !0.13.0 |Replaced the Photos section with the Media section. |- !0.13.1.0 |The number of available media deletions is now linked to the difficulty type or custom game difficulty multiplier implemented. |} Category:Gameplay fr:Journal ru:Журнал

content: The Legacy Badge is a badge that was given to players that played Phasmophobia before the release of the Ascension update. Legacy Badges show the highest level a player achieved prior to the level system overhaul. Legacy badges are unobtainable for players that began playing after 17 August 2023. ==Features== Upon launching the game after the Ascension update, eligible players are given the ability to customize their legacy badge which includes changing the color, background, and accent icons on the badge. This is a one-time process, and after saving the badge it will permanently show on a player's left shoulder under their Prestige. ==Legacy Badge Plaque== As of version 0.9.0.4, a plaque was added to the Lobby to show a player's Legacy Badge. This will only appear for players that have a Legacy Badge. Category:Gameplay fr:Badge d'héritage
