content:
The Hantu is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. They are known for their increased speed in colder rooms, which can make them an unexpected threat during a hunt. ==Behaviour == === Activity === The Hantu cannot turn on the fuse box, and is twice as likely to turn it off. === Hunt === During a hunt, the Hantu's speed is affected by the temperature of the room that it goes through: {| class="article-table" ! Room temperature ! Ghost speed (m/s) |- | > | 1.4 |- | | 1.75 |- | | 2.1 |- | | 2.3 |- | | 2.4 |- | | 2.5 |- | < | 2.7 |}
Unlike most other ghosts, the Hantu does not have line-of-sight acceleration during hunts. During a hunt, the Hantu will emit freezing breath near its head in any room as long as the fuse box is off. Dead players cannot see this breath. As this is not actual "evidence", it can appear on any difficulty. == Strengths and weaknesses == These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Lower temperatures allow the Hantu to move at faster speeds. Weakness: Hantus move slower in warmer areas. ==Evidence== On limited evidence (1/2 evidence) games, a Hantu will always have Freezing Temperatures as one of its evidence types. == Strategies== Temperature plays an important role in both identifying and defending against a Hantu. In general, Hantus will be most powerful within and near the ghost room, where low and freezing temperatures are most likely to be. Thus, it is important that players get away from the ghost (room) as soon as a hunt begins, as the Hantu can quickly catch someone within its vicinity. Hantus are particularly dangerous during Light Snow weather, especially on the outdoors maps of Maple Lodge Campsite and Camp Woodwind, as ambient room temperatures will generally be lower if the fuse box is off, boosting their speed during a hunt. In general, leaving the breaker turned on is a safer strategy, though one can also turn it off to aid in identification, if needed. === Identification === There are three ways to identify a Hantu: * Leave the fuse box turned on for a while, then listen for its speed during a hunt. If it is faster in colder rooms (usually, but not always the favourite room), and slower than a normal ghost in a warm room, then it is a Hantu; this can usually be identified safely from a hiding spot, by using its notoriously uneven footsteps, with the rate of footsteps changing suddenly and seemingly randomly as it changes between different speeds. ** If it is a Raiju, then the ghost will be fast near active electronics and a normal speed outside a specified range. If this is a no-evidence game, try removing all electronics first. If at least one piece of evidence is provided, then having Freezing Temperatures as a piece of evidence will eliminate Raiju. ** Similarly, if it is a Jinn, it will speed up when spotting a faraway player, as the fuse box is turned on; have all players hidden out of sight to prevent a misidentification, or turn off the fuse box just before/during the hunt. ** The Moroi can also speed up over several hunts or even during a hunt, but as a result of gradually lowering average sanity instead. Ensure that all players maintain their sanities at a constant level, and do not take Sanity Medication/use sanity-draining cursed possessions during a hunt, which induces a sudden, very noticeable speed change in a Moroi, possibly causing a misidentification. * The Hantu's ability to emit freezing breath when the breaker is off can be used to definitively identify it without evidence, though it is more risky than the other strategies. Look closely! Use Incense to stun it while it's hunting. * Leave the breaker turned on for a while, then loop it around a large piece of furniture in a warm room during a hunt, carrying Incense to avoid death. If the ghost does not speed up with line-of-sight and does not have any other noticeable speed differences that could point towards another ghost, then it is likely a Hantu. It is worth noting the mere presence of the ghost in that room will cool it down and make it increasingly harder to loop over time; this is usually irrelevant in small maps which have shorter hunt durations, and looping a Hantu for an entire hunt is feasible, but on medium and large maps and/or when the hunt duration is extended by cursed hunts, such looping should not be done over an extended period of time, or alternatively one should utilize a loop or series of loops that spans multiple rooms. ** For reference, if the player is continuously sprinting off-cooldown, their average speed is 2.125 m/s; this means the Hantu is significantly slower than the player in rooms that are >12°C, roughly the same speed in rooms that are 9-12°C, and faster than the player in rooms that are <9°C. Having a tier I Thermometer out while looping the ghost can help identify when temperatures are approaching dangerous levels and the player should switch to loop in another room/find a hiding spot. ** If ambient temperatures are high and the player is confident enough in their looping skills, the player can opt to loop the ghost with the breaker off instead, allowing them to look for a Hantu's signature freezing breath at the same time. If you do not obtain Freezing Temperatures as one of the ghost's types of evidence on a limited evidence custom game (1/2 evidence), then the Hantu can be safely ruled out. It also cannot turn on fuse boxes, so if this happens, the ghost is not a Hantu. The Hantu is one of two ghosts (the other being the Onryo) for which you can collect all three pieces of evidence without excluding The Mimic. Therefore, before concluding you're dealing with a Hantu, confirm that it is actually a Hantu using the above methods and/or check whether the Spirit Box gives a response. If it does, you have The Mimic instead. ==Trivia== *"Hantu" translates from the Indonesian/Malay languages to spirit or ghost, and generally refers to spirits of the dead, but they can also be other invisible supernatural beings such as Demons. In mythology, Hantus vary widely and don't necessarily have to be evil. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.29.6 |Added Hantu. |- !0.3.0 |Prior to 0.3.0, the evidence was Fingerprints, Ghost Orb, and Ghost Writing. |- !0.5.0 |Hantu now emits freezing breath when manifested. |- !0.5.0.2 |Hantu’s freezing breath will now only be visible in freezing temperature rooms. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.5.1.0 |Freezing Temperatures is now guaranteed as one of the Hantu's evidences on Nightmare difficulty. |- |Dead players can no longer see the Hantu's freezing breath. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.5.2.0 |Changed the Hantu's speed brackets. |- |Increased the chance of the Hantu turning off the breaker. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.5.2.1 |Hantus can no longer turn on the fuse box. |- |Further changed the Hantu's speed brackets, making it faster in colder rooms. |- !0.8.0 |Cold breath will now animate in any room during hunts if the breaker is off. |} == References == ru:Ханту fr:Hantu Category:Ghosts
title: Hantu

content: This guide will teach you how to locate the ghost in Phasmophobia. Depending on the ghost type, the difficulty level as well as direct player activity determining where the ghost currently is on a map can be a tedious task, especially on larger maps. Identifying the ghost's location correctly can save a lot of time (and lives) while identifying its nature. Certain items can help players trap the ghost in its room and prevent it from initialising hunts for a period of time. ==Location methods== Generally, the location of a ghost can be split into three categories: * Favourite room * Ghost's current room * Ghost's current location It is important to know the distinction between the ghost's favourite room (a.k.a. "ghost room") and its current room. The favourite room is a specific room in the map where the ghost teleports back to after every hunt, as well as where Ghost Orbs will appear. On the other hand, the ghost's current room is where the ghost physically is, and does not have to be the favourite room. Generally, identifying both the favourite room and the ghost's current location will aid the investigation. The setting up of equipment will mostly be centred around the favourite room. Depending on the room size, you may need to watch out for the ghost moving favourite rooms (only on difficulties where this can occur, e.g. Professional, Nightmare, and Insanity), and place your equipment accordingly. This will mostly occur in small or tight rooms like bathrooms and hallways of houses. Some of these tips may be useful for the initial finding of the ghost, while some are better used later into the investigation. ==By interactions== In most cases, ghosts can interact with items that are up to 2.12 metres away (4.24 metres on large maps) of its current position. The exceptions (relevant for this section) are: * All ghosts can turn on/off the fuse box remotely. * The Twins can interact with objects up to 8.48 metres away (16.97 metres on large maps) when it uses its ability, which may result in red herrings. * The Yurei can interact with a random opened door in its current room to close it (not necessarily within the interaction range) when it uses its sanity drain ability. Generally, interactions occur at a varying rate of approximately 1 - 3 per minute, which may depend on the ghost type. Interactions can help to pinpoint the ghost's current location, though not necessarily its current room (since ghosts can interact through walls) or favourite room. ===Visual and audio clues=== One way to identify interactions is to silently walk around and look carefully for sounds produced by the ghost or objects being out of place. For example: ====Visual and audio==== *Doors being unexpectedly opened or closed, or seen being moved without anyone nearby. The sound produced by a ghost when touching a door is distinct from the sound that players cause *A faucet (i.e. Dirty Water) or shower running *An item being thrown or hitting the floor/being out of place, like food utensils or paintings being on the floor *Car alarms, televisions, or computers being turned on *Light switches being turned on/off, or being unexpectedly turned on *Fans rumbling *A piano key being pressed *A rocking chair rocking *Sunny Meadows - Crosses found hung on walls being turned upside down *Sunny Meadows - Metronomes being turned on *Sunny Meadows - Alarm clocks being turned on ====Audio only==== *Phones ringing *Radios (not player walkie-talkies) being turned on *Teddy bears giggling *Window knocks *Guitars being strummed ====Visual only==== *Mannequins being rotated or teleported; the location where the mannequin was teleported from is where the ghost was *Teddy bear head being turned *Teddy bear/bunny/ball being teleported ===EMF Reader=== Generally, most out-of-place objects will be obvious enough to identify, but some may be easier to miss. In this case, carrying an EMF reader will help to identify the exact object that was thrown recently. All interactions generate an EMF reading that lasts 20 seconds, so once you hear or see something, use the reader to identify which item it was. ==Temperature== Using a thermometer can be useful in locating the ghost. Ghosts lower the temperature of the room that they are currently in to a certain point, regardless of whether they are inside or outside. ===Temperature ranges=== Ghosts cool down the room that they are currently occupying. When a room is at its coldest, the temperature reading range on the thermometer will be as follows: * Ghosts with Freezing Temperatures as evidence: * Ghosts without Freezing Temperatures as evidence: At the start of the game, all rooms (including the ghost's current room) start at either the maximum possible temperature (if the fuse box starts on and the room is considered indoors), or at the weather's ambient temperature. As thermometers only have a fluctuation upwards, reading a temperature below the starting temperature (either maximum or ambient depending on the factors above) means that the ghost has spent some time in that specific room. Turning the fuse box on will warm up indoors areas, which can help in distinguishing rooms where the ghost has been from rooms where it has not been. Temperatures slowly rise if the ghost is not present in a room. Do not assume that the ghost is still in a room just because it is cold, as it may take a few minutes after the ghost leaves a room for it to no longer be cold. Some maps have special mechanics to keep in mind: *Lighting the campfire on Camp Woodwind will warm up the Campfire room even if the ghost is in that room. *Turning on the fuse box on Nell's Diner will cool down the Cooler Room even if the ghost is not in that room. ==Using cursed possessions== ;Haunted Mirror Using a haunted mirror will show the interior of the favourite room. The danger of using a haunted mirror is the rapid sanity drain, and once the user's sanity reaches zero, a cursed hunt will be initiated. The haunted mirror is best used very early into the game, allowing players to setup equipment early. ;Music Box Activating a music box will cause the ghost to sing along with the tune, and the ghost's singing will be louder the closer you are to it. Players can then listen closely for the direction where the singing is coming from. While its singing can only be heard if the music box is within 20 metres of it, the music box will otherwise function globally. Players should weigh finding the ghost against prematurely starting a hunt or capitalizing on the triggered ghost event, especially on smaller maps where ghost is more likely to be nearby. ;Ouija Board If spawned, a Ouija Board can be used to ask questions about the ghost's location such: *"Where are you?" *"What is your room?" *"What is your favorite room?" The Ouija Board will always reply with the ghost's current room and not the favourite room, no matter how the question is phrased. The name of the room that it gives is sometimes obvious (e.g. "Kitchen", "Foyer") but other times, the name of an unfamiliar room can be only determined by placing sound sensors in each room and referring to the name listed on the Sound Monitor. As the ghost may have moved to a different room by the time the player figures out the answer and makes their way to the room, answers should only be interpreted as a general direction and not a pin-point indication. Note that location questions will deduct a whopping 50% sanity from the player who asked it. If the player does not have enough sanity to "pay" for the question, the Ouija Board will break and trigger a cursed hunt. Therefore, it is recommended that the player asks early into the game when sanity is generally still high. ;Voodoo Doll The voodoo doll can be used to force the ghost to perform an interaction, which can be found as described in the earlier section. Note that each pin inserted deducts 5% of sanity from the user, while pushing the heart pin (or having not enough sanity) will deduct 10% of their sanity and start a cursed hunt. ;Tarot Cards Several cards may help to identify the ghost's current location or favourite room: *The Tower tarot card will double the rate of ghost activity for the next 20 seconds. *The Hermit will trap the ghost in its favourite room for 60 seconds, but will not prevent ghost events or hunts; if it hunts from a certain room within the specified duration, then that will be the favourite room. However, manifestation ghost events will still teleport the ghost, ignoring the card's effects. * If your risk tolerance is high, pulling a Death card can help to identify where the ghost was when it started its hunt. Most other possible cards are less useful in terms of finding where the ghost is, or even detrimental to the player, and hence usage of these cards should be carefully considered. *The The Devil card will trigger a ghost event, however, it will do so by teleporting the ghost to the nearest player (for manifestation events). The location of the ghost event therefore does not necessarily indicate the favourite room or ghost's location. ;Monkey Paw A few wishes from the Monkey Paw can be used to assist in locating the ghost, with an added complication for the specific wish used: *"I wish to trap the ghost" will lock the ghost in its favourite room, and prevent it from doing anything for one minute. This is not very useful in singleplayer, as all doors in the room where the wish was called upon will also lock, trapping the wisher, but in multiplayer, the rest of the team can simply walk around and find whichever other room is locked down to find the ghost's location. Alternatively, if the map has a room that can be exited without going through a door, the wish can be used there in singleplayer without trapping the wisher. This should be done with a degree of haste, however, as after the end of this minute, the ghost will begin a hunt. The player calling on this wish should also have Incense handy in case they end up getting locked in with the ghost. *"I wish for activity" will double the rate of all ghost activity, including interactions, events, roaming, and abilities, for two minutes. However, the fuse box will permanently break, and exit doors will be locked for two minutes. *"I wish to be sane", past its effects on sanity, will force the ghost to change favourite rooms to a random one. While this is a hindrance in most cases, it can be useful on larger maps where the ghost is in a very distant room (such as the Kitchen and its side rooms in Sunny Meadows) or an extremely large room (such as the Basketball Court in Brownstone High School) both of which can hinder investigations greatly, and forcing it to pick a new one is desirable, especially if sanity has dropped to the point where the ghost is chain-hunting and preventing further investigation. ==Other equipment and evidences== ;Ghost Orb The live video feed on a video camera allows a player to find ghost orbs on the spot by carrying a video camera and watching the video feed. If a ghost orb appears inside a room, that room is guaranteed to be the favourite room. Ghost orbs are generated when all players have loaded in, making it also possible to view them with a CCTV camera on larger maps even before any exit doors have been unlocked, if the camera happens to have a view of the favourite room. On difficulties where the favourite room can change, periodically verifying the location of ghost orbs helps players to determine whether the favourite room has changed, signalling the time to move equipment. Note that Ghost Orbs is not always one of the ghost's evidences (or is hidden as an evidence), so be careful not to assume that the ghost is not in a particular room if there are no ghost orbs. ;Parabolic Microphone Using a parabolic microphone (also known as a paramic) may help to narrow down the ghost's location. It has a detection range of 20 or 30 metres forward (depending on its tier), and can detect any sound caused by the ghost, including footsteps, whispers, and interactions with the environment. Keep in mind that the paramic also reads sounds that could be caused by a player, such as doors being closed or objects being thrown. Spirit box static, and ambient sounds on a few maps, will also be read by the paramic. ==After finding the ghost (room)== ;Motion Sensor Motion sensors can be used to track the ghost's movement, which can be useful to look for roaming patterns that can help setting up equipment more efficiently or locate the ghost's current position. Be aware of other players (including dead ones) that will also trigger motion sensors. ;Incense The "Cleanse the area near the ghost with Incense" objective completes when the incense's effect applies within 3 to 5 metres of a ghost (depending on its tier). After the ghost has already been located, this may be useful in verifying that the ghost is still nearby, and for a Yurei, will also help to limit its movement to its favourite room in the 90 seconds following the cleansing. If this objective does not complete after using the incense, it may mean that the ghost is not near enough, and has moved away to another location (though this may still be within the room). ;Sound Sensor As sound sensors are limited by range, one can use them to see if the ghost is still in its room. Like the parabolic microphone, sound sensors can detect sounds through walls within its coverage area and provide feedback to the truck of the sum of all sounds detected, allowing players to monitor activity from the safety of the truck and verify its location. Sound sensors are used most efficiently by covering the favourite room and its immediate area. Note that just like the parabolic microphone, sound sensors can also pick up some player-made sounds. ;Spirit Box If the ghost has Spirit Box as one of its evidence, you can use this to identify its general location. The ghost will only respond through the spirit box if the player asking questions is in the same room as it and within a certain range. Thus, the spirit box can help to identify the ghost's current room and its approximate location. Although the spirit box can identify both the ghost's current room and its approximate location, using the spirit box and continuously walking from room to room may be a noisy and tiring task. Hence, the spirit box is generally used only after the room has already been found and its evidence has been confirmed. ==Other tips== ===Preserving sanity=== Often, it is ideal to preserve the overall team sanity so that there is enough time to collect evidence before the ghost hunts, if needed. This happens by preventing passive sanity drain: *On suburban house maps, the simplest way is to turn on lights in frequented areas and in rooms that you are currently standing in (unless you are looking for certain evidence like Ghost Orbs and Spirit Box). The downside to this (before the ghost has been found) is that ghosts that are currently in lit rooms cannot throw items (EMF 3), though they can still perform interactions that cause EMF 2. In addition, this is less helpful or downright useless in most other maps, since light sources are generally too "dim" to slow sanity drain on average. *On larger maps or in general, another way is to continuously hold a lit firelight, and an igniter offhand if needed; this will slow the passive sanity drain down, and will theoretically grant a longer time to find the ghost. However, this will limit one's ability to carry other items; balance this against evidence collection and objective completion. A decent compromise is to set lit firelights in the ghost room and along the path that the player needs to take to get to the ghost room, but this in turn can cause their fuel to burn out rapidly (if the player does not have tier III firelights) without fully utilizing their sanity drain reduction, and leave the player with no firelights when they need the effect later on. ===Hunts=== When a hunt ends, the ghost will be teleported to the favourite room. If interactions occur in a certain room shortly after a hunt ends, then that may be the favourite room (or nearby), especially if it is "chain-hunting" and hence returning to its favourite room more often. You may also pay attention to the ghost's starting point to narrow down the favourite room; the location where a hunt begins is usually in/near the favourite room, as hunts always start from the ghost's current location, except for The Twins. Keep in mind that the Wraith, the Banshee, and the Phantom have special movement abilities which may lead to hunts starting far away from the favourite room. If the player has a particularly high risk tolerance and/or confidence in their skills, simply triggering a cursed hunt can be a fair method of locating the ghost. ===Hunt interactions=== During a hunt, ghosts will throw items at fairly frequent intervals, as well as interact with doors along the way. If you find an abnormal number of doors open (especially with the 'Doors starting open' difficulty option set to None) or items thrown on the floor, then the ghost is likely to have walked through the area while hunting. Note that ghosts can choose not to open doors or throw items, or there were simply no props near the ghost for it to do so. ===Increasing the chance of being given a clue=== Saying recognised phrases such as "give us a sign" has a chance of causing the ghost to perform an interaction, though the player must be in the same room as the ghost, and there is a 10 second cooldown on this chance being triggered. This means that walking around repeatedly saying trigger phrases may be more detrimental as opposed to listening carefully for any interactions the ghost performs naturally. Simply talking near a Yokai will also increase its activity and its hunt sanity threshold. Note that no phrase can "force" the ghost to perform particular types of interactions. ===Avoiding red herrings or errors=== In any difficulty, the ghost is just as likely to wander around and cause disturbance outside the favourite room. In Professional, Nightmare, and Insanity difficulties, the favourite room itself may change. In either case, other than when detecting Ghost Orbs, placing and using equipment in both the suspected favourite room and surrounding areas where the ghost may wander will help to reduce hassle in moving equipment between rooms. ===Dead players=== If a player died before the ghost could be found, they may produce various red herrings from beyond the grave, whether it be of malicious intent or purely accidental. Dead players will trigger motion sensors just like the ghost, which may significantly misdirect or confuse remaining players of the whereabouts of the ghost, though a motion sensor getting frequently triggered is usually a sign of a dead player. Additionally, dead players often have the habit of throwing/moving the props around the map to pass time, which can sometimes be mistaken for ghost interactions. Noticing regular items being dropped or piled, or thrown directly at alive players in a humorous manner is the sign of a dead player interacting and not a ghost. Moreover, objects being displaced by dead players will never emit noise or give out EMF readings. ===Sounds=== Some maps have "ambient" sounds that play randomly at random locations. These ambient sounds are not produced by the ghost, although they may initially be confused for ghost sounds. Examples include: the little "cling" sounds that are often heard in Prison, branches cracking in Maple Lodge Campsite, the distant screams heard on Sunny Meadows Mental Institution, and the creaking and settling of floors on most house maps. These are produced randomly by the map itself, and the ghost does not create them and do not help in locating it. In contrast, the sound of a cell door opening or closing is not an ambient sound and can only be caused by either the ghost or a player opening or closing a cell door. During bad weather (e.g. heavy rain), one may mistake ambient sounds for ghost activities such as window knocks; use an EMF reader to verify whether the ghost actually knocked a window. ===The Mimic=== The Mimic can copy any ghost type, including the Twins. While being that type, it can mislead and confuse players even further, letting them to believe that the favourite room was not identified correctly. Always be on the lookout for orbs; having a video camera in the general area of manifestations is crucial for knowing both what type of ghost it is and where it(s favourite room) currently is. ==See also== *Identifying ghosts Category:Guides fr:Guides/Localiser l'entité
title: Guides/Locating the ghost

content:
A ghost event is a manifestation of the ghost in the mortal world other than a hunt and which does not directly interact with the environment (unlike an interaction). Ghost events vary from full on physical apparitions to mere balls of smoke and usually produce sound (hissing, moaning, chanting etc.) perceivable without the use of specialized equipment. ==Mechanics== ===Triggering ghost events=== When the ghost attempts to perform a ghost event, it will check for players in the investigation area within a certain range (tested to be 15 metres) on the same floor. If successful, the closest player within the range will be chosen as the ghost event's target each time. If the ghost chooses to manifest, it will be teleported to near the player first. Ghosts do not teleport for mist form events. An EMF 4 reading will be generated at the point where the ghost is at the start of the event. Players can trigger ghost events by drawing The Devil card from a deck of Tarot Cards. Some other cursed possessions can trigger specialised ghost events. Otherwise, ghost events are random, and a lower average sanity increases the chance of them occurring. Neither smudging nor verbally provoking the ghost will increase the chance of a ghost event. ===Blacklisted rooms=== Ghosts cannot perform ghost events towards a player if the latter is standing in the following rooms: {| class="fandom-table" !Bleasdale Farmhouse !Point Hope !Prison !Brownstone High School !Sunny Meadows |- | *Kitchen *Trophy Room *Attic Bedroom | *Kitchen *Maintenance Room *Lantern Room Bottom | *Office Hallway | *Lobby *First Floor Main Corridor *First Floor Left Corridor *First Floor Right Corridor *Second Floor Main Corridor *Second Floor Left Corridor *Second Floor Right Corridor *Classroom 1 *Classroom 14 | *Female Day Room *Male Bathroom *Basement West Corridor *East Visitors' Room *Restricted Area *Courtyard Corridor *Female Wing *Male Wing |}
Ghosts and the mist form can still follow a player into these rooms from an adjacent room. Events caused by cursed possessions can also bypass this restriction. Currently, the general rule of thumb is that if the targeted room does not have any doors connected to it (i.e. actually linked to the room, meaning they close when using the Monkey Paw's trap wish), is not part of a basement, and is not on a small map, then the ghost will be unable to perform an event by itself. Maple Lodge Campsite does not have blacklisted rooms as the ground floor/camping grounds is actually considered a basement. The "fake hunt without vocalisations" ghost event is still possible in these rooms (but this type of ghost event is currently bugged, see below). It is unknown whether this is intended. ===Types of events=== ====Manifestation==== When the ghost chooses to manifest, there are several subtypes which it may perform: *The ghost stands in one spot and sings; this is usually known as a singing event. Male ghosts will hum an unknown, low-tone tune, while female ghosts will sing Ring a Ring o' Roses. **For the Krampus model during the Winter's Jest event, this was another ~30-second tune. **For the forest spirit model during Easter events, this was the female vocalisation played backwards. **For the snowman model during the Holiday 2023 event, this was a variation of Jingle Bells. *The ghost remains stationary. One of three things will happen: **No additional features other than the lights in the room turning off. **All lights in the room will be glowing red for the duration of the event before turning off. **All lights in the room will flicker (if turned on), then shatter at the end of the event. *The ghost chases and walks towards the player who triggered the event. If it goes near enough to the player, it will disappear and hiss sharply. Otherwise, it will disappear without any sound if enough time has elapsed. The ghost will walk at the standard ghost speed of 1.7 m/s, regardless of ghost type or ghost speed settings. This is known as a fake hunt event and it creates two EMF 4 readings instead of one. **The fake hunt event has a variant where the ghost does not produce vocalisations. This event can't occur if the room the target player is in doesn't have lights. This variant is bugged since 0.10.0; the event will only turn the lights off and the ghost will spawn in, visible for a single frame. In all subtypes except for the singing event, the ghost will select a random hunt vocalisation. During the event, many things will happen: *The ghost will manifest in either its full form, a shadow which is only visible under light, or a jelly-like, almost see-through form. *Nearby electronics will malfunction and lights will flicker, giving the impression of an ongoing hunt. *For singing events and fake hunt events, all doors in the room where the target player is will close (including exit doors, but without locking them), and the lights in that room will also turn off. **The fake hunt without vocalisations does not close doors and will end prematurely if the player turns on a light or leaves the room the event started in. *Light switches cannot be toggled in the room where the ghost event occurs if the lights will shatter at the end of the event. *Ghosts will not leave fingerprints on doors being closed and lights being turned off by the event. The ghost event will end prematurely if the ghost goes near enough to the target player, making it disappear. ====Mist Form==== The ghost will turn off all lights in the target player's room and cause a small white cloud to appear in the room. The cloud will then begin floating toward the player, and if it reaches them it will disappear, and cause a sharp hissing sound, in which the pitch and duration is always the same. If the player keeps their distance from it long enough, it will eventually vanish without hissing (or draining any sanity). This event goes by multiple names, such as "airball", "smoke ball", or simply "mist". Note that there are other "mist"-like things or graphics effects that can all be confused with each other, such as freezing breath, incense smoke, or lighting bloom. ====Summoning==== This event can be triggered by using a Summoning Circle or the Monkey Paw's "I wish to see the ghost" wish. When used, the ghost will be teleported to the circle (or stay at its current location instead when using the Monkey Paw), become visible and remain trapped there for 5 seconds. Afterwards, it will begin a cursed hunt on the spot. ====Music Box==== This event can only be triggered by using a Music Box. If the ghost is within 5 metres (2.5 metres for Yokai) of an actively playing music box, it will become visible and begin walking towards the box. If it walks for 5 seconds, touches a player holding the music box, or the music box is dropped, it will begin a cursed hunt. ===Sanity drain=== If the ghost event target collides with the ghost or the mist form, causing it to disappear, 10% of their sanity will be deducted. For light-shattering events, the player has to be near the ghost when the event ends. Some ghosts have differing rates of sanity drain: *Banshee: 15% sanity instead of 10% if: **The ghost event is of the singing type, and **The ghost event target is also the hunt target. *Oni: double sanity drain for all types of events. *Phantom: Additional 0.5%/s sanity drain if the player is within 10 metres of the ghost while in pseudo line-of-sight (where heartbeats play). ===Ghost event rates and preferences=== Some ghosts have a preference for certain types of ghost events, or have modified rates of ghost events: *Banshee: Higher chance of singing ghost events. *Mare: Higher chance of light-shattering ghost events. *Oni: Will never perform the mist form ghost event, and is more likely to appear in its full form when manifesting. *Shade: Higher chance of shadow model for manifestation events, and increasing sanity (above 50%) corresponds to decreasing chance of ghost events overall. **Also has a chance of showing up as a shadow model when summoned via the summoning circle, the music box, or the monkey paw, for the duration of the ghost event. *Thaye: Initially 100% more likely to perform ghost events. Every time it ages, the likelihood decreases by 15% in absolute terms, decreasing to 50% once it has aged completely. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" ! colspan="9" |Advanced mechanics |- ! colspan="9" |WARNING: This data is not officially verified. |- ! rowspan="2" |Ghost ! rowspan="2" |Singing ! colspan="3" |Standing ! rowspan="2" |Chasing ! rowspan="2" |Mist Form ! rowspan="2" |Chasing without vocalizations |- !Standard !Light-breaking !Red light |- |Standard |20% (1/5) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |- |Banshee |46.67% (7/15) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |- |Mare |20% (1/5) |4.44% (2/45) |11.11% (1/9) |4.44% (2/45) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |20% (1/5) |- |Oni |20% (1/5) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |40% (2/5) |0% |20% (1/5) |- |Shade |0% |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |6.67% (1/15) |20% (1/5) |60% (3/5) |0% |} ===Non-ghost events=== The following are not considered ghost events: *A hunt or a cursed hunt. *Any ghost activity occurring during a hunt. *Room lighting fading or dimming for 1-2 seconds. *Firelights burning out by themselves. *Any interaction. *The Yurei's ability to shut a door and deduct nearby players' sanity. ==Tips== *Although smudging is not known to directly increase the chance of a ghost event, doing so when sanity is very low may allow the ghost to perform a ghost event instead of hunting. ==Related difficulty settings== *Event frequency: The chance for the ghost to trigger an event ==Objectives== {| class="article-table" !Objective !Actual requirements |- |Have a member of your team witness a Ghost Event |Have a ghost event occur |} ==Trivia== *Doors being closed during a ghost event will create a photographable EMF 2 or 5 interaction. ==References== Category:Ghost State fr:Événement paranormal ru:Паранормальное явление
title: Ghost Event

The Infrared Light Sensor was an item that helped to indicate the ghost's physical location. It was removed in 0.3.0. ==Usage== When a player, dead player or ghost walked past the infrared light sensor, it would illuminate the surrounding area with a bright light, allowing players to track the ghost to a certain degree while on-site. The Infrared Light Sensor did not provide feedback to the truck, nor did it count for the "Detect the ghost with a motion sensor" objective. Due to its very limited utility, it was merged with the Motion Sensor. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !August 13, 2020 |Added the Infrared Light Sensor as an equipment. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access (Steam) |- !0.3.0 |Removed the Infrared Light Sensor. |}

content: The lobby, or warehouse, is the place players will spawn upon starting up the game or finishing a contract. It is a warehouse that has been converted into the lobby. The lobby is used as an intermission area for players to find or create servers, play minigames while waiting, purchase equipment, or simply to interact with other players. ==Layout== The lobby contains several distinct areas, which are, clock-wise: ===Main menu board=== This is where players will spawn upon launching the game/joining the lobby. This board acts as a user interface and contains several options. To access the board, the player must press Space or left-click on it; it is not necessary to be in front of the board if pressing space. Players can press Space again or the Esc key to leave the board. ====Main menu==== This is the menu which will appear before joining a lobby. From there, players may either create or join lobbies as well as view their daily and weekly objectives progression. * Singleplayer - create a singleplayer session * Multiplayer - create or join a server * Training - learn the basics of ghost hunting * Twitch Drops - link your Twitch account to the game * Options - adjust the settings to your preference * Credits - Shows a list of people who directly contributed to the game's development * Quit - exit to desktop ====Lobby menu==== This menu appears upon joining a lobby. It allows the host and other players to adjust server settings and manage players before starting a game. Every player in the lobby will appear as ID Cards on the board. The host is able to kick players from the lobby using the "X" button next to the player's card, whom will be barred to join again until the host leaves. All players can also adjust the volume of other players for themselves using the scroll bar at the bottom of the player's card. If the lobby is set to "private" upon creation, a code will be assigned to it, which will be displayed in the top right corner. Players are able to copy the lobby code to share it to others or hide it from view (this will not hide it for other players in the lobby; this feature is meant for streamers to prevent viewers from joining the lobby). The server settings can be managed through these buttons: * Change - Allows the host to change the difficulty or create a custom difficulty (see below). Non-hosts can view the current difficulty through this button. * Leave - Disconnects the player from the lobby * Ready - Marks the player as "ready" to start the game. Every player in the lobby must be ready for the host to start the game. * Start (Host) - Starts the game. ====Difficulty selection==== By clicking on the pen icon by the difficulty box, players will be able to view and edit the current difficulty through the "change" button. Alongside the five default difficulties and the Challenge Mode, there are three custom difficulty preset slots players may edit in order to create unique gameplay experiences. ===Shop=== This is where players can buy or sell equipment as well as add them to the game through a large touch-screen. Players may also create custom loadouts they may select upon entering a lobby. The area is also decorated with display cases and two large wall racks containing all equipment. ===Display area=== This area consist of several display cases where collectibles and items found during investigations will appear, including: *Bones (certain bones such as hands, feet, femurs, etc. must be collected twice) *Cursed possessions used during investigations (Tarot Cards are collected individually by drawing them from the deck) *Trophies related to special events. *Trophies related to Achievements/Trophies. Clicking on items inside the display cases will allow the player to inspect them closer. ===Entertainment corner=== Going up the stairs, there is a mezzanine where several games and entertainments can be found. ====Basketball==== There is a basketball hoop on one of the walls as well as two basketballs on a table in a corner. The hoop is equipped with a score display that will count the number of goals a player has made. The number of goals is specific to each player; one player scoring a goal will not increase the score of other players and the number of goals will carry over from one server to another. ====Cornhole and ring toss==== Sets of cornhole and ring toss games. The rings and bags for each game can be found on the same table as the basketballs. ====Bowling==== There are pins disposed on the floor along with a small bowling ball players may toss. The pins can be similarily to firelights. ====Jenga==== A stack of jenga blocks (branded "Biggish Blocks") where players may play jenga. Each jenga block can be in a manner similar to Video Cameras. ===Staff room=== A dark, inaccessible room located under the entertainment corner. By peering through the window, the Patient 07 ghost model can be seen twitching at the far end of the room. ===Event board/Boombox=== There is a table next to the staff room where the Event Board, a boombox, and two clipboards displaying the Daily and Weekly Tasks can be found. The boombox can be toggled on or off to play techno music for the player that has activated it. It may also play themed music or start on during special events. The music titles played by the boombox are: *Rik4k - All Aboard *Rik4k - Back in Time *Rik4k - Dreaming Emotion *Rik4k - Enlight *Rik4k - Forgotten Truth *Rik4k - Luminosity *Rik4k - Peace Circus *Rik4k - Promotion *Rik4k - Rocket Science *Rik4k - Summer Ending ===Truck=== The players may access and explore the truck from this area. The corkboard inside displays the 10 last pictures taken during a game. ===Event leaderboard=== Only available during special events, a leaderboard displaying the Top 10 players having contributed to the current event, and the player's own rank and points. ===Map selection board=== On the left of the main menu board, there is another corkboard where players can choose the next map to play on. This is a vote-based system; the map with the majority of votes will be the one chosen for the contract. If multiple maps have the same number of votes, the game will randomly choose between the tied maps upon starting the contract. The players may also choose the "random" option to let the game select the map for them. ==Events== On multiple occasions, the lobby has been decorated to celebrate various special events: ===Halloween 2020=== During this event, the lobby was decorated with Jack-o-lanterns, the lights were dimmed out. and particles resembling Ghost Orbs were floating near the board. The sky outside was also turned bright red. ===1st Year Anniversary=== The lobby was decorated with various party accessories, including banners, party lights, interactible balloons scattered on the floor, as well as Glowsticks of different colors players could pick up. Player models were also given party hats that they would keep for the entire game while the event was ongoing. It is also during this event that the boombox was introduced. ===Halloween 2021=== Most of the lights in the lobby were turned off, the sky turned an ominous bright red and particles resembling ember floated around the white board, giving the lobby a very sinister ambience. UV flashlights were disposed under the white board, which could be used to reveal various messages and writings all over the walls and floor. Some special elements were are also added: *The door by the electrical board is slightly ajar. Peering through will make the ring girl ghost model suddenly appear in the gap with a loud hissing sound. *A shadowy child ghost model with bright glowing eyes is peering down at players from the rafters above the white board. This is modified from the "tooth-faced" ghost model. *There is a skeleton hidden in one of the lockers. Player models also wore paper masks representing various ghost models for the entirety of the event. After the event ended, the lighting and particle effects were removed, but the UV messages and other physical decorations remained. One UV flashlight stayed available on the equipment shelf for use. ===Holiday 2021=== The lobby gained a Christmas tree with several presents surrounding it, two minigames for players to spend time on, snowballs to throw, and snow covering part of the floor. Player models wore elf hats for the duration of the event; additionally, one of the ghost models was temporarily changed to wear a Santa hat, wield an oversized candy cane instead of an axe, and ring jingle bells every time it made an audible step. ===Halloween 2022=== The lobby received ominous lighting effects as well as various thematic props, such as skeletons, candelabras and jack o' lanterns. The jack o' lanterns could be lit using a lighter found on the table where the boombox is. A then-upcoming Tier III UV Light could be picked up from a box behind the counter of the shop area and used to reveal various writings on the wall. Peering through the Staff Room door at the ghost model inside would cause a demonic circle to appear in the middle of the lobby with ominous grandfather clock sound effects, surrounded by five sheet-covered ghosts (these are merely accessory NPCs, not to be confused with actual ghosts) who would whisper and emit freezing breath. If the player walked into the middle of the circle, the ghosts would start to slowly close in with a rising sound effect, until they all suddenly dematerialize, leaving the sheets dropping to the ground and finishing the event. ===Holiday 2022=== Between 0.8.0 and 0.8.0.7, the lobby featured several decorations: * Christmas fairy lights and bells * Stockings hung on the walls * 3 snowmen who turn their heads to look at the player * A cookie plate on the table * Christmas-themed music (using the same music as 2021) ===Halloween 2023=== The lobby was very similar to the Halloween 2022 lobby with the same thematic decorations minus the lighters and the Tier III UV Light. The demonic circle event was also present. ===Holiday 2023=== The lobby received several themed decorations: * Christmas fairy lights * Stockings hung on the walls * 4 snowmen * A cookie plate on the table * Snowballs * Presents * Christmas-themed music (using the same music as 2021) ===Easter 2024=== The lobby received several themed decorations: * A Summoning Ritual * Twigs * Bunnies * Fireflies * Nests with eggs ===Crimson Eye=== During the Crimson Eye event, the lobby received Halloween-themed decorations: * A Blood Altar * Candles * Demonic symbols * Halloween-themed music ===Winter's Jest=== During the Winter's Jest event, the lobby received Christmas-themed decorations: * A Christmas tree * Snow * Presents * Christmas-themed music ===Cursed Hollow=== During the Cursed Hollow event, the lobby received Easter-themed decorations: * Straw * Wooden bunnies * Fireflies * Ominous whispers on the boombox ===5th Year Anniversary=== In 0.14.1.0, as Phasmophobia celebrated its 5th anniversary, decorations such as balloons, fanions, confetti, usable confetti poppers, and an anniversary cake were added to the lobby. ==Trivia== *The lobby that came with the initial Steam release of Phasmophobia was a modified version of the Garage Workshop pre-made Unity asset. Many elements from this pack were also used in other areas of the game, such as the lockers and clutter like crates or bins found across some of the pre-Apocalypse update maps. *Shooting 666 hoops will trigger lighting and thunder outside. *Between 0.3.0 and 0.3.1.2, old equipment models could be found in a cardboard box on a shelf on the right of the whiteboard. *Two rings from the ring toss can be linked together by throwing the first one upwards and collide it with the second one by the same way. This is most likely a Unity physics bug. *An engraving on the side of the table with a boombox reads JOJO WAS HERE. This is a reference to an official Phasmophobia content creator, JOJOsaysBREE. *Several runes could be found in the display area using a UV Light between 0.8.1.0 and 0.10.0. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.7.0 |Updated the lobby. |- !0.10.0 |Removed Point Hope teasers. |- !0.11.0 |Added the Event Board. |- !0.11.1.1 |Added the Event Leaderboard. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.13.0 |Added trophies to the display area. |- |Reworked the main menu board. |} ==References== Category:Maps fr:Lobby
title: Lobby

content:
This guide demonstrates how to survive a ghost's hunting phase in Phasmophobia, as well as necessary information to do so. During regular gameplay, and not taking into account the use of certain cursed possessions, the hunt is the only mechanic in which a ghost can kill players one at a time by colliding with them. No items can end a hunt, although lit Incense can disorient ghosts for some time. Thus, in order to survive, players are required to either hide from, try to outrun, or loop the ghost for as long as they can until the hunt ends. ==Identifying the start of a hunt== Hunts are not always easy to tell apart from other manifestation ghost events (especially by newer players). The following is a list of indicators that are unique to hunts, manifestation ghost events, or shared between both: {| class="fandom-table" !Indicator !Hunt !Event (manifestation) |- |Exit Doors |Will audibly and physically lock and/or close, depending on whether the door was (re)opened prior |May close (not lock) for singing/chasing event that occurs in the same room as said exit door |- |Doors |No interaction |Singing/chasing event: All doors in the room where the event occured will close
All other events: No interaction |- |Lights |Will stay in same position and cannot be toggled until hunt ends
Will dim or flicker on ghost approach
Will immediately turn off as the hunt ends |Will either turn off at the start of the event, or have a small chance to either turn red, or shatter then break as the event ends
Cannot be toggled in the room where the event occured (only red-light/light shattering events)
Can be toggled in all rooms for all other events |- |Ghost Model appearance |Always full model |May appear as a full model, shadow, or semi-transparent |- |Model phasing (blinking) |Will be invisible during the grace period, then start phasing as it hunts |Will immediately and always be visible for the duration of the event, and never phase |- |Speed |Will move at several various speeds depending on its type and situation; see Hunt#Ghost speeds |Either remain stationary, or chase a player at 1.7 m/s for a short while before disappearing (chasing duration may vary) |- |Footsteps |Always heard upon beginning to move |Only heard for chasing events |- |Vocalisations |Same vocalisation for every hunt in the same contract |In addition to any regular vocalisations, female ghosts can use "Ring Around the Rosie" tune while male can produce a low-tone two notes during singing events |- |Electronic interference/global chat static | colspan="2" |Will flicker within 10 metres of the ghost (15 metres for Raiju) on the same floor |- |Heartbeats | colspan="2" |Plays within 10 metres of the ghost and having "heartbeat line-of-sight (LoS)" |}
Keep in mind that unless a cursed hunt is initiated, ghosts cannot hunt for a certain duration (90 seconds for most ghosts) after being smudged. ==Surviving a hunt== There are many strategies for surviving a hunt. Some of these may involve riskier tactics, while others may require cooperation between players. Often, using multiple strategies will help to achieve the highest chance of survival. ===Knowing the map's layout=== It is ideal to get a good sense of the layout of all maps, including good hiding places, potential dead-ends, and routes for you to escape. Map layouts range from the near-symmetry of Brownstone High School and Sunny Meadows, to the organic layout of Maple Lodge Campsite, to the tighter environments of 42 Edgefield Road and 6 Tanglewood Drive. Knowing the symmetry of the map may improve your understanding of the layout. ===Hunt prevention=== Preventing hunts from occurring in the first place is a very dependable way to reduce the risk of dying. ;Incense *Smudging the ghost will prevent hunts for the next 90 seconds (60 seconds for Demon and 180 seconds for Spirit). This applies even when the ghost is smudged during a hunt, though the ongoing hunt will not end. It may be preferable to smudge just as a hunt is about to end (if you are far away from the favorite room), or just before the hunt cooldown is over. *Note that if an existing hunt prevention cooldown from a previous Incense is still ongoing, using a new Incense will not restart the timer. ;Crucifix *In some cases, it may be more ideal to place a crucifix along the escape route near the favorite room, so that the ghost does not initiate a hunt from there. Make use of the visible crucifix radius to cover a larger area. ;Sanity *If you start with 100% sanity, almost all ghosts cannot hunt immediately unless you use a cursed possession. By turning on lights, holding lit candles, avoiding ghost events, and taking Sanity Pills as needed, you can keep sanity well above the threshold for most ghosts for a longer time. If you start at lower sanity, these strategies may decrease in usefulness. Though hunts are dangerous, in some cases it may be necessary for them to happen for the players to identify the ghost or complete objectives. ===Communicating hunts=== When a hunt starts, there is usually a short grace period before the ghost can actually detect or kill players. Communicating to other players that a hunt has started can help them to get a head start on the ghost and be more likely to survive. As players that are far enough from the ghost can still use global chat, they can communicate that a hunt has started if they realize so. Some clues include all the exit doors locking, the activity level displayed in the truck reaching 10, and light switches becoming unusable. Note that some of these may also be caused by ghost events or other factors. ===Running away=== Once a hunt starts, try to figure out where exactly the ghost will spawn. The only indicators of where the ghost will be are electronic interference and its hunting noise, so a stereo audio setup is recommended. Depending on where the ghost begins, decide which hiding spots are feasible and begin to move. *Try not to hide near the area where the ghost could spawn; otherwise, hiding near the ghost could mean it detecting you quickly, then looking around your last seen location first. However, if you can reach a decent hiding spot before the ghost can detect players, then don't be afraid to hide near the ghost; as long as you are hidden in time, it does not matter whether the ghost is nearby or far away. *If the ghost spawns just outside the room you're in, try to get to the safest spot against an adjacent wall, so your line of sight can be broken by at least another corner. *Use the sprint ability strategically, as it will only allow the player to run for 3 seconds before having a 5 second cooldown, limiting the player to walking. It can either be used whenever a hunt starts to gain a head start on the ghost to quickly reach a hiding location or to quickly break line of sight if the ghost happens to spot the player. *Most ghosts speed up with continued line-of-sight. Hence, refrain from running in a straight line from the ghost; use corners or objects to your advantage instead. If you happen to run into a long hallway or a corridor, always consider pointers to break line of sight such as doors or stairs. Generally, using two line-of-sight blockers in quick succession (e.g. by turning corners and closing doors) before entering a hiding spot is a great way to shake off the ghost effectively. *Once you know the route, turn off your electronic equipment as soon as possible. Having lit firelights, igniters, or Tier II UV lights does not attract the ghost and can safely be used in case you still need to see. *If the ghost had the chance to spot you or a teammate, it will "camp" around that location for a little, before moving to a new random area. Make sure you are always moving towards the hiding spot and be very attentive to its hunting sounds. The Myling's vocalizations are audible only from a shorter distance, while some vocalizations can be very soft. *Some ghosts (e.g. Revenant, Hantu) have different speed abilities that may allow them to catch up even quicker. This is important to note if the ghost's location is relatively free of obstructions, making it harder to break line-of-sight with the ghost and enabling it to continue chasing at high speeds. ===Hiding=== While searching for the ghost or afterwards, players should identify accessible hiding spots around the map. Hiding spots may sometimes be inaccessible, forcing players to take potentially riskier routes to escape the ghost during a hunt. Note that some object/furniture hiding spots are not "official" hiding spots, and hence will never be blocked off. In addition, there may be certain locations which may act as decent hiding spots, even without furniture. So there are usually more "hiding spots" available than listed, depending on the risk you can take. If the ghost is a Deogen, however, hiding is pointless and may cause the player to get cornered and killed as it always knows where all players are during a hunt. ;Official hiding spots Players should prioritize official hiding spots such as closets, lockers, small tents, etc., as these are usually the safest spots. ;Furniture Generally, recommended hiding spots based on furniture can often be located in a dead end, such that the ghost will rarely path all the way to that area, and the only line-of-sight to the player is from the area right beside the hiding spot. As a general rule of thumb, if the furniture covers the player to at least the horizontal eye level, it should be a viable hiding spot. Players may need to crouch where the furniture is not tall enough to fully cover them otherwise (e.g. kitchen tables/islands). Generally, furniture elements with no or small collision hitboxes such as potted plants or the bushes on Maple Lodge Campsite will not hide the player from the ghost. ;Room If all else fails, simply hiding in a room is the last resort. It is best to choose smaller and dead-end rooms. The pathable area is small, meaning that the ghost is less likely to choose that room to enter. On smaller maps, this is risky as the ghost simply has to walk into the room you're hiding in to kill you. This strategy is marginally more useful on larger maps, such as Sunny Meadows; The vast number of rooms and area the ghost can choose to cover creates a significantly smaller chance for it to find you. As the ghost can detect nearby players hiding behind open doors, you must remember to close the door if you are hiding in a small room. ;Glitched spots Some maps have spots where it is impossible for the ghost to kill a player, even when the ghost is fully aware of the player being there. This generally occurs in places where the ghost is either unable to collide with the player, or cannot achieve line-of-sight. Some of these spots may require additional actions by the player to remain safe. Users of these spots should take note that they can be patched in any update, and cannot be relied on indefinitely. ===Being far away=== On the largest maps such as Sunny Meadows and Brownstone High School, simply staying far enough away from the ghost is a relatively safe way to avoid death. In the same vein that a ghost is extremely unlikely to wander to a faraway location by chance, it will also tend to wander relatively near its starting location (e.g. in a wing of Sunny Meadows) during a hunt, and is unlikely to find players in an extremely far location as long as the latter are somewhat hidden and cannot be spotted from afar. In extreme cases, it may even be possible for an entire hunt to start and end without players realizing a hunt had even occurred. ===Lighting Incense near the ghost=== Using Incense near a ghost will cause it to ignore all players for 5 seconds. This gives the player time to escape and move to a different location to hide if needed. Beware that the ghost can still wander in the same direction as an escaping player, making it lock back onto them if it can see them. *Preferably, you should be able to reach a hiding spot by the time the Incense runs out. Avoid sprinting before you have even lit the Incense to keep the sprint for later. *Remember that each Incense can only be used once and will only blind the ghost once. Trying to light it again won't work and keeping it in your hand after it has burnt out is pointless. *The Moroi is smudged for 7.5 seconds instead of 5, giving players more time to move to a hiding spot. *If you are not the host of the current lobby or have a slow connection, try to light the Incense slightly earlier than you comfortably would, as significant lag on the player's end may cause the ghost to be registered as killing them before the Incense is actually lit. As long as the Incense is burned near the ghost, its effects will be applied regardless of the player who burned it, allowing players to effectively save each other. For example, if a player is hiding and another player is chased by a ghost nearby, the hidden player can light an Incense to disorient the ghost, and allow the escaping player to hide in the hiding spot without compromising it. ===Looping the ghost=== Some locations have furniture or walls that are located in such a way that players can loop around while the ghost is chasing them, such as Grafton Farmhouse, where one can loop between the Dining Room, the Kitchen, and the Foyer, or around the kitchen islands in various houses. Looping takes advantage of the shape of the furniture or structure continually breaking line-of-sight, reducing the ghost's acceleration. Generally, most looping is done around kitchen islands, and players usually crouch to slow the rate at which the ghost gains speed. Players looking for more intense gameplay may loop the ghost until the end of the hunt, but partial looping can also be used to run to a safer place or bide time. Looping can also be used to save other players, especially in Nightmare and Insanity difficulty if the ghost is chasing players towards a dead end. If the player plans on looping, keep the lights in the room turned on to aid visibility. Looping will generally involve the ghost reversing direction; players should keep a lookout for when it does so. Looping is generally more dangerous if the ghost is a Phantom, has a speed advantage, or is a crawling ghost, and players may need to listen for the ghost's precise location or abandon looping altogether. If the player performing the strategy is confident, they may try to take pictures of the ghost while looping, though this usually requires the player to continually have line-of-sight with the ghost, making it accelerate. Crouching while looping the ghost can drastically reduce its time with line-of-sight to you, therefor also drastically reducing how quickly it accelerates. An Incense is highly recommended in case the ghost catches up with the player. *The Deogen, Hantu and Thaye become slower than even the player's walking speed under certain conditions, and do not speed up with line-of-sight; looping these ghosts is generally much safer, and in the case of the Deogen, is essential for surviving against it. Tier III Salt may come particularly handy to loop a ghost, since it has the ability to slow down a hunting ghost for 2 seconds (this will not reset the line of sight acceleration, however). Placing lines at regular intervals may allow the player to loop a ghost for possibly the entire hunt. ===Turning off, throwing, and/or swapping electronic equipment=== As any active electronic equipment held in the hand, including flashlights (even when on the shoulder), will attract the ghost within 7.5 meters, players should turn these off or swap them to another inventory slot before entering their hiding place, or preferably as early into the hunt as possible. Note that the default flashlight with a very weak light (that cannot be removed from the shoulder) will not attract the ghost. *Ghosts will move to the last known location of a detected electronic, even if it was turned off after. Do not turn off electronics in the hiding spot - do so well before entering the spot. *In particular, any worn Head Gear should be turned off as soon as possible, as they require a short moment of holding the Special key to turn off, so if the ghost wanders nearby, it may already be too late. *Always assume that attracting the ghost is instantaneous; electronic equipment that is turned on then very quickly turned off can still be detected if the ghost is within range. *For the Yokai, this range is 2.5 metres. A Raiju will gain speed almost equal to that of a Revenant if nearby electronic equipment is active, even when thrown on the floor, so swapping electronics into the inventory, or turning them off before throwing them, is important to prevent it from gaining strength. ===Staying quiet=== The ghost is able to hear players using any form of voice chat within 9 meters; a ghost which hears a player will immediately go to their location and attempt to kill them if they are present. For the Yokai, this range is also 2.5 meters. On smaller maps, it is especially important to keep quiet, as the ghost will more often be within range to hear you if you speak. Using push-to-talk can be useful if one has sufficient background noise that may inadvertently alert the ghost. If your cat's meow is loud enough, the ghost knows! ==Recognizing the end of a hunt== When a hunt ends, the ghost will disappear and be teleported back to its room, hunting sounds will cease, and all lights will turn off and be toggleable again. If hiding away from the ghost, try toggling a light source to see if it turns on, audibly clicks, or physically changes (e.g. light switches flicking up and down). If the player is near an exit door, they may also try opening it; successfully opening an exit door means the hunt is over. If a player kill ends the hunt, hearing a player die also means that the hunt has ended, however unfortunate this may be. ==Other tips== *Listen for vocalizations and footsteps that the ghost makes to determine its location. Similarly, all electronic equipment can give players a general idea of the ghost's whereabouts during a hunt. **Keeping exit doors open provides an good indicator for a hunt starting, due to the obvious closing and locking sound the door makes upon a hunt start. *Whether a player is standing or crouching, they will walk and sprint at the same speed. The same is true whether the player is running forwards or backwards, left or right, or even running backwards while crouched. Crouching can be useful for wayfinding in the dark. *In theory, if all players manage to get outside of the investigation area during a hunt, the hunt will end prematurely. **The only legitimate method of doing so is by using the Monkey Paw. The paw can be used to unlock all exit doors even during a hunt (or if they were locked due to another reason). Category:Guides fr:Guides/Survivre à une chasse
