25.99 CAD |version= }}Phasmophobia is a psychological horror game developed and published by Kinetic Games. It became available in early access in September 2020 on Steam. In the game, one to four players take on the role of ghost hunters who work to complete a contract where they must identify the type of ghost haunting a designated site and complete other optional objectives. ==Gameplay== Players can choose to play alone or with up to three other players, the latter by creating or joining a server lobby. The host selects a difficulty level while any player can vote for a location and add equipment. The host can then start the contract when all players are ready. For each contract, the player is tasked to identify the ghost type, and three optional objectives are also assigned. To do this, the player must conduct an investigation, using their equipment to locate the ghost room and find various forms of evidence. This evidence must be recorded in the journal, which contains information about the different types of ghosts. Players can also use the characteristics of the different types of ghosts as recorded in the journal to identify the ghost. To complete other objectives, players may use equipment they have brought with them or items found on site. Some objectives depend on the ghost's activity, and the player can increase that activity by saying certain key phrases or the ghost's name. While the player is in the investigation area, their sanity gradually decreases, depending on their surroundings and certain activities that occur. As the player's sanity decreases, the ghost is more likely to initiate a hunt, where it will pursue players and attempt to kill them. During a hunt, exit doors will lock, forcing players to hide or escape the ghost for the duration of the hunt. A combination of equipment and strategies will be needed to stay alive. Players can leave whether or not the objectives have been met. After closing the truck door with all players alive inside, the contract will end and players will be rewarded with money and experience based on the completion of objectives and secondary evidence collected. These rewards can be used to purchase or unlock equipment and progress in the game. ==Availability== Phasmophobia can be purchased on the Steam Store, the Xbox Store, and the PlayStation Store. Officially, Phasmophobia supports Windows 10/11 and the Steam Deck. Unofficially, the game can also be played on Mac or Linux devices through other methods, or on Windows 7/8. Phasmophobia is compatible with any VR headset that supports OpenXR, such as Valve Index, HTC Vive and Oculus Rift. The game can also be played on Meta Quest via Air Link or Oculus Link. On PlayStation 5, it is compatible with PlayStation VR2. ==Controls== ==Gallery== File:Tanglewood hallway.png File:School hallway.png File:Sunnymeadows corridor basement.jpg File:Shop 0.9.5.png File:Flickering 0.7.jpg File:Phastock.png ==Trivia== *The word "phasmophobia" means fear of apparitions (as opposed to "phantasmophobia" which is the fear of real ghosts), but in modern usage it is most often used to refer to ghosts in general; the game was originally called Spectrophobia. Phasmophobia is considered the first early access ghost hunting game (previously and still sometimes lumped into the "survival horror" genre) that allowed direct communication with the AI via a microphone, and also the first game of its kind to use VR. *There is an unrelated game with a similar name called Phasmophobia: Hall of Specters 3D, which released in 2016. Sanity Medication is a purchasable item that is used to replenish a player's sanity. ==Mechanics== sanity medication will replenish a certain amount of the player's sanity up to the maximum of 100%, depending on difficulty: * Amateur: 40% * Intermediate: 35% * Professional: 30% * Nightmare: 25% * Insanity: 20% * Custom: 0% - 100% Consuming sanity medication will cause it to drop from the player's hand, and that item will no longer be consumable. Sanity medication cannot be consumed if the player's sanity is above 95%. Depending on the tier of the medication, the speed of restoration will differ (the tier does not change the amount of sanity restored). It is recommended to stay outside of the house/in the truck until the full sanity amount has been restored in order to accurately track sanity for hunts. * Tier I: 20 seconds * Tier II: 10 seconds * Tier III: 10 seconds ===Tier III sprint boost=== Once consumed, the Tier III sanity medication grants the player a sprint boost for 10 seconds, which means the player can run without exhaustion during that period. During the boost, the player can hear the heartbeat noise. After the boost, the user will normally consume the sprint stamina until they are exhausted. Consuming a Tier III sanity medication while a sprint boost is active doesn't extend the sprint boost time. == Tips == Strategically used, sanity medication can help to stave off hunts by bringing the average sanity back above the ghost's hunt sanity threshold. They can also be used to allow for further usage of cursed possessions such as Ouija Boards, to avoid breaking the possession. Sanity medication could even be used to identify ghosts based by seeing if they hunt above a certain threshold (e.g. Shade), or by performing a test for the Moroi. If one's aim is to delay hunts through sanity medication, specifically on multiplayer, one possible way to do this would be to distribute the sanity medication so that the overall sanity drain is slower on average. * For example, if just one player is at 0% sanity and the remaining players have enough sanity to be above the hunt threshold, then these remaining players should take the sanity medication instead of the 0% player. This would make it so that less players are reducing the average sanity of the entire team. * Another example is when all players are at varying levels of sanity; the players who tend to manage their sanity better could take the sanity medication, as long as this keeps the average sanity above the hunt threshold. Note that results may vary depending on factors such as the hunt sanity threshold, the ghost type, or players dying. Alternatively, Sanity Medication can be saved as an "emergency ration" for the last player(s) when multiple players have already died; this allows the surviving players to raise the average sanity higher than what would be possible when there are still more players alive, and possibly raise it above the hunt threshold when it wouldn't have been possible with more players. * For example, if all four players are at 0% sanity, and one player takes multiple Sanity Medication to raise their sanity to 100%, the average sanity would still only be 25%; if only two players are alive, then the average sanity would be 50% instead of 25%. Though a less common use (as Sanity Medication is often consumed in the truck and rarely brought into the investigation area), Tier III Sanity Medication can prove to be a potent tool in escaping the ghost during a hunt, as the player's sprint speed of 3 m/s is much faster than the speeds of most ghosts (barring ghosts such as Revenants or Thayes), and the player can easily outrun one while the sprint boost is active, allowing them to lose the ghost and get to safety while potentially rising their sanity enough to prevent another hunt from occurring. == Related difficulty settings == * Sanity pill restoration (%): The amount of sanity restored per sanity medication item ==Trivia== *Before 0.3.0, the substance labeled on the bottle itself was chlorpheniramine maleate, an antihistamine used to treat hay fever and allergy symptoms. == Gallery == File:Sanity Pills.png|The old sanity pills packer bottles File:New Sanity Pills.jpg|The sanity pills packer bottlers before the truck's layout overhaul File:SanityPotion.png|The tier I sanity medication shown at the Lobby File:EctoAdrenaline.png|The tier III sanity medication shown at the Lobby ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !3 February 2020 |Painkillers are now consumed instantly. |- !4 February 2020 |Renamed Painkillers to Sanity Pills. |- ! rowspan="2" |25 March 2020 |Sanity pills now have a slight delay before taking effect. |- |Sanity pills now have sound effects. |- ! rowspan="2" |7 July 2020 |The sanity restored has been reduced from 50% to 40%. |- |Sanity pills will now be removed from the hand when consumed. |- ! rowspan="2" |12 August 2020 |Sanity pills now cost $30 instead of $25. |- |Only 3 Sanity Pills can now be brought per contract, down from 4. |- ! rowspan="2" |30 August 2020 |4 Sanity pills can now be brought per contract again, up from 3. |- |Sanity pills now cost $45 instead of $30. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Changed the Sanity pills model. |- !0.4.0 |Sanity pills now restore different amounts of sanity depending on difficulty. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.6.0 |Sanity pills now need to be re-bought when consumed. |- |Sanity pills now cost $20 instead of $45. |- !0.6.0.1 |Sanity pills no longer need to be re-bought when consumed. |- !0.8.0 |Sanity pills now drop to the ground once consumed. |- ! Props are mainly useless objects scattered around the map. Both players and ghosts can interact with them, with the latter also providing evidence or facilitating investigation. ==Mechanics== Ghosts can interact with a nearby prop, usually to throw them, giving off an EMF 3 emission. Various props will have different sound effects depending on their material. ===Props=== Some props have special properties and/or can be interacted with differently by the ghost: {| class="fandom-table" !Prop !Notes |- !Basketballs and volleyballs |As well as being a lobby minigame, basketballs can be found in Brownstone High School, while volleyballs can be found in various house maps. These balls have bouncy physics, and can be teleported by the ghost. |- !Mannequin |Instead of being thrown, the mannequin can either be teleported to a specific spot on the map, or rotated in place. |- !Phones (various types) |Traditional phones can be rung, while smartphones can be vibrated. In addition, the phone in the cabin of Maple Lodge Campsite has a small chance of being rung after the nearby television or the fuse box is turned off. |- !Piano |Ghosts can interact with the piano to play random notes. Players will play the song "Adrift" when interacting with the piano. |- !Potato |A reference to the partner PsychoHypnotic. The potato can be found in a kitchen cabinet of 6 Tanglewood Drive and in Sunny Meadows's Bake House. When it collides with a surface, it emits Psycho's Twitch alert sound. |- !Teddy bears and bunnies |Teddy bears can be found in maps, and the ghost can interact with them in several ways: teleporting them, making them giggle, twisting their head, and throwing them normally. Bunnies can only be thrown or teleported. |- !Various photos in frames |Though there is no special interaction by the ghost, many of these photos are of pets of the developers, and various partners and staff of the official Phasmophobia Discord server.
The pets on display in various photo frames are:
This list is incomplete ;13 Willow Street *Willow (on entrance table, cjdxn's cat) *Ham (on wall, cat) *Bilbo (on hallway table, cjdxn's friend's cat) *Cheeseburger (in hallway, cat) ;10 Ridgeview Court *Leeroy (on fireplace, Shuee's cat) |} Category:Item fr:Accessoire

Point Hope is a medium map in Phasmophobia. It is a ten-story lighthouse, totaling sixteen rooms. It has a cramped, narrow, linear environment, with spiral staircases and circular rooms, providing a unique challenge to investigators, as sole avenues of escape can be cut off by a wandering Ghost. ==Structure== Point Hope consists of an extended ground floor underneath an additional nine, roughly evenly-sized rooms that each count as a separate floor. It has two bathrooms, one smaller one on the first floor and a much larger one that dominates the fifth floor, and two bedrooms, a master bedroom on the sixth floor and a child's bedroom directly above on the seventh floor. The top floor opens out to a balcony that overlooks the surrounding environment. ===Layout tips=== *Point Hope is defined by its very linear structure: there is only ever one route to getting to a different area of the map. *The circular Balcony on the top floor has two doors that lead out to it, but the door that has a view of the sea below has a much shorter path to the stairwell that heads back down to Lantern Room Bottom. *These rooms cannot be chosen as the favourite room: **Bathroom Hallway **Master Bedroom Hallway **Child Bedroom Hallway **Balcony *The following rooms don't have any lights and hence don't prevent passive sanity drain: **Lantern Room Top **Balcony ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== There are 11 "sanctioned" hiding spots on Point Hope: *Entry Bathroom, in the shower *Entry Hallway, closet near the exit door *Living Room, small lighthouse tent *Living Room, closet near the living room entrance *Living Room, behind the opened crate below the stairs *Kitchen, behind the cardboard next to the washer *Dining Room, behind the boxes below the stairs *Master Bedroom, behind the room divider *Child Bedroom, cupboard *Maintenance Room, lockers *Lantern Room Bottom, behind the boxes near the stairs Depending on the difficulty, some of these hiding spots may be blocked by the presence of bulky items, be sealed behind locked doors, or have their concealing elements removed: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 3 *Professional: 4 *Nightmare/Insanity: 6 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overridden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
==Cursed possession locations==
File:phope cards.jpg|The Tarot Cards spawn on Floor 1 on the table near couch. File:phope mirror.jpg|The Haunted Mirror spawns on Floor 3 besides a cupboard. File:phope ouija.jpg|The Ouija Board spawns on Floor 4, on a shelf. File:phope circle.jpg|The Summoning Circle spawns on Floor 5 on the bathroom floor. File:phope box.jpg|The Music Box spawns on Floor 6, on the table. File:phope doll.jpg|The Voodoo Doll spawns on Floor 7, on a shelf in the blue bedroom. File:phope paw.jpg|The Monkey Paw spawns on Floor 8, on the desk with the wooden horse.
==Fuse box locations== There are four locations where the Fuse Box can spawn. These are encountered along the path ascending/descending Point Hope's height: *In the Living Room, opposite the closet hiding spot in the entrance hall. The hallway door may obscure it if it is opened all the way. *In the Kitchen, between the window and the stairs to the next floor. *In the Games Room, to the side of the window at the end of the stairwell from the Dining Room. *In the Master Bedroom Hallway, next to the hall light switch. ==Tips== *A single match in a box can be found in the Games Room on the fireplace. While usually irrelevant, it is useful to know where it is in case the player makes a mistake such as bringing in Incense or a Firelight without taking an Igniter. *Due to its linear layout, it can take extremely long to get from the entrance to a higher floor room such as the Lantern Room Top; coupled with a relatively fast sanity drain and a lower maximum number of lights that can be turned on due to its medium classification, this map can be deceptively difficult if the ghost selects a higher floor as its favourite room. **Extensive use of Firelights, and keeping on the hallway lights of floors on the way to points of interest such as the Ghost Room and Fuse Box (or, in the case of a ghost located towards the top of the building, about six or seven, in order to leave margin for a light source to be turned on, either accidentally by a player or by the ghost, without tripping the breaker), is strongly advised to help preserve sanity. *During a hunt, moving between floors can be very dangerous, especially if the location of the ghost room isn't known, both due to the map's linear structure and because the ghost's vocalizations will be muffled when it's on different floors. It is best to make note of which floors have available hiding spots, and which ones can be moved to without having to pass through where the ghost is likely to be on the way there. However, due to the lack of sight lines up and down the stairwells, escaping the ghost during a chase is quite feasible, as line-of-sight can be quickly broken simply by heading up or down a flight of stairs. *Some floors feature a large, solid pillar at the centre of them, which can be circled around and used to loop the ghost. These are best used to regenerate stamina and break line-of-sight to facilitate running up or down stairs. *While the first floor has by far the highest density of hiding spots among all floors on the map (just under half of the map's hiding spots are located either in the living room or the entrance rooms), hiding on that floor can be risky, especially if the ghost is also on the ground floor. Likely due to a bug, ghosts can and will enter the hiding spots unprovoked (both during and outside of hunts) - it is advised for players to have Incense ready if the ghost is roaming around a lot nearby. ==Easter Egg: Ferryman of the Drowned== Point Hope contains an easter egg that gives the "Ferryman of the Drowned" ID Card after leaving through the truck when triggered. In order to trigger the easter egg, the player will need at least one working UV light ready and complete the following steps on any difficulty: #First, the player needs to throw three different balls in the pool table in the Games Room in any of the holes in a certain order indicated by the coloured paintings near the stairs. The order is the following: green ball, blue ball, and orange ball (found next to the dark red one). After the balls have been holed in, the key to the lantern cabinet will drop at the ball exit. #The lantern cabinet in Lantern Room Bottom can now be unlocked. However, a cogwheel is missing inside. The latter can be found in the Maintenance Room which is the room below and the player can find it leaning against a shelf to the right of the lockers. The player needs to pick it up and it into the cabinet. #Once the cogwheel has been inserted, the lighthouse's lantern will now blink periodically instead of having a continuous lighting. The player now needs to ring the large bell next to the entrance three times which will make a fire-like noise in the distance of the map. #The player must now head back to the very top of the lighthouse, go to the balcony, and look towards the island where a cave entrance with the letters "UV" will be visible with a bright fire. #Finally, the player will have to shine the UV light against the large lantern until the lantern's light turns purple. Only one player in a game has to complete this as everyone in the lobby will receive the reward, regardless of who actually completed it. ==Trivia== *This map has been teased throughout the development of the game. Many hints included newspapers in the truck referencing to three keepers who disappeared, a lighthouse being added to Maple Lodge Campsite in 0.6.0, Runes added in 0.8.1.0 teasing the name "Point Hope" when deciphered, and a map added in 0.9.1.0 on the wall in Maple Lodge Campsite's reception building designating the lighthouse as being the "Point Hope Lighthouse". The map was unintentionally confirmed on the 10th of December 2023, when the weekly task "Complete Objectives on [Map Name]" required it to be done on Point Hope. On the 3rd of January 2024, a development preview was released, officially revealing Point Hope as well as providing two screenshots of the interior. *Two Blåhaj plushies can be found in the Child Bedroom. *From left to right, the maritime signal flags in the Child Bedroom spell out "GET OUT". *The commemorative plaque at the front door states that the lighthouse was constructed in the "Province of Massachusetts" in 1802, making Point Hope the first map to be connected to a tangible, real-world location. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.10.0 |Added Point Hope. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.10.1.0 |The lantern room has been split into different ghost rooms to avoid confusion and fix sensor placement: *Lantern room top *Lantern room bottom |- |The fuse box on Point Hope will now only spawn in the entry house, kitchen, games room, and master bedroom floors. |- !0.12.0.1 |Point Hope is now classed as a medium map. |} ==References== Category:Maps fr:Point Hope ru:Point Hope Category:Medium Map

Money in Phasmophobia is used to purchase equipment to bring on investigations. ==Mechanics== Each player starts off with $0, and can earn money through finishing contracts, completing tasks, and selling off previously bought items. Money is used solely to purchase equipment, and will not interfere with any other gameplay mechanic or grant any other bonus to players. The amount of money the player has is listed in the Shop in the lobby. ===Purchasing items=== Players may purchase the following items from the item store: {| class="article-table sortable mw-collapsible" |+Item store !Purchasable item !Price !Purchasable item !Price |- |EMF Reader |$45 |Tripod |$25 |- |Flashlight |$30 |Incense |$15 |- |Photo Camera |$40 |Motion Sensor |$100 |- |Igniter |$10 |Sound Sensor |$80 |- |Firelight |$15 |Sanity Medication |$20 |- |UV Light |$35 |Thermometer |$30 |- |Crucifix |$30 |Ghost Writing Book |$40 |- |Video Camera |$50 |Spirit Box |$50 |- |Parabolic Microphone |$50 |Salt |$15 |- |Head Gear |$60 |D.O.T.S. Projector |$65 |- |Sound Recorder |$30 | | |} ===Earning money=== Players gain money depending on the objectives they complete and additional secondary evidence that they find: {| class="article-table mw-collapsible" |+Money rewards summary !Task !colspan="2"|Money rewarded |- |rowspan="3"|Ghost identification |Small map |$100 |- |Medium map |$150 |- |Large map |$200 |- |Objectives 1 - 3 |colspan="2"|$25 - 30 per successful objective |- |Media |colspan="2"|Up to $231 |- |Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|If the player identifies the correct ghost and escapes alive, $ = Ghost identification + Completed objectives |- |Perfect Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|$50 |- |rowspan="3"|Bone evidence |Small map |$25 |- |Medium map |$35 |- |Large map |$50 |- |Blood Moon weather |colspan="2"|+10% |} To get the additional Perfect Investigation Bonus of $50, the player must identify the correct ghost, complete all 3 objectives, collect the bone, and fill the journal with only unique media. The amount of money gained from ghost identification, optional objectives, recorded media, and any investigation bonus(es) is then multiplied by the difficulty multiplier: *Amateur: 1x *Intermediate: 2x *Professional: 3x *Nightmare: 4x *Insanity: 6x *Custom: 0x - 15x depending on settings If the player does not identify the correct ghost on a custom difficulty, their rewards will be rounded down to the nearest default difficulty (e.g. from 7x to 6x, which is the Insanity multiplier). Difficulty multipliers below 1x are not affected. If the player is dead when the investigation ends, the difficulty multiplier is not applied if it is higher 1x, and the money earned is halved. If the resulting money is not an integer value, it is then rounded down to the nearest integer. A summary of all the money earned in a game will be displayed on the contract payment board after completing a contract. ===Insurance=== If a player is dead when the investigation ends, all equipment that they added to the mission is lost, unless the "Lose items upon death" difficulty setting is turned off. Insurance will reimburse dead players with a portion of the money spent on purchasing those items. The percentage of money paid out is dependent on the difficulty of the contract: {| class="article-table" !Difficulty !Money refunded |- |Amateur
Difficulty multiplier ≤ 1x |50% of the value of all the added items |- |Intermediate
Difficulty multiplier ≤ 2x |25% of the value of all the added items |- |Professional
Nightmare
Insanity
Difficulty multiplier > 2x |Nothing |} Insurance money is not multiplied by the difficulty multiplier. ==Notes== *Picking up the bone and taking a picture of the bone are not the same. Each one of these actions rewards the player with money but they are not linked one to another. This means that the player can pick up the bone for the money or take a picture for the money without doing the other action. The picture of the bone will be registered in the Pictures section of the game summary, and picking up the bone will be registered in the Bone evidence category. *Insurance payout is not affected by whether a photo of the dead player's body is taken. ==Trivia== *Given that the game is set in the United States, it is implied that the currency used is the US Dollar. *The limit on the amount of money one can have is $2,147,483,647 (231 − 1), the maximum value of a Int32 variable (that is used to store the player money in the save file). *The theoretical maximum amount of money you can earn from a single contract (excluding Daily and Weekly Tasks) is $14,261, by completing a perfect game on the highest difficulty multiplier with Blood Moon weather on large maps. When additionally completing 4 of the most rewarding daily tasks (only on the 2nd, 11th, and 25th of each month) and 3 weekly tasks awarding $500 each, the absolute maximum money is $16,211. The Myling is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. It is distinct for being more talkative, but very quiet when hunting. ==Behaviour== ===Activity=== The Myling produces a paranormal sound (groaning/laughing/talking/whisper) on a Parabolic Microphone or a Sound Recorder every 64 - 127 seconds, instead of every 80 - 127 seconds for other ghosts. ===Hunt=== When hunting, a Myling's footstep and vocalization sounds will only be audible to players within 12 meters – slightly greater than the range required for electronic interference – instead of the usual 20 meters. The volume of footsteps is slightly muffled near the limit, but quickly becomes discernible as it approaches. ==Evidence== ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: A Myling is known to be quieter when hunting. Weakness: Mylings make more frequent paranormal sounds. ==Strategies== ===Behavioural identification=== The best way to identify a Myling is taking advantage of the small difference between its audible range (12m) and the electronic interference range (10m), and having a rough intuition of these ranges. If the ghost's sounds are very faint or not audible at all at the threshold of the interference range, then it is probably a Myling. Note that this test is not valid if the ghost is on a different floor, since this will muffle the audible range. This can be tested in multiple ways, such as: *Before a hunt, dropping an active electronic equipment at your preferred hiding spot, then looking for the behaviour during the hunt *Holding an active electronic equipment or using during a hunt, with incense for protection Note that the Raiju has a larger interference range (15m), which may create a similar effect. Use other methods (such as ghost speed) to eliminate the Raiju. ;Paranormal sounds If two paranormal sounds are picked up within 80 seconds on a Parabolic Microphone or a Sound Recorder, then it is a Myling. ===Surviving hunts=== On larger maps, especially in long hallways, it is prudent to visually look out for the ghost, as its reduced audible range gives it a mild advantage in catching a player off guard, while also gaining speed for longer if line-of-sight was achieved; alternatively, a Parabolic Microphone renders this a non-issue, as it will detect the ghost's footsteps and vocalizations if it is in range, regardless of whether it's a Myling or not. ==Trivia== *In Scandinavian folklore, Mylings (pronounced “mai-ling” { /ˈmaɪlɪŋ/ } or “me-ling” { /ˈmiːlɪŋ/ } for a more traditional pronunciation) are ghosts of children who were either killed by their parents, unbaptised, or abandoned. Because they were not baptized, Mylings cannot rest and are forced to roam until they can persuade a living being to carry them or their body to hallowed grounds where they can rest peacefully. Failure to meet a Myling’s demands will result in them killing the benefactor. In-game, the Myling's age and ghost model are randomly chosen, and the ghost does not have to be of a young age. *Another way that the Myling can find peace is if it can find and kill its mother. Usually it needs to be either carried by someone or get a form of "permission" to move/search from a relative in order to move from its burial place. This permission is usually obtained by trickery or vague wording of the request. They are usually depicted as small children in a early stage of decay (swollen and discoloured skin) but can choose to appear as adult if that was the age they would have been had they been alive. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Added Myling. |- !0.7.0 |Myling will now decrease the audible range of its hunt audio, instead of only footsteps. |}

The voodoo doll (or tortured voodoo doll) is a cursed possession used to force the ghost to perform interactions. ==Mechanics== The voodoo doll has a 1 in 7 chance, per contract, of being chosen as the cursed possession that will appear with one specific spawn location per map. Interacting with the voodoo doll will cause one of the 10 pins stuck in the doll to be pushed into it at random. This will cause the ghost to perform an interaction, and will drop the user's sanity by 5%. These forced interactions can include EMF Level 5 and Ultraviolet sources, but not the Ghost Writing Book. If the heart pin is pushed in, the user's sanity will drain by 10%, and the ghost will initiate a cursed hunt. If the user interacts with the voodoo doll while at 0% sanity, all remaining pins will be pushed in and a cursed hunt will also occur. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a voodoo doll will yield a photo labelled as Voodoo Doll and reward up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Photo Camera. ==Tips== *The voodoo doll can either be used to find the favourite room, by listening to where the interaction happened, or after the favourite room has been found, to force the ghost to interact with evidence sources rather than waiting extended periods for the ghost to do it on its own. *If the player is trying to force the ghost to give Ultraviolet evidence, items in the room can be removed to stop the ghost from interacting with those instead of a Ultraviolet source. *As each use has a risk of causing a cursed hunt, players should either stay in a safe location, or have Incense ready and/or have an intact Tier 3 Crucifix in the favourite room. *When using the voodoo doll with no sanity, all pressed remaining pins may cause multiple objects to be thrown at the same time. Be mindful of this to not confuse the ghost with a Poltergeist. ==Trivia== *Prior to its introduction as a cursed possession in version 0.5.0, the voodoo doll was initially a decorative prop found only on some specific maps (namely the original versions of Grafton Farmhouse and Bleasdale Farmhouse, as well as 13 Willow Street). Voodoo dolls could be photographed as photo evidence, but they otherwise had no use or effect on gameplay, even though some rumors claimed that they could anger the ghost if taken outside, or that they would always land facing the ghost room when thrown on the ground. *The Voodoo Doll was available as official merchandise for a limited time, until 11 April 2023 (UK time). A second edition was available until 30 July 2024 (UK time). ==History== {|class="fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Early Access |- !rowspan="4"|0.5.0 |Updated the voodoo doll model. |- |Voodoo doll spawning is now tied to it being a cursed possession instead of specific maps. |- |Voodoo dolls are now used to force the ghost to perform an interaction. |- |Voodoo dolls now have its own photo label. |- !0.5.0.2 |Pushing the heart pin now triggers the hunt instantly, instead of after the animation. |- !0.5.2.0 |Voodoo Doll pins can now force the ghost to interact with the Ghost Writing Book, D.O.T.S Projector and doors, instead of just clutter. |- !0.9.0 |The Voodoo Doll can no longer force the ghost to interact with the Ghost Writing Book and the D.O.T.S. Projector. |}

content: Sinks can be found in various places such as kitchens, toilets and bathrooms on any map. They can be turned on or off by both the player and the ghost. ==Mechanics== When the ghost interacts with a sink, it will fill the basin with dirty water, giving out an EMF 2 reading (with a 33% chance of being EMF 5 for the relevant ghosts). Be mindful that most but not all sinks are functional sinks. One can verify if a sink is functional by with the tap. If the player cannot turn on the tap for clean water, the ghost cannot use it for dirty water either. An example of a non-functional sink is in the garage of 6 Tanglewood Drive. content: Tripods are used to mount video cameras, essentially acting as a portable surface for them. ==Usage== Picking up a video camera and it on top of the tripod will mount the camera on the tripod. Carrying the tripod afterwards will bring the camera along as well, so the player does not need to carry both an empty tripod and an unmounted video camera. The video camera can be removed from the tripod by it. A tripod can be placed by it, making it drop below the player in the direction they are facing. Tripods can also be placed via the key; holding this key will show a translucent outline of its placement, which can be adjusted by moving the mouse left or right. Tripods are bulky items, and thus take up your hand slot while carrying it; they cannot be stored in your inventory, and switching to another item or hand while carrying a tripod will automatically drop the tripod. Additionally, tripods will hinder player movements when walked through, forcing player to more carefully chose where to place them. The tripod will allow players to position video cameras in places where no suitable surface is available, and will also reduce the likeliness of the ghost knocking over the camera than if it was placed down on its own. The stability of the tripod against ghost tampering will depend on its tier. Additionally, Tier II and III tripods have a motorized mount, allowing to rotate the camera left or right by using the arrows in the bottom right corner of the computer in the truck. ==Strategies== *The rotation feature of the Tier II and III tripods may allow players to observe the entirety of the room with a single camera, allowing to more easily find Ghost orbs or track the ghost during a hunt. ==Trivia== *The Kinetic Games logo can be spotted on the back side of the tier III tripod. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !19 June 2020 |Tripods are now level-locked. |- !17 September 2020 |Tripods can no longer be placed on the VR inventory belt. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.7.0 |Tripods can now be rotated or placed. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.9.0 |Divided into three upgrade tiers. |- |Ghosts can now knock over tripods. |- !0.10.0 |Tripod I knockdown chance increased from 20% to 30 % and Tripod II knockdown chance increased from 10% to 20% |} Category:Equipment fr:Trépied ru:Штатив
title: Tripod

content: The Mimic is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. They are known for mimicking the traits of other ghosts. ==Behaviour== ===Ability=== The Mimic is able to imitate any type of ghost, and inherit all of its features and abilities: *Interaction and ghost event rates and preferences *Hunt thresholds *Hunt movement speeds *Various forms of special abilities (e.g. Poltergeist multi-throw, Demon ability hunt) When imitating a type of ghost, The Mimic will not copy its types of evidence, and will not necessarily provide its guaranteed type of evidence on reduced-evidence difficulties such as Insanity, but can copy features related to evidence. For example, it is able to copy the Obake's six-fingered handprints or the Deogen's breathing, as The Mimic has Ultraviolet and Spirit Box as evidence, but it cannot copy the Goryo's trait of only appearing on a Video Camera when interacting with a D.O.T.S Projector, as The Mimic does not have D.O.T.S Projector as one of its types of evidence. The Mimic will always start in the "blank" state (in which it essentially mimics itself) at the beginning of a contract. When this is the case, it will act as a default ghost and have no special abilities. It will attempt to change 1 minute after an exit door has been opened for the first time, then every 30 seconds to 2 minutes, but cannot change during hunts and ghost events. Additionally, The Mimic cannot imitate the Banshee or the Dayan if it is male. If The Mimic is affected by Incense, it will not be able to hunt for the duration associated with the ghost it was imitating at that moment, even if it imitates another ghost before its end. The Mimic, when imitating some specific ghost types, will have some specific behaviours, listed below: *If The Mimic imitates a Thaye, a fixed age between 0 and 10 is randomly selected, and it will imitate another ghost using its own timer instead of the Thaye's ageing timer. *If The Mimic imitates a Moroi, and curses the player through the Spirit Box, the Parabolic Microphone, or the Sound Recorder, the curse will remain even if The Mimic switches to another ghost type. *If The Mimic imitates a Banshee, initially, it has no target. Once the first non-cursed hunt is attempted, a target is chosen randomly. The Mimic provides "evidence" of Ghost Orbs in addition to its three main evidence types, which also appear on difficulties with reduced evidence, including zero evidence. These Ghost Orbs, along with the other types of evidence if none are hidden due to the difficulty, will always exist regardless of the type of ghost that The Mimic chooses to imitate, and will behave in exactly the same way as those produced by other ghost types and will only levitate in the ghost room. ==Evidence== Though Ghost Orbs are always present, this is not considered by the Journal when inputting evidence. Whether Ghost Orbs is selected does not affect your payout even if the ghost is blanked out when selecting the ghost. ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: We're unsure what this ghost is capable of. Be careful. Weakness: Several reports have noted ghost orb sightings near mimics. ==Strategies== The Mimic's fundamental nature means that it is extremely unpredictable; it might mimic a Shade and be scared to hunt the whole contract, or it could mimic a Moroi and rapidly drain everyone's sanity then turn into a Revenant and wreak havoc with a surprise early hunt. It can theoretically have the powers of almost any ghost type at any time, most notably ghost abilities that could enable early hunts. In theory, the absolute safest way to handle a Mimic is to treat it as if it had every potential modifier that could increase its aggression/drain player sanity faster than usual, and utilize all tactics that would be used to dissuade attacks from other ghost types: *Aggression-related: **Try to minimize speaking when near the ghost (Yokai) **Turn off electronics that are no longer needed (Raiju) **Make sure to have active sources of flame in the Ghost Room (Onryo) **In general, be prepared for the possibility of early hunts (Demon/Thaye) *Sanity-related: **Avoid colliding with the ghost during an event (Oni) **Turn the breaker off (Jinn) **Avoid being in pseudo line-of-sight of the ghost (when the player hears their own heartbeat) (Phantom) **Remove items from the ghost room (Poltergeist) **Close doors in the ghost room (Yurei) In practice, however, it is oftentimes overkill and a great annoyance to perform all of these at once, with some even conflicting with each other, and most of the time it's simpler to just bring in Crucifixes early to stop any surprise hunts and/or take Sanity Medication to refill sanity as needed. Additionally, it is prudent to have Incense handy, as The Mimic may imitate fast ghosts such as the Revenant or Thaye, catch players by surprise by starting a hunt from an unexpected location if it imitates The Twins or a stalking ghost (Wraith, Phantom and Banshee), or most dangerously imitate the Deogen and require players to completely change up their strategy from hiding to looping between hunts, potentially after everyone is already situated at a hiding spot. As The Mimic always produces Ghost Orbs and appears to go over the difficulty's maximum amount of given types of evidence, players have to take care when trying to identify the ghost through evidence. However, this can also cause The Mimic to be very simple to identify, as players only need to confirm an additional type of evidence compared to the difficulty. On difficulties with all three types of evidence, identifying Ultraviolet, Spirit Box and Ghost Orbs also definitively indicates a Mimic, as no other ghost has this evidence combination. Ghost behaviour is also a relatively easy, if somewhat luck-dependent way to identify The Mimic; if the player spots conflicting ghost behaviour throughout the contract that seems to indicate different ghosts at different times, it is most likely The Mimic changing between different ghost types. Similarly, identifying the behaviour of a specific ghost type, but then getting types of evidence that it does not have, gives The Mimic away. For example, if the player hears a Banshee's scream on the Parabolic Microphone, but also gets a Spirit Box response which Banshees do not have, then it's guaranteed to be a Mimic. ==Trivia== *The Mimic is the only ghost that can leave handprints on the Exit Door: it must be mimicking a Yurei, it must use the door-closing ability on the exit door, and the Ultraviolet evidence is not hidden. Hence, this occurrence is very rare. *It is impossible to get the Doom Slayed achievement against a Mimic due to it remaining in its "blank" state for 1 minute at the beginning of the contract and therefore cannot use the Demon's ability in the required timespan. *Since the new alphabetical sorting, the Mimic is sorted under 'the' before The Twins, rather than being listed before Moroi. This may throw people off when looking for the name. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.5.0 |Added The Mimic. |} ==References== ==Notes== Category:Ghosts fr:Le Mimic
title: The Mimic

content: The Twins is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. They are known for existing as a "pair", with both Twins able to interact with the environment and start hunts "separately". ==Behaviour== Despite its name and accompanying flavor text, mechanically, The Twins is simply one ghost. This means there is no "decoy twin" to: *Set off motion sensors or step in salt *Produce evidence of Freezing Temperatures (or even affect temperatures to begin with) or Spirit Box *Perform ghost events or hunts at the same time ===Ability=== When The Twins tries to interact, one of the following occurs: *50% chance of performing one interaction within the normal range (up to 2.12 metres on small and medium maps, and up to 4.24 metres on large maps). *30% chance of performing one interaction within a larger range (up to 8.48 metres on small and medium maps, and up to 16.97 metres on large maps). *20% chance of performing its ability, which produces two interactions, one in each range, in a timespan of 1 or 2 seconds. All such interactions follow the standard 1/3 (33%) chance of producing EMF Level 5 instead of 2 or 3, regardless of which range was used to perform the interaction. ===Hunt=== As The Twins is only one ghost, two hunts cannot occur simultaneously, and it will follow the standard 25-second cooldown between hunts. When The Twins attempts to initiate a hunt, it will first perform a crucifix check at its current location before choosing to have a slow (1.5 m/s) or a fast (1.9 m/s) base speed, with each having a 50% chance. If choosing to be slow, the hunt will begin at its current location; if choosing to be fast, it will teleport close to the area where it last interacted with the large range and will hunt from there. Regardless of where The Twins hunts from, it will follow standard hunting rules. If a cursed hunt is triggered, The Twins will always hunt from the current location, but it still has a 50% chance of selecting either base speed. ==Evidence== == Strengths and weaknesses == These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Either Twin can be angered and initiate an attack on their prey. Weakness: The Twins will often interact with the environment at the same time. ==Strategies== The Twins' primary strength is its ability to misdirect: its core ability can very easily conjure red herring interactions at parts of the map far from the favourite room where it would give evidence, misleading hunters and delaying their efforts to identify it. This can be especially troublesome on larger maps like Sunny Meadows Mental Institution when trying to locate the favourite room. However, these misleading interactions can be used against it: as the ghost is not physically in the room where these long-ranged interactions occur, any indication of the ghost past EMF Level 5 cannot be obtained in the area. Using a thermometer and noting a lack of Freezing Temperatures (or, at the very least, notable temperature drops) where ghost activity is noted, failing to receive Spirit Box responses in rooms near where interactions occurred, or not being able to detect it with Motion Sensors/Salt are strong signs of the antics of The Twins trying to cause trouble. One can identify The Twins by spotting back-to-back interactions with less than 2 seconds of delay, as other ghosts need at least 2 seconds before performing another interaction. Noticing a subtle change in base speed from one hunt to another might indicate that the player is dealing with The Twins. Be sure to avoid confounding factors such as line-of-sight acceleration, or a few other ghosts which may also change base speeds between hunts. Both Twins also have a slightly different speed than the normal base speed of 1.7 m/s, which allows particularly experienced hunters to identify it from one hunt simply by noticing said difference; players should be careful of relying too much on this method though, as a few other ghosts can have a similar base speed, most notably a Moroi which has a speed of 1.915 m/s between 20% and 25% average sanity, nearly indistinguishable from The Twins' 1.9 m/s. Due to The Twins having two possibilities in regards to angles of attack for any given hunt, it is recommended to plan for the event that The Twins approaches from a planned escape route, such as through use of Incense. Additionally, as The Twins checks for a crucifix in its current location before teleporting to the location of its last large range interaction if it decides to be fast during the hunt,<ref name="twins" group="note"/> this can lead the ghost to begin a hunt directly on top of a crucifix, something no other ghost can do (outside of a cursed hunt). Identifying hiding spots in the ghost room may also come in handy (if there is one available), as players can simply hide inside the ghost room if The Twins hunts from outside the room. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.4.0 |Added The Twins. |} ==Notes== Category:Ghosts fr:Les Jumeaux ru:Близнецы
title: The Twins

content: Spirit Box is a type of evidence in Phasmophobia. It is used to determine which type of ghost is inhabiting a location. Its corresponding piece of equipment is the Spirit Box. ==Obtaining== Spirit Box evidence can be obtained through its equipment counterpart by asking the ghost various questions while it is enabled. There are some conditions to this, however: *The player must be in the same room as the ghost. *The player must be within range of the ghost (3 metres with a Tier I Spirit Box, 4 metres with a Tier II Spirit Box, and 5 metres with a Tier III Spirit Box). *All ambient lighting in said room must be off. Adjacent rooms do not need their lights disabled, and equipment doesn't need to be turned off. *Ghosts who respond only to "people who are alone" will only respond if there is only one player in the room. Otherwise, the number of players in the room does not matter. If these conditions are met, the ghost will have a chance to respond. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Advanced mechanics |- !colspan="2"|WARNING: This data is not officially verified. |- !Answer chance |The response chance depends on the spirit box tier: 50%, 60%, 70% for tiers 1, 2, 3, respectively. |} ===Possible questions=== There are three main categories of questions that differentiate the responses a ghost will give to players: *Aggressiveness *Location *Age Given the nature of voice recognition, questions may be marginally different from one another, so the following lists only contain general phrases that should be used as a guide. ====Aggressiveness==== Ghost responses are threatening with murderous intent. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Aggressive questions |- |"Are you friendly?" |- |"What do you want?" |- |"Why are you here?" |- |"Do you want to hurt us?" |- |"Should we leave?" |} ====Location==== Responses will correspond to the location of the ghost relative to the player. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Location related questions |- |"Where are you?" |- |"Are you close?" |- |"Give us a sign." |- |"Speak to us." |- |"Can you talk?" |- |"Are you here?" |- |"Is there a Ghost here?" |- |"What is your location?" |- |"Show yourself." |} ====Age==== Responses will detail the ghost's predetermined age. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Age related questions |- |"How old are you?" |- |"Are you a child?" |- |"Are you old?" |- |"Are you young?" |} ===Possible answers=== The player may try to extract information from these audio snippets, but they're not always intelligible enough. For example, when a voice saying "a young individual" is heard after asking for the ghost's age, it is safe to assume the ghost is young. Hearing "right here" or "look behind you" in response to a location-related question means that the ghost is nearby. ==Possible ghosts== {| class="article-table" |+ |Dayan |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |- |Deogen |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S Projector |Ghost Writing |- |Gallu |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |- |Mare |Spirit Box |Ghost Orb |Ghost Writing |- |Moroi |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |- |Onryo |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |- |Phantom |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ultraviolet |- |Poltergeist |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |- |Spirit |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |- |The Mimic |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |- |The Twins |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Wraith |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |EMF Level 5 |- |Yokai |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Orb |} ==Trivia== *Age related questions do not relate to the ghost's appearance. *The response voices are the heavily edited voices of many Phasmophobia content creators. *Some Spirit Box questions can also be used on the Ouija Board. Category:Evidence Category:Equipment ru:Радиоприёмник (Улика)
title: Spirit Box (Evidence)

content: The Site Map is a screen located within the starting Truck, being the top left screen. Beyond giving the name and layout of the current map, it also highlights many map details, including: * The present location of players, coded to their color on the Sanity Monitor, additionally giving a small light glow to indicate which direction they're facing * The positioning of CCTV cameras * The location of the fuse box, depending on Difficulty Depending on the map, the Site Map may either be a birds-eye view of the whole area, including outside sections, with visible props, textures and lighting (all maps added or reworked since 0.4.0); or a simplistic, greyed-out outline of only the investigation area's general layout and geometry (all older maps). In the case of maps where only the geometry is given, a few further points of interest are highlighted: * Windows, which are marked with a red line * Exit doors, which are marked with a green line * Staircases to different floors, indicated with a simplistic graphic and an arrow pointing towards the direction that the stairs are accessed to reach the next floor. On both styles of the Site Map, a couple pieces of Equipment are visible on it when placed: * Motion Sensors, which show a red bar extending a short distance outward. The bar will flash green and make an audible beep when the motion sensor is activated. * Sound Sensors, which produce a translucent orange sphere showing its effective area. Two arrows can be found on the left side of the screen, which can be used by left-clicking on them to switch to either the next floor up or down. These arrows do not "wrap around" when reaching the uppermost or lowermost floor; the opposing arrow must be clicked to switch floors. Category:Truck Equipment fr:Carte du lieu ru:Карта локации
title: Site Map

content: Temperature affects several gameplay aspects within Phasmophobia. ==Mechanics== The ambient temperature of a map, both indoors and outdoors, is dependent on the weather. Each weather type will have a specific ambient temperature that is set at the beginning of each contract. There are 4 groups of weather used to determine the ambient temperature. From warmest to coldest: *Sunrise: *Clear, Fog, Blood Moon: *Light Rain, Heavy Rain, Windy: *Snow: Before the investigation area/building is entered, all rooms will be at the ambient temperature. Though, in Amateur difficulty, all rooms will start at their maximum temperature. The ghost will not affect the temperature of its current room until an exit door is opened. When a player is in a room that is at or below , their breath will be visible. ===Affecting temperature=== After an exit door is opened, temperatures of all rooms will change dynamically. Temperatures increase at 0.025°C (0.045°F) per second, and decrease at 0.1°C (0.18°F) per second. Temperatures will decrease at 1/3 of this rate once it is below the ambient weather temperature. If the fuse box is off, all applicable rooms will return to the ambient temperature. If it is on, these rooms will slowly increase in temperature until . Only indoor building rooms are affected by the fuse box. Outdoor areas, including tents and outdoor bathrooms in campsites, are not affected. The room that the ghost is currently in will slowly decrease in temperature to a minimum of , regardless of the fuse box's state. It will slowly increase if the ghost leaves the room. The temperature of a room can be read by a thermometer. The value of the reading will fluctuate upwards from the actual room's temperature by a maximum of 3°C (5.4°F) with a tier I or II thermometer, and by a maximum of 2°C (3.6°F) with a tier III thermometer. When lit, Camp Woodwind's campfire instantly raises the temperature of its "room" to , even if the ghost is in that room. The campfire itself will usually exceed . This does not apply to Maple Lodge Campsite's campfires, which is likely a bug. ===Ghost abilities=== The Hantu's speed during a hunt is affected by the temperature of the room it is currently in. The colder the room, the faster it can move. ===Freezing Temperatures=== If a ghost has Freezing Temperatures as one of its evidences, the ghost can further decrease the room temperature to , at the lowest. ==See also== *Fuse Box *Weather *Hantu ==Notes== Category:Gameplay fr:Température
title: Temperature

content: Experience (or XP) in Phasmophobia is used to unlock various equipment and difficulties. ==Mechanics== Each player starts off at level 1 with 0 XP, and earns XP through finishing contracts. The experience required to level up increases progressively, and the level is capped at 9,999. Once level 100 has been reached, the player can choose to Prestige, which will wipe out their level, money, and equipment, in exchange for a new badge and title for the ID Card. The ID Card lists the number of levels the player has and the amount of XP required to reach the next level. The amount of XP earned each contract is displayed on the debriefing screen. ===Gaining experience=== Players may gain XP from the following sources: {| class="article-table mw-collapsible" !Task completed !colspan="2"|XP rewarded |- |rowspan="3"|Ghost identification |Small map |100 XP |- |Medium map |150 XP |- |Large map |200 XP |- |Objectives 1 - 3 |colspan="2"|25 - 30 XP per successful objective |- |Media |colspan="2"|Up to 231 XP |- |Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|If the player identifies the correct ghost and escapes alive, XP = Ghost identification + Completed objectives |- |Perfect Investigation Bonus |colspan="2"|50 XP on top of Investigation Bonus |- |rowspan="3"|Bone Evidence |Small map |25 XP |- |Medium map |35 XP |- |Large map |50 XP |- |Blood Moon weather |colspan="2"|+10% |} To get the additional Perfect Investigation Bonus of 50 XP, the player must identify the correct ghost, complete all 3 objectives, collect the bone, and fill the journal with only unique media. The amount of experience gained from identifying the ghost, completing optional objectives, recorded media, and any investigation bonus(es) is then multiplied by the difficulty multiplier: *Amateur: 1x *Intermediate: 2x *Professional: 3x *Nightmare: 4x *Insanity: 6x *Custom: 0x - 15x depending on settings If the player does not identify the correct ghost on a custom difficulty, their rewards will be rounded down to the nearest default difficulty (e.g. from 7x to 6x, which is the Insanity multiplier). Difficulty multipliers below 1x are not affected. If the player is dead when the investigation ends, the difficulty multiplier is not applied if it is higher than 1x, and their experience gained is halved. If the resulting EXP is not an integer value, it is then rounded down to the nearest integer. ===Level progression=== Players will unlock more equipment, difficulty levels, and maps as they progress. content: The Spirit Box is a piece of equipment used to find Spirit Box evidence. It creates white noise by constantly cycling through various radio frequencies, which allows the ghost to communicate with players. ==Usage== The Spirit Box can be turned on via . The Spirit Box emits a constant static noise while active. The microphone LED/icon will indicate whether or not the Spirit Box is listening (when Push To Talk or Toggle is used), or receiving microphone input (when Voice Activation is used). ===Questioning=== There are three ways to probe for a response via the Spirit Box: *If using voice chat, the Spirit Box will recognize any valid question asked by the player. *If using the text-based UI, the UI will appear upon turning on the Spirit Box. Players can then click to select one of 3 questions. The player can exit the UI by turning off the Spirit Box. *If the player selects "Voice", "System Voice", or "None" as the voice recognition method, having voice chat active (by holding the push-to-talk button or selecting Voice Activation) will enable the Spirit Box to automatically "ping" a question every 10 seconds. If nothing happens upon asking a question, it is possible the game did not recognize any valid phrase, or the player's voice recognition is not working properly. Note that the microphone LED/icon shows whether the game is picking up the player's microphone only if the player's voice chat option is set to Voice Activation. When using "System Voice", this does not necessarily mean that the system is working properly. ===Answering=== When a question is successfully registered, the Spirit Box will return one of two results: *If all the relevant conditions are met and the chance is successful, the ghost LED will turn white on a Tier I Spirit Box, the ghost icon will display on a Tier II Spirit Box, the response LEDs will turn white on a Tier III Spirit Box, and a distorted voice line will be heard through the Spirit Box. This is considered as evidence of Spirit Box. *If the ghost LED turns red on a Tier I Spirit Box, the 'X' icon displays on a Tier II Spirit Box, or the response LEDs turn red on a Tier III Spirit Box, one or more of the conditions listed below have not been met. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Advanced mechanics |- !colspan="2"|WARNING: This data is not officially verified. |- !Answer chance |The response chance depends on the spirit box tier: 50%, 60%, 70% for tiers 1, 2, 3, respectively. |} ===Evidence requirements=== In order to get a successful Spirit Box response from the ghost, all of the following is required: *The ghost has Spirit Box as one of its types of evidence. *The player must be in the same room as the ghost. *The player must be within a certain range of the ghost (3 meters with a Tier I, 4 meters with a Tier II, and 5 meters with a Tier III). *All lights in said room must be off. Light emitted from equipment, including electronic and non-electronic equipment, does not affect this. Lights in other rooms, including rooms or hallways that are directly adjacent, may be left on, and any doors between the rooms can stay open. *Ghosts which respond only to "people who are alone" will respond only if there is a single person in the room at the moment the question is asked. If the ghost is noted to respond to everyone, the number of people in the room does not affect the ghost's ability to respond. If the difficulty has a setup time (e.g. Amateur and Intermediate), this will be indicated on the cork board and in the journal. *If all other conditions are met, there is a chance of the ghost responding per question asked. The chance depends on the tier of the Spirit Box. If the player is particularly unlucky, a combination of these factors may cause the Spirit Box to repeatedly turn the LEDs red, or show an 'X', despite the ghost having Spirit Box as one of its evidences. Other than the need for the Spirit Box to be near the player, there are no further checks on where the Spirit Box itself is. ===Interference=== The Spirit Box is considered an electronic equipment. When interfered with, all the LEDs/icons will flicker rapidly. During a hunt, holding an active Spirit Box within 7.5 meters of a ghost on the same floor will attract it to the player. Note that the ghost may still respond audibly if the player asks questions while the Spirit Box is being interfered with. This also counts as Spirit Box evidence. ===Non-evidence=== The following does not count as evidence of Spirit Box: *The ghost touching a door or an object *The ghost performing a ghost event or a hunt, which may cause the LEDs/icons on the Spirit Box to flicker **One ghost vocalization involves the ghost repeatedly saying certain words; this is also not evidence of Spirit Box *Any other phenomenon not related to the Spirit Box ===Ghost-specific abilities=== *The Deogen has a 33% chance to respond with heavy breathing instead of a regular response if the player is standing within 1 meter of the ghost. *The Moroi will curse the player who asked a question if they successfully obtain a response. The cursing response will not sound any different. ===Rewards=== Successfully recording a Spirit Box response will yield a Spirit Box Response sound in the journal, rewarding up to $12 and 12 XP, depending on the tier of the Sound Recorder and whether there is a Unique stamp. Additionally, a Deogen Breathing can also be recorded, also rewarding up to $12 and 12 XP. ==Tips== *It is recommended that the Spirit Box be used early on in the investigation as soon as the presumed favorite room has been found, as using it effectively requires a player to remain alone in the dark with the ghost for several seconds, thus considerably reducing their sanity and allowing a potential hunt to start. This is especially true for higher difficulties. *As the Spirit Box emits a constant static when turned on, it may interfere with the ability to hear ghost activities properly, and the ghost can also interrupt players talking normally if the game interprets a phrase as a question; Turning it off is recommended when not in use. *Ghost replies on the Spirit Box do not count as ghost events or interactions. *It is possible to obtain a Spirit Box response from a ghost that has it among its types of evidence during a ghost event or a hunt. ==Possible ghosts== {| class="article-table" |+ |Dayan |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |- |Deogen |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Writing |- |Gallu |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ultraviolet |- |Mare |Spirit Box |Ghost Orb |Ghost Writing |- |Moroi |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |- |Onryo |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |- |Phantom |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ultraviolet |- |Poltergeist |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |- |Spirit |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |- |The Mimic |Spirit Box |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |- |The Twins |Spirit Box |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Wraith |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |EMF Level 5 |- |Yokai |Spirit Box |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Orb |} ==Types of questions== There are three types of questions that can be asked: *Aggressiveness *Location *Age Given the nature of voice recognition, questions may be marginally different from one another, so the following lists only contain general phrases that should be used as a guide. ===Aggressiveness=== Ghost responses are threatening with murderous intent. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Aggression-related questions |- |"Are you friendly?" |- |"What do you want?" |- |"Why are you here?" |- |"Do you want to hurt us?" |- |"Should we leave?" |} ;Responses {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" ! colspan='3' |Aggression-related responses |- !Response !Audio |- |"Attack" | |- |"Death" | |- |"Hate" | |- |"Hurt" | |- |"Kill" | |} ===Location=== Responses will correspond to the location of the ghost relative to the player. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Location-related questions |- |"Where are you?" |- |"Are you close?" |- |"Give us a sign." |- |"Speak to us." |- |"Can you talk?" |- |"Are you here?" |- |"Is there a Ghost here?" |- |"What is your location?" |- |"Show yourself." |} ;Responses {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" ! colspan='3' |Location-related responses |- !Distance !Response !Audio |- | rowspan="3" |Within 2 metres |"Here" | |- |"Close" | |- |"Behind" | |- | rowspan="2" |Between 2 - 5 metres (where applicable) |"Away" | |- |"Far" | |} ===Age questions=== Responses will detail the ghost's predetermined age. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" !Age-related questions |- |"How old are you?" |- |"Are you a child?" |- |"Are you old?" |- |"Are you young?" |} ;Responses {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed fandom-table" ! colspan='3' |Age-related responses |- !Response !Audio |- |"Old" | |- |"Young" | |} ==Trivia== *In real life, a spirit box scans through various radio frequencies to pick up potential sounds that may have come from a ghost, mostly through pareidolia of various different audio clips being strung together to sound like proper phrases or prudent responses to questions. *Using the spirit box by itself does not increase ghost activity or interactions, but saying recognized phrases (whether with or without the spirit box) near the ghost can provide a small boost to the rate of interactions. *Age related questions do not relate to the ghost's appearance. *The response voices are the heavily edited voices of many Phasmophobia content creators. *Some Spirit Box questions can also be used on the Ouija Board. *The tier 3 Spirit Box text does not show on VR. *Ghosts will respond to "Are you French?" as the game thinks it hears "Are you friendly?" ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="2" |0.3.0 |Changed the Spirit Box model. |- |The Spirit Box now has three different voice responses that are based on the ghost's gender. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.9.0 |Added Tier I and Tier III Spirit Boxes. |- |Changed the Spirit Box responses. |- !0.9.3.0 |Lowered the “far” response’s minimum distance to 2m, from 4m |- ! rowspan="2" |0.10.0 |Small environment lights such as lamps must now also be turned off to receive a response |- |Players must now hold the Spirit box to use it with text-based voice recognition |} ==See also== *List of voice lines ==References== Category:Equipment Category:Starter Equipment fr:Spirit Box ru:Радиоприёмник

content: Ultraviolet is a type of evidence created by ghosts that can be used to determine the ghost type. ==Mechanics== Ultraviolet evidence consists of fingerprints and footprints which can be revealed by using a UV Light. ===Fingerprints=== By default, each interaction on a valid surface will always produce a fingerprint. Exceptions include with the Obake which has a 25% chance to hide them, or when using the "Fingerprint chance" custom difficulty modifier to reduce the odds. A ghost with Ultraviolet evidence will leave behind fingerprints when it interacts with the following surfaces or items: *Most types of doors *Light switches and lamps *Windows *Keyboards *TV remotes *Cooler boxes *Mirrors (specific maps only) The Prison map has additional places where fingerprints may be left behind: *On the horizontal surface of a bar of cell doors *On the steel keyhole surface of cell doors Maple Lodge Campsite and Camp Woodwind also have additional places where fingerprints may appear: *Bases of lanterns *Interior edges around large tent door flaps/tops of small tent door flaps *Picnic benchtops *String light poles Lights flickering or interactions caused by ghost events will not result in a fingerprint being left behind in these instances. Depending on the surface area of the object being interacted with, either a fingerprint or a handprint will be visible. Fingerprints will disappear completely after 2 minutes, or 1 minute on Insanity difficulty. This can be changed using a custom difficulty setting. Additionally, the Obake can sometimes use an ability to reduce the remaining time for all existing fingerprints on the map by half. There are 18 different fingerprint patterns, including 3 which are unique to the Obake. When leaving fingerprints on surfaces it touches, an Obake has an approximately 16.7% chance to leave a non-standard pattern: *A handprint with six fingers instead of five *Two fingerprints instead of one on light switches, lamps, and TV remotes *Five fingerprints instead of four on keyboards and Prison doors For each type of door or surface that a fingerprint is possible, the fingerprint will always appear in the same spot. In addition, most doors of the same model will always have the fingerprints on only the push or pull side, but not both. For example, all Farmhouse-style doors will always have the fingerprints on the top-right corner of the door, and only appear on the "push" side. There are a few exceptions to these two rules; for example, one street/road house-style door may have the fingerprint on the "push" side while another identical door has it on the "pull" side, though they will always appear on the middle of the door. ===Footprints=== When a ghost moves any time within 10 seconds after it steps in a salt pile, it will leave a footprint with each step until it stops moving, and each footprint will produce a footstep sound and disappear after 10 to 15 seconds. If the ghost doesn't have Ultraviolet as evidence, or the evidence is hidden, its footprints will be invisible. *The Obake has a 25% chance each step to hide the footprint, creating no footstep sound when successful. Because of the random nature of the game, a ghost may step in a salt pile and choose to stop moving immediately, creating no footprints in that instance. Footprints left by the "lamprey-faced" child ghost model are slightly smaller than those left by other ghost models. ===Rewards=== Taking a photo of a fingerprint or a footprint that has been charged using a UV Light will respectively yield a photo labelled as Fingerprint or Footprint, each rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Photo Camera and whether there is a Unique stamp. Keep in mind, however, that the prints will slowly fade before becoming completely invisible after the player stops charging them with a UV Light. Invisible prints cannot be photographed and will result in an invalid photo. Each instance of a fingerprint, including repeat fingerprints on the same surface, can only be photographed once. ==Possible ghosts== {|class="article-table" |Banshee |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |Ghost Orb |- |Demon |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Writing |- |Gallu |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Spirit Box |- |Goryo |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |EMF Level 5 |- |Hantu |Ultraviolet |Freezing Temperatures |Ghost Orb |- |Jinn |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Freezing Temperatures |- |Myling |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Writing |- |Obake |Ultraviolet |EMF Level 5 |Ghost Orb |- |Obambo |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |D.O.T.S. Projector |- |Phantom |Ultraviolet |D.O.T.S. Projector |Spirit Box |- |Poltergeist |Ultraviolet |Ghost Writing |Spirit Box |- |The Mimic |Ultraviolet |Spirit Box |Freezing Temperatures |} ==Tips== *Footprints can be useful to check for Ultraviolet evidence if the ghost is not interacting with doors in a timely fashion. *Footprints can sometimes be covered by certain furniture or carpets. *During a hunt, the ghost will almost certainly open and/or close a few doors; scanning doors with a UV Light immediately after a hunt ends can often reveal some fingerprints if the ghost has Ultraviolet as one of its evidence. ==Trivia== *Exit doors can show a fingerprint. For this to happen, the ghost must be The Mimic, it must be mimicking a Yurei, it must use the door-closing ability on the exit door, and the Ultraviolet evidence is not hidden. Hence, this occurrence is very rare. ==Related difficulty settings== *Fingerprint chance (%): The chance of a ghost leaving fingerprints when interacting (only shows when Evidence given is not 0) *Fingerprint duration (s): The duration of fingerprints before they disappear (only shows when Evidence given is not 0) ==History== {|class="fandom-table" !colspan="2"|Early Access Alpha |- !29 January 2020 |Fingerprints now only show on doors that have been interacted with by the ghost rather than being on walls. |- !19 March 2020 |Fingerprints can now appear on windows. |- !11 August 2020 |Fingerprints can now appear on light switches. |- !colspan="2"|Early Access |- !0.2 |Fingerprints can now appear on Prison keyboards. |- !0.3.0 |Updated footprint visuals. |- !rowspan="3"|0.4.0 |Fingerprints now disappear after 60 seconds. |- |Fingerprints are now left only 75% of the time. |- |Added a new fingerprint design for Maple Lodge Campsite. |- !rowspan="3"|0.4.1.0 |Increased the fingerprint duration to 2 minutes. |- |Fingerprints are now left 100% of the time again. |- |Fingerprints can now be found on more surfaces in Maple Lodge Campsite. |- !rowspan="2"|0.6.0 |Added new fingerprint designs. |- |Fingerprints can now appear on house keyboards. |- !rowspan="3"|0.8.1.0 |Fingerprints will now slowly fade out, instead of disappearing instantly. |- |Footprints now fade over time, instead of disappearing instantly. |- |Improved fingerprint and footprint rendering. |- !rowspan="5"|0.9.0 |Renamed Fingerprints evidence to Ultraviolet evidence. |- |Footprints now count as Ultraviolet evidence. |- |Salt will now only reveal footprints if the ghost has Ultraviolet evidence |- |Renamed Footsteps photo to Footprints |- |Footprints will be affected by ghost traits similar to Fingerprints |- !0.10.0 |Ghosts can now leave single fingerprints on all small lamps and TV remotes in all locations |} Category:Evidence fr:Ultraviolet ru:Отпечатки
