The Wraith is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. Wraiths are best known for their purported ability to "fly" and "walk through walls", actually referencing to them not stepping on a salt pile and their ability to teleport to players randomly. ==Behaviour== ===Activity=== The Wraith will never step in a salt pile, and therefore will never disturb them. This includes Tier III Salt during hunts, rendering it ineffective against one. ===Ability=== When the Wraith is not hunting, it has a chance to teleport to a random player, generating an EMF Level 2 reading at the location where it teleported to, at the level of the targeted player's feet, with a 33% chance for this to be an EMF Level 5 reading instead. The Wraith will resume normal behaviour after teleporting. ===Miscellaneous=== Wraiths cannot and do not: *Float off the ground, whether during hunts or manifestations. A Wraith cannot be identified by looking at its ghost model. *See through physical objects such as walls and doors. *Walk quietly; Wraiths will emit footstep noises at the same volume as most other ghosts. *Walk through walls, even during hunts; they can only walk through doors (which all other ghosts are also able to do). *Actively avoid moving over salt; they do not try to path around salt piles, and will simply ignore any piles entirely. ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Wraiths almost never touch the ground, meaning it can't be tracked by footsteps. Weakness: Wraiths are afraid of Salt and will actively avoid it. ==Evidence== ==Strategies== ===Identification=== ====Salt test==== The Wraith will never step in or disturb a salt pile. If you've had undisturbed salt in the ghost's room for a prolonged period of time, then it could be a Wraith. This can be used to identify a Wraith deterministically: either during a fake hunt ghost event, when it appears in D.O.T.S, or during a real hunt, place salt in front of where the ghost is about to step. If it does not disturb the salt pile despite passing directly through it, then it is a Wraith. Note that a Gallu can also pass through a salt pile without disturbing it if it is enraged. Placing salt in the center of the Summoning Circle and then summoning the ghost is a good way to spot a Wraith. Alternatively, one could place a line of salt across a tight access route where the ghost is highly likely to pass through (e.g. a doorway for/in the ghost's room), then place a motion sensor or two on the doorway. If the ghost passes through the motion sensor(s) but never steps in the salt, then it is likely a Wraith. Note that the salt should be tightly packed enough (but not wasteful) such that a ghost that passes through is otherwise virtually guaranteed to step on the salt. Tier II or tier III salt makes this work easier since they are placed in a long pile. ====Teleportation==== The Wraith's teleporting behaviour may give rise to otherwise odd behaviour, such as: *Interactions happening far away from the favourite room and near where a player currently is (or recently was) *Seemingly random EMF level 2 or 5 readings which could not have been caused by any interaction, especially far away from the favourite room The Banshee and Phantom can also roam/walk (but not teleport) to a player, while The Twins can interact with objects far away, and of these other culprits only the Phantom can create these apparently random EMF readings when moving to a player, but it will never leave EMF level 5 readings as it does not have that as evidence and the EMF reading will be located at head level; a random EMF level 5 reading or a random EMF level 2 reading at ground level most certainly indicates a Wraith. Meanwhile, having the roaming frequency setting on Medium or High may induce similar behaviour. If desired, one could use motion sensors to see where the ghost actually is (moving) when it performs such an interaction. ===Hunt=== Although the Wraith teleporting does not by itself trigger a chance to hunt, it could possibly hunt from the location it teleported to if it meets normal hunt requirements. This makes being almost anywhere within the investigation area dangerous once average sanity is low enough; avoid being caught off guard by the Wraith starting a hunt nearby. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !18 March 2020 |Wraiths now require Freezing Temperatures instead of Dirty Water as one of its evidences. |- !22 March 2020 |Wraiths no longer leave footsteps when hunting. |- !23 March 2020 |Wraiths will now emit footstep noises when hunting, but not footprints. |- !25 March 2020 |Wraiths can now leave footprints by stepping on a salt pile. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !22 September 2020 |Wraiths no longer interact with salt piles during hunts. |- !22 September 2020
(Part 2) |Wraiths no longer leave footprints after stepping on a salt pile. They instead have a higher activity limit. |- !0.3.0 |Prior to 0.3.0, the evidence was Spirit Box, Fingerprints, and Freezing Temperatures. |- !0.8.0 |Wraiths no longer step in salt altogether |}

13 Willow Street (or simply Willow) is a map in Phasmophobia. It is a small, single-story home with two bedrooms and one bathroom, as well as a small garage and a basement. It is one of the smallest maps in the game, being only slightly larger than 6 Tanglewood Drive, but feels almost tiny due to its spacious open rooms, a sharp contrast to the generally congested environments of the other suburban homes. Willow can often make for a swift investigation due to its small size, but the lack of lockers, closets, and easily-accessible side rooms to hide in makes it relatively dangerous during a hunt. As such, players will have to learn the ins and outs of hiding behind furniture in order to survive. ==Structure== Willow consists of two bedrooms, one bathroom, a garage, and a large basement, among other rooms. See Third-party tools for a list of detailed map viewers that players may use. ===Key hiding spots and strategies=== Willow does not contain any closets or lockers, but 8 organic hiding spots are available: *Living Room, behind stacked storage crates in corner next to fireplace *Garage, behind shelf in laundry area *Garage, behind stacked storage crates along far wall *Garage, behind upright plywood in corner (when covered from side and front) *Boys Bedroom, behind stacked storage crates in back corner next to white wardrobe *Master Bedroom, behind black wardrobe (only when chair is next to it and facing the opposite corner) *Basement Hallway, behind trash cans at far end *Right Storage Room, behind blue tool cart Depending on the difficulty, some of these hiding spots may be blocked by the presence of bulky items or have their concealing elements removed: *Amateur: None *Intermediate: 3 *Professional: 5 *Nightmare/Insanity: 7 *3-player game: +1 available hiding spot *4-player game: +2 available hiding spots Additional hiding spots on multiplayer is overriden when "Number of hiding places" is set to None Several more unofficial furniture-based hiding spots are available. While they are more risky, they will never be blocked unlike official hiding spots, and can still provide decent hiding in most cases. Examples include: *Master Bedroom, behind the desk *Living Room, right against the bookshelf. While a decent replacement for the official hiding spot by the fireplace, it remains a risky option if the ghost wanders into the living room. Looping the ghost may be performed around the pickup in the garage, the kitchen island or around the two shelves in the Right Storage Room. The living room couch can also be used loop partially to move towards the kitchen if needed. ==Bone locations== Bones spawn randomly, but will only spawn in areas that a ghost can also walk on. ;Examples
Bone willow hallway.png|A long bone in the Hallway. Bone willow basementhallway.png|A spine bone in the Basement Hallway.
==Cursed possession locations== File:Willow-Ouija.png|The Ouija Board spawns on top of the washing machine/dryer in the Garage. File:Willow-Cards.png|The Tarot Cards spawn on the end table next to the couch in the Living Room. File:Willow-Voodoo.png|The Voodoo Doll spawns in the cabinet in the Boys Bedroom. File:Willow-MusicBox.png|The Music Box spawns on the table beside the entrance in the Living Room. File:Willow-Circle.png|The Summoning Circle spawns in the Basement Hallway. File:Willow-Mirror.png|The Haunted Mirror spawns in the corner of the utility section of the Garage. Monkeypaw willow.jpg|The Monkey Paw spawns in a cabinet in the Hallway. ==Trivia== *In the kitchen, a set of food bowls, a scratch post as well as a bag of catnip with the name "Kong" written on it can be found. These props are dedicated to cjdxn's cat, which passed away before the release of 0.7.0. A photo of the cat can be found on the table next to the front door. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.29.0/0.29.6 |Added Willow Street House. |- !0.7.0 |Renamed Willow Street House to 13 Willow Street. |}

content: The Thaye is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. It is known to exhibit paradoxical activity spans when nearby players, ranging from that of an Oni to that of a Shade the longer at least one player stays in its vicinity. ==Behaviour== ===Ability=== The Thaye has an internal "age" parameter that affects its general activity. The Thaye will attempt to age 1 minute after an exit door is opened for the first time; if at least one player is in the same room as the ghost or within 3 meters of it, the Thaye will add 1 to its age and re-attempt to age after 1-2 minutes, else it will re-attempt to age after 30 seconds. If the Thaye successfully uses this ability during a hunt, the age increase will only be effective after the hunt. The following shows the parameters that are affected by age: {| class="article-table" ! Behaviour ! Age 0 (Initial) ! Per age added ! Age 10 and higher |- ! Hunt sanity threshold | 75% | -6% | 15% |- ! Hunt speed | 2.75 m/s | -0.175 m/s | 1 m/s |- ! Relative interaction/ghost event rate | 200% | -15% | 50% |- | colspan="4" | {| class="article-table mw-collapsible-content mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" style="text-align:center;" width="100%" |+Detailed behaviour per age !Age !Hunt sanity threshold !Relative activity rate !Hunt speed |- |0 |75% |200% |2.75 m/s |- |1 |69% |185% |2.575 m/s |- |2 |63% |170% |2.4 m/s |- |3 |57% |155% |2.225 m/s |- |4 |51% |140% |2.05 m/s |- |5 |45% |125% |1.875 m/s |- |6 |39% |110% |1.7 m/s |- |7 |33% |95% |1.525 m/s |- |8 |27% |80% |1.35 m/s |- |9 |21% |65% |1.175 m/s |- |10+ |15% |50% |1 m/s |} |} For every age added, the Thaye's "human age" as provided by the Ouija Board increases by 1 - 4. Unlike ghost activity, there is no (reasonably attainable) limit on the Thaye's "human age". The Thaye's starting "human age" can still be anywhere from 10 - 90, like all other ghosts. Once the Thaye has used its ability 9 times, it will no longer be able to perform ghost events unless forced through the use of cursed possessions. ===Hunt=== Unlike most other ghosts, the Thaye does not speed up with line-of-sight of a player. == Strengths and weaknesses == These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Strength: Upon entering the location, Thaye will become active, defensive and agile Weakness: Thaye will weaken over time, making them weaker, slower and less aggressive ==Evidence== ==Strategies== With a Thaye, both interactions and events will be more frequent from the start of the investigation, which may make it easier to locate the ghost. On the other hand, if players do not locate the ghost quickly, especially on large maps, the Thaye may prove to be one of the most dangerous ghosts in the game, as its initial hunt sanity threshold is higher than that of a Demon's, and it is much faster when chasing players during these early hunts. Due to the extreme danger it can pose towards the beginning of a contract, identifying hiding spot locations as soon as possible is very prudent. Once the ghost has been located, setting up ghost writing books and D.O.T.S Projectors to try and get their evidences early may help, especially on Nightmare where one evidence is hidden; if the ghost gives both Ghost Writing and D.O.T.S Projector, then it will either be a Thaye or an Obambo, as the Deogen, the only other ghost to share those two evidence types with the aforementioned, has guaranteed Spirit Box as one of its pieces of evidence. One must be careful not to confuse the Obambo's two distinct hunt speeds and polarising sanity thresholds (based on its state) with the Thaye's slowing and progressively-lowering hunt sanity threshold as it ages. One could identify a Thaye through its hunting behaviour; if it is fast early in the contract, slows down over several hunts as players continue spending time near it, and does not gain speed with continuous line-of-sight (LOS), then a Thaye is likely. Unlike a Thaye, the Obambo does gain speed with continuous LOS, making this a clear way to differentiate the two. Likewise, if the ghost hunts early and has high levels of activity, but becomes less willing to hunt, interact, or perform ghost events over time, this could also point to a Thaye. Because ghost events and interactions are more common early on, one should use this opportunity to complete any non-hunt related objectives or fill the journal with photos. Taking the hunt sanity threshold into consideration, if one is careful with how they interact with the ghost, a (near-)perfect contract can be achieved easily. However, if players spend excessive time in the ghost room and cause the Thaye to age quickly, and are not careful with their cursed possession usage to compensate for the loss in activity, completing objectives and obtaining photo evidence could become an annoying (or boring) task. Hunt-related objectives on the other hand are best left for when the ghost has aged enough that it is no longer a major threat; after aging 4 times, a Thaye will be slower than the player's average speed if continuously sprinting off-cooldown, and after aging 3 more times (for 7 times in total), it will be slower than the player's walking speed, allowing it to be easily looped. Staying in the ghost room for a period of time to age them to safe levels, then using a cursed possession to force a hunt is a safe way of completing many objectives such as escaping the ghost during a hunt. ==Trivia== *Thaye (IPA: /θəjɛ́/, pronounced "thuh-yeh") are also known as sarai and tasei in Burmese (written သရဲ) are disembodied spirits in Myanmar folklore that have many forms at once, depending on the beholder. They come in the deep of the night and cause minor nuisances. *When The Mimic mimics a Thaye, it will choose a random age. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.6.2.0 |Added Thaye. |- !0.6.2.1 |Adjusted the Thaye's weakness. |- !0.9.0 |The Thaye no longer has an increased chance to interact with the D.O.T.S. Projector or the Ghost Writing Book. |} ==References== ==Notes== Category:Ghosts fr:Thayé ru:Тайэ
title: Thaye

content: The Spirit is a type of ghost in Phasmophobia. They are unique among other ghost types for not having any distinctive strengths. ==Behaviour== ===Activity=== When Incense is used near a Spirit, it will not be able to initiate a hunt for 180 seconds instead of 90 seconds with most other ghosts. Like other ghosts, this will not prevent cursed hunts. This delay will also apply if the Spirit was smudged during a hunt. Spirits have no other special behaviour. ==Evidence== ==Strengths and weaknesses== These are the strengths and weaknesses as listed in the journal: Weakness: A Spirit can be temporarily stopped by burning Incense near them. ==Strategies== With no special powers, and a harsher reaction to Incense, Spirits serve as a baseline to measure other ghosts against. With their behavior not being especially unique amongst the ghosts, its overall lack of defining traits can confuse investigators; therefore, unless clear evidence is established, a Spirit can be easily mistaken for another entity. The main (and usually only) way to test for a Spirit without using evidence is to lower the average sanity to below 50%, and smudge the ghost while it is hunting; if it hunts again before the three minutes is up, it is not a Spirit. If it hunts only after three minutes, it is very likely (though not conclusively) a Spirit. Note that if it hunts within the first minute of the smudge stick being used, then the smudge stick did not work, and the player should attempt to smudge it again. In Nightmare/Insanity difficulty, players should wait for a hunt or a burnt crucifix to confirm that the average sanity is low enough. A more reliable way to test for Spirit is using incense near the ghost, start a timer and wait for around 160-170 seconds and then use incense near the ghost again. Using motion sensors can be helpful to determine the position of the ghost. Due to the incense's cleansing effect not being re-applied if a current one is ongoing, two scenarios can happen: *If the ghost hunts within the next 60 seconds of the second incense, the ghost is a Spirit. *If the ghost hunts after 60 seconds but before 90, it is still likely to be a Spirit, but it may also be a Demon instead, though this is not likely to be an issue, as a Demon will most likely initiate a hunt before the second incense is even used, ruling out the Spirit. ==Trivia== *Although the journal says that the Spirit is the most common ghost, all ghost types actually have the same chance of getting selected by the game. **Perhaps this description was thought to mean that the Spirit is the "basic" ghost type other types were based upon in the process of development. *The Spirit is the first ghost in the list and is automatically selected at the start of each contract by default. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !13 March 2020 |Spirit now requires Fingerprints instead of Bug as one of its evidences. |- !10 September 2020 |Spirits can now be prevented from hunting for 3 minutes when a Smudge Stick is used. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.3.0 |Prior to 0.3.0, the evidence was Spirit Box, Fingerprints, and Ghost Writing. |} Category:Ghosts fr:Esprit ru:Дух
title: Spirit

content: Toys are props which the ghost can interact with. ==Mechanics== .]] ;Teddy bears When a ghost interacts with a teddy bear, one of four things will happen: it will throw the bear, make it giggle, twist its head by 180 degrees, or teleport it to another location. .]] ;Bunnies Contrary to teddy bears, ghosts can only throw or teleport bunnies when interacting with them. .]] ;Dolls On Grafton Farmhouse, dolls can be found in Child Bedroom. When a ghost interacts with them, it can either make them talk, change their pose, or teleport them elsewhere, usually near the player. .]] ;Parrot & Sharks On Point Hope, a parrot and two sharks can be found in Child Bedroom. When a ghost interacts with them, it can either throw them or play a short sound. Players can also play the short sound by using the button while holding these toys. ===Rewards=== Recording a teddy bear giggling will yield a Possessed Toy sound in the journal, rewarding up to $7 and 7 XP, depending on the tier of the Sound Recorder and whether there is a Unique stamp. ==Locations== {| class="fandom-table" !Map !Teddy bears !Bunnies !Dolls !Parrot & Sharks |- |6 Tanglewood Drive |Nursery |Nursery | | |- |10 Ridgeview Court |Girls Bedroom |Master Bedroom | | |- |13 Willow Street |Boys Bedroom |Master Bedroom | | |- |42 Edgefield Road |Orange Bedroom |Orange Bedroom | | |- |Point Hope | | | |Child Bedroom |- |Bleasdale Farmhouse |Master Bedroom | | | |- |Grafton Farmhouse | | |Child Bedroom | |- |Camp Woodwind |Yellow Tent |Kids Area | | |- |Maple Lodge Campsite |Yellow Tent | | | |- |Sunny Meadows/Restricted |Female Room 2 | | | |} ==See also== * Map Category:Item Category:Map Features fr:Jouet

The thermometer is a piece of starter equipment used to read the temperatures in the nearby environment, and is the primary tool for detecting Freezing Temperatures. ==Usage== ===Tier I=== The Tier I Thermometer passively reads out the temperature of the last room in which the player held it, with the red liquid (alcohol) within slowly rising or falling depending on if the room is colder or warmer than where it was before. While very slow to update, with a rate of 0.33°C per second, it benefits over its upgraded versions by being both completely passive, and is not an electronic item that could attract the ghost while held during a hunt. The thermometer reads out both Celsius (°C) and Fahrenheit (°F), with Celsius values on the left side and Fahrenheit on the right. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +3 degrees, in Celsius. ===Tier II=== The thermometer can be to turn on the display. Holding down the button will make the thermometer read the player's current room's temperature in degrees Celsius (°C) every 2.5 seconds. This can be changed to Fahrenheit (°F) in the settings. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +3 degrees, in Celsius. ===Tier III=== Similar to the Tier II thermometer, it can be to turn on the display, and can be used to give a reading by holding down the use button. Compared to the Tier II thermometer, it is much faster to give a read-out, only taking 1.5 second between each reading. By default, the reading will be in degrees Celsius (°C); this can be changed to Fahrenheit (°F) in the settings. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +2 degrees, in Celsius. ==Tips== *Temperatures readings below the weather's ambient temperature (e.g. below 5°C in snowy weather) is generally an indication that the ghost is in (or was recently in) the room. *The tier II and III thermometers will continuously give out new readings when players hold after the initial reading while the tier I thermometer will refresh constantly, although at a much slower speed. *When using thermometers thrown on the floor, turning it off and on again or moving between rooms before attempting to read the temperature may help to reduce the risk of errors. ==Trivia== *The tier III thermometer is actually a Therma-Hygrometer which can also measure the air humidity; the design of the tier III thermometer is based off the THS-224-612 Therma-Hygrometer. *The tier III thermometer displays "EMS 0.95" on its screen, but EMS (Emissivity) is a measure for thermal radiation, and is used for infrared thermometers like the tier II thermometer. Since the tier III thermometer uses airflow to measure, the device is inaccurate. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" | Early Access Alpha |- !10 February 2020 | Added Thermometer as an equipment. |- !19 June 2020 |The Thermometer is now level-locked. |- !27 June 2020 |The Thermometer now requires level 4 to be purchasable. |- !24 August 2020
(Part 4) |The Thermometer now costs $30 instead of $25. |- !11 September 2020 |The Thermometer now updates its reading at a slower rate. |- ! colspan="2" | Early Access |- !24 September 2020 |The Thermometer is no longer level-locked. |- !0.3.0 |Changed the Thermometer model. |- ! rowspan="5" |0.9.0 |The Thermometer now has 3 tiers. |- |Thermometers are now counted as a starter item alongside the other evidence items. |- |Cold breath is no longer a reliable source of evidence. |- |You must now use a Thermometer to find freezing temperatures at 0 Celsius (32 Fahrenheit) or below. |- |To receive a room temperature reading you must now hold the “Use” button for a short period (Tiers II and III only). |- ! rowspan="4" |0.10.0 |Holding down the USE button while holding a Thermometer II or III will now continuously update, instead of having to restart after each reading. |- |Tier I now has randomization to make it consistent with the other Tiers. |- |Tier II Hold time has been reduced to 2.5s from 3s. |- |Tier III randomization has been reduced to make it more accurate. |} Category:Equipment fr:Thermomètre ru:Термометр Category:Starter Equipment
title: Thermometer

The UV light is a buyable starter item used to detect Ultraviolet evidence such as fingerprints and footprints. ==Usage== The UV light can be enabled using the key while holding it. The UV light can be activated at the same time as a standard flashlight, but any visible fingerprints or footprints may contrast poorly and be hard to see under their light. The UV light projects purple light and this light is weak relative to flashlights. The Tier I and III UV Lights will not work if Flashlights are turned off in custom difficulty settings. Ghosts that give ultraviolet evidence can leave prints on certain surfaces doors, light switches, and windows. They may also leave prints on floors after stepping through salt. These prints become visible and green when a UV light is shone towards them. The Tier I UV Light is a flashlight with a narrow spotlight. It counts as an electronic equipment. So it will flicker rapidly near a manifesting ghost and will attract the ghost during a hunt when it is nearby. Tier II UV Light is a small glowstick. When activated, it glows brightly for 1 minute, then fades to half intensity over the next 10 seconds. After dimming, the glowstick can be shaken with to revitalize the light it produces. The tier III UV Light is also a flashlight. However, it has a much wider spotlight and a lesser charge time than tier I. It also counts as an electronic equipment. ==Tips== *As of patch 0.9.0, UV prints must be illuminated by a UV light to take a successful photo. *Many regard the Tier II UV Light as superior to the Tier I and III versions, due to the fact that the player can simply throw the glowstick on the floor and it will continuously illuminate any prints nearby, and it is also not an electronic, allowing the player to use it as a light source during hunts without the ghost detecting it. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !28 August 2020
(Part 3) |Added glowsticks. |- ! colspan="2" | Early Access |- ! rowspan="3" |0.3.0 |Changed the glowstick model. |- |The glowstick now fades after a short while. |- |Changed the UV flashlight model. |- !0.3.0.1 |The glowstick now fades to half intensity over 10 seconds after 1 minute. |- ! rowspan="3" |0.9.0 |UV light now has 3 tiers. |- |The glowstick has been repurposed as the Tier 1 UV light. |- |After it dims, the glowstick can now be shaken to revitalize the light it produces. |- !0.10.0 |Swapped tier I and tier II UV Light. |} Category:Equipment Category:Starter Equipment fr:Lampe UV ru:Ультрафиолетовый свет

content: The shop is used to buy and sell items, add them to the contract, and create loadouts. == Usage == The shop can be accessed from the main menu by navigating using the keyboard arrow keys, or clicking the right arrow from the main menu. The shop can also be directly clicked on. Pressing Esc or Space, or clicking the left arrow will exit the shop. The shop is divided in three pages that can be accessed on the left of the screen. These pages are "Shop", "Equipment Manager", and "Quick-Loadouts". The player's current level and money are listed at the top right-hand corner of the screen. === Shop === The Shop page allows players to buy equipment. Each piece of equipment has a tile that displays the quantity of it the player currently owns and its price. Clicking on the different tier buttons will show the piece of equipment's description, properties, and the buttons to buy, sell, or upgrade said piece of equipment. === Equipment Manager === The Equipment Manager page allows players to add and remove equipment from the contract. To add a piece of equipment to the contract, the player needs to click on its + button. Clicking on its - button will remove it from the contract. Starter equipment is colored in white while each player's equipment is represented as a different color that can be customized in the options. Changing the piece of equipment's tier can be done by clicking on one of the tier buttons. Each player can only bring one tier of equipment. If the host changes their tier of a main equipment, the starter equipment will also be changed to that tier. === Quick-Loadouts === The Quick-Loadouts page allows players to create loadouts that can be added to the contract. By default, players can set 2 loadouts. Additional loadout slots can be unlocked by prestiging, up to 8 additional slots. In each loadout, players can click the + and - buttons in the "Amount" column next to each piece of equipment to add or remove it from the loadout. The tier buttons in the "Tier" column will set the piece of equipment's tier in the loadout. The "All" row can increase or decrease the tier of all equipment at once, and add or remove one of each piece of equipment from the loadout. In the "All" loadout, only the tier of each piece of equipment can be changed. The loadout is automatically saved every time a change is made to it. Each loadout also can be renamed, except for the "All" loadout. Once the player is satisfied with the loadout, they can choose to enable it, which will automatically buy the missing pieces of equipment in the loadout and add it to the contract each time they load into a lobby. Once enabled, the loadout will have a checkmark icon next to it. A warning icon will appear instead and prevents the player from using it if they haven't unlocked a specific piece of equipment in the loadout, or if they don't have enough money to cover the loadout's costs. The "Truck" column will display all the equipment currently added to the contract. == See also == * Main menu board == History == {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.7.0 |Moved the equipment store to its own separate computer. |- !0.7.0.3 |Loadouts now automatically save. |- ! rowspan=6 |0.8.1.0 |Reformatted Shop/Storage to act similar to an online shopping cart |- |Added the truck icon to show the number of items added to the lobby |- |Added the trash button to the Shop/Storage tab |- |Added the Auto Add button to the Loadouts tab |- |Added All items loadout |- |Improved several icons |- ! rowspan=3 |0.9.0 |Clicking on any Equipment panel in the SHOP or LOADOUT pages will now open a new window displaying new information and buttons for Upgrading |- |Added a small Tier button to the top left of each equipment item in the Shop, which you can click to quickly cycle through unlocked Upgrades |- |Added the Auto Buy button to the Loadouts tab |- !0.9.5.0 |Complete overhaul: *3 separate pages for more intuitive usage *Easy buy options for controller *Renamable loadouts *Player-specific colours for supplied equipment *Quick shortcuts to navigate between screens to unlock equipment *Full tutorial for each page *Shortcuts for gamepad users |} Category:Lobby fr:Magasin
title: Shop

content: The Sound Monitor is a screen in the Truck labelled "Sound Sensors". The screen will list up to 4 separate sound sensors in a horizontal bar graph format. When placing sound sensors inside a playable area, it will label the sensor on the sound monitor according to in which area it was placed. Sound sensors pick up the sound level in an area around it, indicated by the associated orange graphic of their radius on the Site Map. Sounds picked up on the sensors will show as a yellow bar indicated in percentage, depending on the volume of the noise detected, and it will play a live audio feed into the Truck, potentially allowing for Evidence such as EMF Level 5 and Ghost Writing without having to be inside the building. 0.1 dB picked up on a Parabolic Microphone is equivalent to 1% on the Sound Monitor. Using sound sensors and keeping an eye on the sound monitor can be useful in finding the ghost's location early. Category:Truck Equipment fr:Moniteur des Capteurs sonores ru:Монитор звуковых датчиков
title: Sound Monitor

Voice chat is the primary mode of communication in Phasmophobia. ==Player chat== Voice chat is used to communicate between players. Phasmophobia uses the Vivox voice chat system. Dead players can hear living players, but not the other way round. Due to a bug, dead players can sometimes not hear each other clearly. ===Local chat=== Local chat is proximity-based. Players can hear one another up to 20 metres away, though in reality this distance is usually shorter due to volume fall-off. There are three settings available for players to communicate through: *Push-to-talk: The game will hear the player while they hold the button. *Voice Activation: The game will always hear the player; this is also known as open mic. *Toggle: The local chat button is used to toggle open mic on or off. A microphone icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen will light up when the game is listening. A throat-clearing sound can also be heard when toggling; a rising tone when toggling on and a falling tone when toggling off. This setting can be adjusted via the settings in the journal or in the main menu. Players in different locations may hear local chat as being muffled: *Players on different floors *Players that are inside versus outside a building During a hunt, any noise transmitted through the microphone that is loud enough (when local chat is enabled) will attract the ghost if it is within 9 metres (or 2.5 metres for a Yokai) of the player on the same floor. This does not affect voice recognition. ===Global chat=== Global chat allows the player to communicate to all players on-site, regardless of their location. Global chat can be activated by holding the button, or by grabbing the walkie-talkie when using VR headsets. Voice through global chat will be muffled in a manner similar to a walkie-talkie. The VR walkie-talkie will automatically return onto the belt when dropped. Global chat can only be activated via push-to-talk. Global chat cannot be used by dead players or in the lobby. Dead players can hear living players through global chat. Using global chat within 9 metres of a ghost (2.5 metres for a Yokai) during a hunt will attract the ghost to the player, regardless of whether the player is speaking or not. Doing this will also cause a static noise to be played for all players in lieu of any microphone audio. One player using global chat will not attract the ghost to other players, regardless of if the speaker is inside or outside the investigation area. ==Voice recognition== Voice recognition is used for recognition of phrases said by the player to elicit reactions from the ghost. Players can change the voice recognition system that is used ("Voice" or "System Voice"), as well as the voice recognition language. While "Voice" supports all existing languages that are available on the game, "System Voice" only supports English, French, German, Japanese, Chinese, and Spanish. Both local and global chat work normally. When voice recognition is set up correctly, the player can use either local or global voice chat to communicate with the ghost using the Spirit Box, the Ouija Board, or the Monkey Paw. Additionally, saying the ghost's name or recognised phrases after having spent 2 seconds near the ghost also has a chance of increasing ghost activity, which includes interactions, roaming, and abilities. It will also increase the Spirit Box's response chances. This has a minimum cooldown of 10 seconds. When using Push-to-talk or Toggle modes, valid phrases will still be recognized even if the mic is activated slightly after (~0.5 seconds) saying that phrase. The following is a list of recognized phrases:
*"Give us a sign." *"Do something." *"Let us know you are here." *"Make a noise." *"Make a sound." *"Can you make a sound?" *"Open a door." *"Open the door." *"Open this door." *"Turn on the light." *"Turn off the light." *"Show us your presence." *"Show your presence." *"Show me." *"Show us." *"Knock something." *"Throw something." *"Can you speak?" *"Can you speak to us?" *"Can we speak?" *"Would like to speak to you." *"Can I ask you?" *"May I ask you?" *"Would you like to talk?" *"Talk to me." *"Talk to us." *"Scream." *"Do you know who we are?" *"We mean you no harm." *"We are friends." *"Is there anyone with me?" *"Is there anyone here?" *"Are there any ghosts?" *"Are you male or female?" *"Are there children here?" *"Are you alone?" *"Are you the only one here?" *"Are you here all the time?" *"Are you waiting?" *"Are you happy?" *"Is there anything that I can do?" *"Is this your home?" *"Do you want us to leave?" *"I'm scared." *"I am scared." *"Scared" *"Scare" *"Scary" *"Spooky" *"Horror" *"Fright" *"Frighten" *"Panic" *"Hide" *"Run"

Note that some of these phrases were tied to older mechanics, so they don't all make sense with the game's current context. Additionally, not all of these may be functional. If the player is unable to use voice recognition, they may use the text option for the Ouija Board, the Spirit Box, and the Monkey Paw. ==Tips== *Players who are unable to use voice recognition may consult the official Phasmophobia Discord server's voice recognition help channel on potential ways to fix voice recognition. *Some languages on the "Voice" system may not work correctly; use the "System Voice" recognition system or "Text" system as an alternative. *If you are using the "System Voice" recognition system, there is a bug where voice recognition (not voice chat) may "fall asleep" when the player loses focus of the game, causing it to fail. Pressing the Windows key twice, or pressing once and clicking on the game icon in the taskbar, will "wake" it up. ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="2" |0.4.0 |Static from global chat now plays during hunts only if the ghost is near the player. |- |Ghosts can now detect players using global chat without speaking during hunts. |- !0.5.1.2 |Open mic is no longer forced on singleplayer. |- !0.6.0 |Local voice chat now has three options: voice activation, push-to-talk, and on/off toggle. |- !0.6.2.0 |Switched the voice recognition system from a Windows-based system to an internal system. |- !0.6.3.0 |Added the option to switch back to the Windows-based voice recognition system. |- !0.10.1.0 |The multiplayer voice chat system has been changed from Photon Voice to Vivox. |- !0.11.1.2 |Voice recognition modes have been reworded for better in game translation. *VOSK has been changed to Voice *Windows Voice has been changed to System Voice |} ==References== Category:Gameplay Category:Settings fr:Chat vocal

content: Weather is a mechanic intended to enhance gameplay and affect temperatures within the map. ==Mechanics== There are currently eight types of weather. Seven among which one will be randomly chosen per game with equal chance, and an additional eighth type that has a 2% chance to replace the chosen weather. Depending on what weather type is present, players may experience auditory and visual obstructions. Weather is grouped into four groups of temperatures. From warmest to coldest: * Sunrise * Clear, Fog, Blood Moon * Light Rain, Heavy Rain, Windy * Snow This can affect how the player finds the ghost; warmer weather means that the average room temperature where the ghost is will be slightly higher than in colder weather. The effects of weather are suppressed while indoors: noise disruption (save for the occasional roar of thunder) is quieted, and the visual effects of fog and precipitation do not make their way inside. However, weather can play a major part in Camp Woodwind and Maple Lodge Campsite, precisely as these maps are mainly played outside. ==Sunrise== overlooking the lake on Sunrise Weather.]] The sun is rising on the horizon (it does not actually move), casting golden rays onto the map, which may improve illumination in certain areas. The deep blue sky is untainted by clouds. Illumination: High Vision: High Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Clear== with Clear Weather.]] The "standard" weather type, and adds no additional features to gameplay. Surroundings are quite dim, and the sky is almost pitch black. Illumination: Poor Vision: High Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Fog== with Fog Weather.]] The map is covered in a thick mist, obscuring visibility. The fog dissipates inside buildings, but outdoor fog can be a hindrance to seeing with night vision outdoors through a video feed. Illumination: Modest Vision: Poor Noise disruption: Low Temperature: ==Blood Moon== with Blood Moon Weather.]] This weather provides a red sky and a light rain. The ghost becomes 15% faster during hunts, the passive sanity drain rate is increased by 100%, and the contract payout is increased by 10%. Illumination: Modest Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Light Rain== with Light Rain Weather.]] This weather type adds a modest rainfall, which generates some extra noise. Flames are not affected by the rain. Illumination: Modest Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Heavy Rain== with Heavy Rain Weather.]] The rainfall and thunder causes loud noise, and the map is shrouded by darkness. Non-tier III Igniters and Firelights cannot be lit in the rain. When an igniter or firelight affected by the rain is lit inside and brought outside, it will be extinguished immediately. Players cannot light the Campfire in Maple Lodge Campsite or Camp Woodwind with this weather. The objective 'Get the Ghost to blow out a Candle' can be difficult on these maps if the favourite room is outside and tier III firelights are not available. Illumination: Poor Vision: Modest Noise disruption: High Temperature: ==Windy== with Windy Weather.]] This weather type makes surrounding trees emit loud noise. The wind makes leaves rustle, making it a fairly loud weather type. Clouds overhead drift by quickly, but other than these, this weather type would appear similar to Clear. Illumination: Poor Vision: High Noise disruption: Medium Temperature: ==Snow== with Snow Weather.|alt=|thumb]] Frequent snowflakes will fall from the sky, though snow will not accumulate on the ground. A light mist lingers around the map. The low ambient temperature will cause for freezing breath to appear all throughout the map, potentially masking one of the main tells of the Ghost Room. Illumination: Modest Vision: Modest Noise Disruption: Low Temperature: == Related difficulty settings == * Weather: Set the weather in the location ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access Alpha |- !2 February 2020 |Jinns can no longer manipulate the weather. |- !? |Weather is now limited to rain on Tanglewood Street House. |- ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- ! rowspan="2" |0.4.0 |Added 6 types of weather. |- |Tanglewood Street House is no longer always raining. |- !0.4.1.0 |Updated the visuals for Heavy Rain. |- !0.5.1.0 |Temporarily removed Fog weather. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.8.0 |Readded Fog weather. |- |Added Sunrise weather. |- !0.11.0 |Added Blood Moon weather. |} Category:Gameplay fr:Météo ru:Погода

content: This page lists special events that have occured within Phasmophobia. Some events will give out trophies, which will be displayed in the lobby. <!-- ==Halloween 2021== ==Christmas 2021== --> ==2022== ===Easter 2022=== During this event, each map had a fixed number of easter eggs spawn in fixed locations. Players could pick them up to collect them. Once all the eggs in the map had been collected, the sanity of all players would be restored to 100%. ===Halloween 2022=== An interactive event was introduced for Halloween 2022. In this event, some maps would have a fixed number of carved pumpkins containing candies, similar to Easter 2022. These maps were indicated by a jack o' lantern symbol in the contract selection board. To complete each map, the player had to be on Nightmare difficulty (not a custom Nightmare preset) and do the following in order: *Collect all the candies. *After all the candies are collected, new carved pumpkins would spawn, requiring players to light them up with a lighter. *Once both of these are done, the ghost will now show up with a pumpkin head for the remainder of the contract. The player(s) must then take a photo of the ghost. The photo does not have to be labelled nor be the first ghost photo as long as the ghost is technically in the photo. Each time a step was completed, a laughing sound would play. The player did not have to survive as long as all the steps were completed. If the map's weather was Heavy Rain, the player had to start a new contract, as some pumpkins were located outside and thus could not be lit. Completed maps would have a check mark on top of the pumpkin label. Once the activity had been done across all the maps containing the pumpkins, the player was rewarded with a pumpkin trophy. This event lasted from 0.7.1.0 until 0.7.1.5. Aside from this event, the lobby and the truck also had various decorations. ===Holiday 2022=== During this event, the lobby was decorated with various Christmas decorations. A temporary challenge was also added. Similar to the Trick or Treat event, participating maps would feature a Holiday Sticker on the map selection board on Intermediate difficulty. The player was then required to visit all 7 maps and do the following on each map: #Collect 6 cookies to add them to a plate #Place the completed plate near the ghost #Wait for the ghost to eat the cookies; this will cause the player's vision to darken, and a hunt starts after their vision clears if they are in the investigation area. The ghost will now appear for the remainder of the contract with a Christmas garb as the one seen from Christmas 2021, and the weather will turn to snow. #Correctly identify the ghost and leave alive After completing all the maps, the player would receive a Holiday '22 Badge (for the ID Card) and Trophy. The maps could be done in either singleplayer or multiplayer. This event was introduced with the Tempest update (0.8.0) and ended on 9 January 2023 (0.8.0.7). ==2023== ===April Fools 2023=== On 1 April 2023, a same-version hotfix (0.8.1.3) was released to add some new features: *Player and ghost model heads are now comically big *Most ghost vocalisations are now sped up and have a higher pitch *Other players now appear to T-pose by default **Consequently, all their photos are taken upside down *Ghosts will occasionally appear in T-pose (such as during certain ghost events or when producing a D.O.T.S Projector silhouette) This lasted the whole 24 hours of the day (UK timezone), and was reverted afterwards. ===Easter 2023=== An event was introduced for Easter 2023. Similar to the Trick or Treat and the Holiday 2022 events, participating maps would feature an Easter Sticker on the map selection board. The player was required to visit all 7 small maps and do the following on each map: *Collect all the hidden Easter eggs. Once all eggs were collected, a laughing sound would play, indicating that the objective has been completed. Compared to other holiday challenges, this could be done on either singleplayer or multiplayer, on any difficulty (including custom difficulties of any multiplier, even 0x), and there was no need to find the ghost type or acquire a ghost photo. The player only needed to be alive the moment the last egg was picked up, and could be dead at any other time. After completing this objective on all maps, the player would receive an Easter '23 Badge (for the ID Card) and Trophy. This event lasted from 0.8.1.4 until 0.8.1.6. ===Halloween 2023=== An event was introduced for Halloween 2023. Similar to previous events, participating maps would feature a Pumpkin Sticker on the map selection board. The player could visit all 9 maps and do the following on each map: *Find the recipe ingredient note found in a pumpkin's mouth. Once the player knew the full recipe, they could proceed to add the ingredients to the cauldron found in Maple Lodge Campsite in order to complete the event. If all the proper ingredients were added, the sky would turn red and a special visual effect would play with ghosts shooting out of the cauldron to form a red skull in the sky. This could be done on either singleplayer or multiplayer, on any difficulty (including custom difficulties of any multiplier, even 0x), and there was no need to find the ghost type. After completing this event, the player would receive a Halloween '23 Badge (for the ID Card) and Trophy. This event was introduced in 0.9.1.0 and lasted until 0.9.2.0. ===Holiday 2023=== An event was introduced for Holiday 2023. During this event, 7 small maps would feature a Snowman Sticker while Sunny Meadows had a Snowball Gun Sticker on the map selection board. To complete the event, the player needed to do the following: *Find 3 mysterious parts on Sunny Meadows Once all parts were collected, a laughing sound would play, indicating that the objective has been completed, which would add a newly built device in the truck. *Using a snowball gun, destroy all the dancing snowmen on the 7 maps featuring a Snowman Sticker Each time all the snowmen in a map were destroyed, the weather changed to Snow, and the ghost changed its model and initiated a hunt. After destroying the snowmen on all maps, the player would receive a Holiday '23 Badge (for the ID Card) and Trophy. This event could be done on either singleplayer or multiplayer, on any difficulty (including custom difficulties of any multiplier, even 0x), and there was no need to find the ghost type. This event was introduced in 0.9.3.0 and lasted until 0.9.4.0. ==2024== ===Easter 2024=== An event was introduced for Easter 2024. During this event, 5 maps would feature a Nest Sticker while Camp Woodwind had a Forest Spirit Sticker on the map selection board. To complete the event, the player needed to do the following: *Capture a photo of the Forest Spirit's minion on the 5 maps featuring a Nest Sticker **The Forest Spirit's minion can be found using the UV Light and the D.O.T.S. Projector *After taking a photo of all 5 minions, capture a photo of the ghost on Camp Woodwind and successfully identify it After completing these objectives, the player would receive an Easter '24 Badge (for the ID Card) and Trophy. The tree in the lobby would also display a glowing visual effect while the event was ongoing. This event could be done on either singleplayer or multiplayer, on any difficulty (including custom difficulties of any multiplier, even 0x), and there was no need to find the ghost type when doing the minions' part. This event was introduced in 0.9.6.0 and lasted until 0.9.6.1. ===Halloween 2024=== The Crimson Eye event was introduced for Halloween 2024. In this event, the players were tasked to work together to achieve three community goals in order to get new ID cards, a trophy, and to permanently unlock the Blood Moon weather type. The three community goals were: *Identify ghosts correctly (10 Blood Moon points per ghost) *Complete optional objectives (2 Blood Moon points per objective) *Photograph any Totems you find (1 Blood Moon point per totem) When completing these goals on one of the four maps featuring the Blood Moon weather type (13 Willow Street, 42 Edgefield Road, Grafton Farmhouse, and Point Hope), players would add progression to a stage. Initially, the required Blood Moon points to complete each stage were 1 billion (stage 1), 1.5 billions (stage 2), and 2 billions (stage 3), but it was lowered twice: to 30 millions (stage 1), 40 millions (stage 2), and 50 millions (stage 3) on 30 October, and the requirement for the third stage was further reduced to 40 millions on 11 November. Once a stage was complete, players would start making progress in the next stage, and they needed to interact with the Blood Altar in the lobby to get a reward. The rewards for each stage were: *Stage 1: Summoner ID card *Stage 2: Upgraded Summoner ID card *Stage 3: Blood Moon Trophy and Blood Moon weather post event This event was introduced in 0.11.0 and lasted until 17 November 2024. It was originally planned to last until 13 November, but it was prolonged twice, on 11 November until 15 November, and again on 15 November after the event already ended, to ensure most players would get a chance to claim the rewards of the last stage. Kinetic Games shared the total amount of Blood Moon points collected and a leaderboard with the top 10 contributors on 15 November. 118,494,255 Blood Moon points were acquired by the whole playerbase with the top contributor contributing 13,104 points. ===Holiday 2024=== The Winter's Jest event was introduced for Holiday 2024. Similar to the Blood Moon event, players were tasked to work together to achieve a set of shared goals in order to receive rewards. However, for this event, there were some improvements, such as the introduction of personal daily and weekly tasks for the event, and improved scoring and rewards. The shared goals were: *Identify ghosts correctly (10 points per ghost with 1 additional point per difficulty multiplier) *Complete optional objectives (3 points per objective) *Open jack-in-the-boxes (2 points per box) When completing these goals on one of the four maps featuring festive decorations (Bleasdale Farmhouse, 6 Tanglewood Drive, Maple Lodge Campsite, and Point Hope), players would add progression to a stage. Once a stage of the overall community goal was completed, players were able to interact with the Event Altar to claim the stage's rewards. The rewards for each stage were: *Stage 1: Winter's Patron ID card *Stage 2: Upgraded Winter's Patron ID card *Stage 3: Winter's Jest Trophy This event was introduced in 0.11.1.0 and lasted until 31 December 2024. ==2025== ===Easter 2025=== The Cursed Hollow event was introduced for Easter 2025. Similar to the Blood Moon and Winter's Jest events, players could achieve a set of community goals. This event also introduced personal goals and daily map rotations. On maps featuring the event, which have Heavy Rain as default weather, players had to do the following to add progress to the community/personal goal: *Identify ghosts correctly (10 points per ghost with 1 additional point per difficulty multiplier) *Complete optional objectives (3 points per objective) *Find and reveal any forest minions (2 points per forest minion) Forest minions were revealed by shining a D.O.T.S. Projector at them, and they affected gameplay in one of several ways: *If the forest minion runs away, the player gains 5% sanity and the ghost's speed is decreased by 5%. This speed decrease does not stack and remains until the end of the contract. *If the forest minion jumps towards the player, the player loses 10% sanity and drops the item they are currently holding. *If the forest minion turns golden, a hunt is triggered (unless blocked by incense or the hunt cooldown). If this happens when the ghost is already hunting, the hunt will end immediately. Once a goal was completed, players would automatically receive the rewards upon login during the event window. The rewards for each goal were: *Community Goal 1: Hero of the Hollow ID Card *Community Goal 2: Upgradable Event Trophy *Personal Goal 1: Upgraded Hero of the Hollow ID Card *Personal Goal 2: Trophy Upgrade I *Personal Goal 3: Trophy Upgrade II *Personal Goal 4: Trophy Upgrade III A total of 3,600 event points was required to complete all 4 personal goals. The upgraded ID card is obtained after collecting 300 points, then 800 more points were required for the first trophy upgrade, 1,000 more points for the second, and 1,500 more points for the last one. This event was introduced in 0.12.1.0 and lasted until 8 May 2025. ===Halloween 2025=== The Crimson Eye event was brought back for Halloween 2025. It was similar to the Halloween 2024 event with minor adjustments. Players could add progress to the community/personal goal simply by playing contracts with Blood Moon weather: *Identify ghosts correctly (10 points per ghost with 1 additional point per difficulty multiplier) *Complete optional objectives (3 points per objective) *Interact with any Totems you find (2 points per totem) Contracts with a difficulty multiplier below 1x would reward no points. Each day, a group of 4 maps among the following guaranteed Blood Moon weather: 6 Tanglewood Drive, Camp Woodwind, Grafton Farmhouse, Bleasdale Farmhouse, Point Hope, 42 Edgefield Road, and 13 Willow Street. Once a goal was completed, players would automatically receive the rewards upon login during the event window. The rewards for each goal were: *Community Goal 1: Child of the Cult ID Card *Community Goal 2: Upgradable Crimson Eye Trophy *Personal Goal 1: Animated Child of the Cult ID Card *Personal Goal 2: Trophy Upgrade I *Personal Goal 3: Trophy Upgrade II *Personal Goal 4: Trophy Upgrade III A total of 3,600 event points was required to complete all 4 personal goals. The upgraded ID card is obtained after collecting 300 points, then 800 more points were required for the first trophy upgrade, 1,000 more points for the second, and 1,500 more points for the last one. This event was introduced in 0.14.2.0 and lasted until 1 November 2025. It was originally planned to last until 31 October. ===Holiday 2025=== The Winter's Jest event was brought back for Holiday 2025. It was similar to the Holiday 2024 event with minor adjustments. Players could add progress to the community/personal goal by doing the following on event maps: *Identify ghosts correctly and survive (10 points per ghost with 1 additional point per difficulty multiplier) *Complete optional objectives (3 points per objective) *Open jack-in-the-boxes (2 points per box) *Drop items in Krampus' bag (10 points per completed list) Contracts with a difficulty multiplier below 1x would reward no points. When Krampus' list was completed, a small gift would also be rewarded, containing items that could only be used in that contract among either equipment of various tiers, cookies that restore sanity (working like the Tier 1 Sanity Medication), or the snowball gun from the Holiday 2023 event. However, if an incorrect item was dropped in the bag, the list could no longer be completed, the small gift would reward coal, and the ghost would become 15% faster during hunts. Each day, four maps were chosen to host the event among: 6 Tanglewood Drive, 10 Ridgeview Court, 13 Willow Street, 42 Edgefield Road, Camp Woodwind, Bleasdale Farmhouse, Grafton Farmhouse, Maple Lodge Campsite, Point Hope, and Nell's Diner. Once a goal was completed, players would automatically receive the rewards upon login during the event window. The rewards for each goal were: *Community Goal 1: Toy Soldier ID Card *Community Goal 2: Upgradable Winter's Jest Trophy *Personal Goal 1: Animated Toy Soldier ID Card *Personal Goal 2: Trophy Upgrade I *Personal Goal 3: Trophy Upgrade II *Personal Goal 4: Trophy Upgrade III A total of 3,600 event points was required to complete all 4 personal goals. The upgraded ID card is obtained after collecting 300 points, then 800 more points are required for the first trophy upgrade, 1,000 more points for the second, and 1,500 more points for the last one. This event was introduced in 0.15.1.0 and lasted until 6 January 2026. ==See also== *Contests and giveaways Category:Gameplay fr:Événements spéciaux Category:Events

Tarot cards are a cursed possession that can trigger various randomly chosen effects on both the player or the ghost. ==Mechanics== As a cursed possession, tarot cards have a 1 in 7 chance per contract of being chosen as the cursed possession to spawn on a default difficulty (except Insanity), with one specific spawn location per map. Tarot cards can be with an empty hand and one card can be at a time. Tarot cards can only be drawn while inside the investigation area. Each Tarot cards deck contains 10 randomly generated cards. There are 10 possible card types the player can draw, each having a unique effect on either the player or the ghost. After being used, each card will burn up and vanish in a uniquely-colored flame. Each card type has a different, independent chance of being drawn, so some card types can be drawn multiple times or not at all in a single deck. Once all ten cards have been used, no more will be given to the player for that contract. When the deck is used up, all future hunts will also be extended by 20 seconds, even if no Death card was drawn prior. ===Cards List=== {| class="sortable fandom-table" !Card !Title !Effect !Burn Color !Draw Chance |- | |The Tower |Doubles all potential ghost activity for 20 seconds. |Blue |20% |- | |The Wheel of Fortune |If the card burns green, the player gains 25% sanity. If the card burns red, the player loses 25% sanity. |Green (sanity gain)
Red (sanity loss) |20% |- | |The Fool |Selects another random card to mimic with the same chance for each, before turning into The Fool as it burns. No effect is applied when drawing this card. |Light Purple |17%, 100% during hunts |- | |The Devil |Triggers a Ghost Event towards the nearest player to the ghost. |Pink |10% |- | |Death |Triggers a cursed hunt. |Purple |10% |- | |The Hermit |Forces the ghost to walk to its favorite room and prevents it from roaming out for 1 minute. This does not prevent hunts or ghost events from initiating while the ghost is trapped. |Cyan |10% |- | |The Sun |Sets the player's sanity to 100%. |Yellow |5% |- | |The Moon |Sets the player's sanity to 0%. |White |5% |- | |The High Priestess |Revives a random dead player where they died. If no one is currently dead, it will revive the next player who dies. This card doesn't stack if pulled more than once. |Light Yellow |2% |- | |The Hanged Man |Instantly kills the player.
It is impossible to draw the real version of this card if the 'Friendly Ghost' custom difficulty option is turned on. Only The Fool version can be drawn. |N/A |1% |} ==Tips== *The player should not draw a card during a hunt, since all cards drawn during one have a 100% chance to be The Fool, essentially wasting the card. *Though tarot cards cannot be drawn outside of the investigation area, this can be bypassed by drawing a card and walking outside of an exit door during the card-pulling animation. Cards will still take effect. **While using this method, as long as no players are inside: drawing The Devil will do nothing, and drawing Death will not trigger a hunt but will still extend the duration of later hunts. *Players should take a photo of the cards before using them, as once all of the cards are drawn, the deck will no longer be an item and no photo can be taken. *Trying to take a ghost photo after drawing The Devil can sometimes be tricky, since the card's burning animation needs to be completed before the player can drop the deck, so multiplayer coordination is a good solution to this. **This is more easily done if the ghost decides to perform a singing ghost event and doesn't spawn too close to the targeted player, as singing ghost events usually last around 10 - 15 seconds. ==Trivia== *On Steam, the Tarot Cards designs are also used for the game's Trading Cards, which can be purchased and sold on the Community Market. *Tarot Cards are the only cursed possession that is not guaranteed to cause a cursed hunt, as it is possible for the entire deck to not contain a single Death (roughly 34.9% chance); this can prove to be detrimental if the player wants to cause a hunt to aid in completing objectives and/or identifying the ghost. *Though extremely unlikely (1/10,000,000,000 decks), it is theoretically possible to draw Death 10 times in a row, making Tarot Cards the cursed possession that can cause the most cursed hunts, up to 10 cursed hunts if the player is extraordinarily (un)lucky. ==Gallery== !Cards.png|Card deck back print Warped Souls - Background.jpg|Warped Souls Background for Steam Warped Souls - Profile.png|Warped Souls Profile for Steam ==History== {| class="fandom-table" ! colspan="2" |Early Access |- !0.5.0 |Added tarot cards. |- ! rowspan="2" |0.5.2.0 |The Tower now affects D.O.T.S projectors, ghost writing books, and doors. |- |The High Priestess now revives the next player to die if no player is currently dead. |- !0.8.1.0 |The Tower now doubles all ghost activity for the next 20 seconds, instead of forcing an interaction to occur. |} ==Notes== Category:Item fr:Cartes de tarot ru:Карты Таро
title: Tarot Cards

content: The truck is the transportation and mobile base for investigators that is stocked with all the equipment required for the contract, and is also used to transport players between the lobby and the contract map. ==Mechanics== After a contract is started, players will spawn in the truck, followed by the equipment brought by the players for the contract. It also houses the computer, Objective Board, sanity monitor, the site map, sound monitor, site activity monitor and the setup timer. Once all players have loaded in, the back of the truck can be opened by with the keypad on the left side when facing the back from the inside, allowing players to walk to the investigation area. The Main Door Key to the investigation area spawns to the left of the keypad. When leaving, all living players must be on the truck for the doors and ramp to close. Dead players do not have to be on the truck for this to work. While the truck is still closing up, the keypad can be used again to reopen the doors, but only after the doors have begun to swing close. Equipment can be picked up from the wall rack, and placed back to the same slot using . Certain equipment such as motion sensors cannot be placed inside or around the truck. Video cameras and photo cameras will turn on automatically outside the truck, and turn off when inside the truck. The truck is also parked in the lobby. However, all the screens in the trailer (except the setup timer, which permanently shows 00:00) are turned off, and the Daily and Weekly Tasks clipboards are not present. ==Trivia== *The truck and the area around it are considered "safe"; the ghost cannot be in these areas, and there is no passive sanity drain. At the same time, it is still possible to effectively use some cursed possessions while in safe areas. For example, the Hanged Man tarot card can kill players even if they are in the truck. *The truck appears to be an Iveco Eurocargo 75E18, with a license plate of 7GHD666. GHD stands for Ghost Huntin' Distribution, the fictional name of the in-game company. 666 is often known as the Number of The Beast. Category:Map Features fr:Camion ru:Фургон
